translated: The person of medium faculties, like a being born spontaneously, should visualize the entire divine wheel simultaneously, in the nature of movement, as empty and of the single taste of compassion, in the nature of the world itself.

original: bzhin gyis grub pa nyid du lhag par mos pa'o zhes so //
analyzed: bzhin gyis grub pa nyid du lhag par mos pa'o zhes so //
translated: The person of sharp faculties, having attained stability through the stage of generation, should enter the stage of completion.

original: ji ltar yang bskyed pa'i rim pa la chos thams cad rang bzhin med par byas pa'i mjug thogs su phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi 'khor lo kho na yam yig la sogs pa las skyes pa rlung la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rim pas rten dang
analyzed: ji ltar yang bskyed pa'i rim pa la chos thams cad rang bzhin med par byas pa'i mjug thogs su phung po dang khams dang skye mched kyi 'khor lo kho na yam yig la sogs pa las skyes pa rlung la sogs pa'i dkyil 'khor gyi rim pas rten dang
translated: In any case, after all phenomena have been made to be essenceless in the creation stage, the wheel of the aggregates, constituents, and sense-spheres are born from the syllable yaṃ and so forth, and the stages of the maṇḍalas of wind and so forth are the different divisions of the support and

original: brten pa'i dbye ba tha dad pa'i lha'i 'khor lo'o //
analyzed: brten pa'i dbye ba tha dad pa'i lha'i 'khor lo'o //
translated: the supported, the wheel of the deity.

original: de bzhin du khams gsum pa'i 'khor lo 'di yang zhig pa'i mjug thogs su rim gyis rdzogs pa'i snod dang sems can gyi 'jig rten @14a * //
analyzed: de bzhin du khams gsum pa'i 'khor lo 'di yang zhig pa'i mjug thogs su rim gyis rdzogs pa'i snod dang sems can gyi 'jig rten @14a * //
translated: Similarly, after the destruction of this wheel of the three realms, the world of the environment and its inhabitants, which is complete in stages,

original: gyi bdag nyid can rten dang brten pa'i 'khor lo'i rang bzhin te /
analyzed: gyi bdag nyid can rten dang brten pa'i 'khor lo'i rang bzhin te /
translated: is the nature of the wheel of the support and the supported,

original: stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa yang ngo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa yang ngo //
translated: and is of one taste with emptiness.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis /
analyzed: 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis /
translated: Āryadeva says:

original: gzhal yas khang pa 'di ni sa gsum ma yin 'di rnams rgyal ba srog chags min //
analyzed: gzhal yas khang pa 'di ni sa gsum ma yin 'di rnams rgyal ba srog chags min //
translated: This celestial mansion is not the three worlds; these are not the victors; these are not living beings.

original: mi min 'di ni 'khor lo'i dbang phyug yul min dbang po ma yin sa sogs min //
analyzed: mi min 'di ni 'khor lo'i dbang phyug yul min dbang po ma yin sa sogs min //
translated: This nonhuman is the lord of the wheel, not the object, not the sense faculty, not the earth, and so on.

original: gzugs la sogs pa yang min chos nyid bdag nyid phyir na de rnams dkyil 'khor pa //
analyzed: gzugs la sogs pa yang min chos nyid bdag nyid phyir na de rnams dkyil 'khor pa //
translated: Since form and so on are the nature of reality, they are the maṇḍala.

original: sna tshogs 'di rnams dkyil 'khor 'khor lo shes par gyis dang sems khyod ci la 'khrul //
analyzed: sna tshogs 'di rnams dkyil 'khor 'khor lo shes par gyis dang sems khyod ci la 'khrul //
translated: Know that this variety is the maṇḍalacakra. Why are you, mind, confused?

original: zhes so // sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang //
analyzed: zhes so // sa ra ha'i zhabs kyis kyang //
translated: The venerable Saraha also says:

original: bud med 'di rnams nyid ni dpal ldan rdo rje btsun mo'i tshogs su shes bya ste //
analyzed: bud med 'di rnams nyid ni dpal ldan rdo rje btsun mo'i tshogs su shes bya ste //
translated: Know that these very women are the assembly of the glorious Vajra Queen.

original: skyes bu 'di rnams nyid ni dpal ldan dkyil 'khor pa rnams zhes par shes par bya //
analyzed: skyes bu 'di rnams nyid ni dpal ldan dkyil 'khor pa rnams zhes par shes par bya //
translated: Know that these very men are the glorious maṇḍala deities.

original: rang lus de rnams nyid ni dpal chen rdo rje can nyid dag tu shes par bya //
analyzed: rang lus de rnams nyid ni dpal chen rdo rje can nyid dag tu shes par bya //
translated: Know that these very bodies are the glorious Vajrasattva.

original: de ltar khyed cag 'gro ba'i zlos gar 'di ni rang bzhin gyis grub 'od gsal lo //
analyzed: de ltar khyed cag 'gro ba'i zlos gar 'di ni rang bzhin gyis grub 'od gsal lo //
translated: Thus, this drama of migrating beings is naturally luminous.

original: zhes pa'o // 'di dag kyang rtul po la sogs pa'i dbye bas gcig gi yang goms pa 'jug pa'i rim pas 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // 'di dag kyang rtul po la sogs pa'i dbye bas gcig gi yang goms pa 'jug pa'i rim pas 'gyur te /
translated: These are also differentiated by the categories of dull and so forth, and the one is also transformed by the process of engaging in cultivation.

original: gcig nyid kyi gnas skabs kyis phye ba'i byis pa la sogs ba bzhin no //
analyzed: gcig nyid kyi gnas skabs kyis phye ba'i byis pa la sogs ba bzhin no //
translated: It is like the case of the child and so forth, differentiated by the state of being one.

original: gang zag gi dbye ba tha dad pa yang gang zag tha dad par gsal ba'i byis pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: gang zag gi dbye ba tha dad pa yang gang zag tha dad par gsal ba'i byis pa la sogs pa bzhin no //
translated: The differentiation of the person is also like the case of the child and so forth, differentiated by the distinct person.

original: 'on kyang rtul po dang 'bring po dag gis kyang mnyam gzhag med pa'i gnas skabs su rnal 'byor 'di dmigs par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yang /
analyzed: 'on kyang rtul po dang 'bring po dag gis kyang mnyam gzhag med pa'i gnas skabs su rnal 'byor 'di dmigs par bya'o zhes gsungs pa yang /
translated: However, it is said that even the dull and middling should take this yoga as an object in the state of non-equipoise.

original: mnyam par ma bzhag rnal 'byor gyis //
analyzed: mnyam par ma bzhag rnal 'byor gyis //
translated: The yoga of non-equipoise

original: thams cad sangs rgyas rang bzhin bsgom //
analyzed: thams cad sangs rgyas rang bzhin bsgom //
translated: meditates on all as having the nature of Buddha.

original: zhes so // de dag nyid ston pa /
analyzed: zhes so // de dag nyid ston pa /
translated: Those very [yogas] are taught.

original: rnon po'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rnon po'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The sharp one, and so forth.

original: ji ltar de dag rim pas dmigs pa ma yin zhe na /
analyzed: ji ltar de dag rim pas dmigs pa ma yin zhe na /
translated: How are they not objects of meditation in sequence?

original: gsungs pa / skad cig ces pa la sogs pas te mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / skad cig ces pa la sogs pas te mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: It is said, in a moment, and so forth, the brief teaching.

original: rgyas par ston pa khams gsum zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rgyas par ston pa khams gsum zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The extensive explanation is “the three realms” and so forth.

original: aom a'a: h'um zhes sngags kyis zhes pa khams gsum pa bsdus pa'i don gyis sku dang gsung dang thugs su mngon par brjod par bya zhing de dang dbyer med pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa'i lus dang ngag dang sems rnams kho na dkyil 'khor ro //
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um zhes sngags kyis zhes pa khams gsum pa bsdus pa'i don gyis sku dang gsung dang thugs su mngon par brjod par bya zhing de dang dbyer med pa'i phyir rnal 'byor pa'i lus dang ngag dang sems rnams kho na dkyil 'khor ro //
translated: “With the mantra Oṃ āḥ hūṃ” means that the three realms are to be expressed as body, speech, and mind, by the meaning of the inclusion, and because of being inseparable from that, the yogin’s body, speech, and mind are the maṇḍala.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /🔽mtho ris sa steng sa 'og tu /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa / mtho ris sa steng sa 'og tu /
translated: That is stated:

original: zhes pa mtho ris dang sa steng sa 'og @14b rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: zhes pa mtho ris dang sa steng sa 'og @14b rnams kyi'o //
translated: “in the heavens, on the earth, and below the earth” means in the heavens, on the earth, and below the earth.

original: sngags ni de bzhin nyid kyis so //
analyzed: sngags ni de bzhin nyid kyis so //
translated: The mantra is by suchness.

original: brjod bya ni mngon du byed pa'o //
analyzed: brjod bya ni mngon du byed pa'o //
translated: The expression is the manifestation.

original: 'di dag gi 'bras bu gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di dag gi 'bras bu gsungs pa /
translated: The result of these is stated:

original: thams cad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: thams cad ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “all” and so forth.

original: dpa' bo thams cad mnyam sbyor ba ni gang gi mkha' 'gro ma'i tshogs dang kun du sbyor ba de bzhin du'o //
analyzed: dpa' bo thams cad mnyam sbyor ba ni gang gi mkha' 'gro ma'i tshogs dang kun du sbyor ba de bzhin du'o //
translated: The union of all heroes is the union with the ḍākinīs’ hosts.

original: de'i bde mchog ni bcom ldan 'das dang bcom ldan 'das ma zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de'i bde mchog ni bcom ldan 'das dang bcom ldan 'das ma zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The supreme bliss of that is the Bhagavat and Bhagavatī, it is thought.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde ba'i mchog / ces so //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro bde ba'i mchog / ces so //
translated: The Vajra dakini is the supreme bliss.

original: gang phyir 'byung ba che bde ba //
analyzed: gang phyir 'byung ba che bde ba //
translated: Because the great elements are bliss,

original: de phyir bde ba de nyid min //
analyzed: de phyir bde ba de nyid min //
translated: therefore that bliss is not reality.

original: zhes brtag pa gnyis kyi rgyal por gsungs pa de ni stong pa nyid dang dbyer med pa'i bde ba la dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes brtag pa gnyis kyi rgyal por gsungs pa de ni stong pa nyid dang dbyer med pa'i bde ba la dgongs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That is stated in the King of Contemplations on the Two Truths, because it is intended to refer to the bliss that is inseparable from emptiness.

original: 'di dag nyid rgyas par ston pa khams bzhi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag nyid rgyas par ston pa khams bzhi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Those very [topics] are taught extensively, beginning with the four elements.

original: 'di dag gis sprul pa'i sku gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di dag gis sprul pa'i sku gsungs so //
translated: These [topics] are the speech of the emanation body.

original: gal te rnam pa dang cig shos dag ji ltar dbye ba med ce na /
analyzed: gal te rnam pa dang cig shos dag ji ltar dbye ba med ce na /
translated: If one asks, how are the aspects and the other inseparable?

original: de bzhin nyid ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The suchness... and so forth.

original: yang na khams bzhi dang phung po lnga dang yul drug rnams kyang lha mo thams cad bsdus pa'i gzugs can bcom ldan 'das ma nyid de ye shes ni bcom ldan 'das so //
analyzed: yang na khams bzhi dang phung po lnga dang yul drug rnams kyang lha mo thams cad bsdus pa'i gzugs can bcom ldan 'das ma nyid de ye shes ni bcom ldan 'das so //
translated: Alternatively, the four elements, the five aggregates, and the six objects are all the form of Bhagavatī herself, who is the embodiment of all goddesses. The pristine consciousness is the Bhagavān.

original: de dag tha dad par brtag par mi bya'o //
analyzed: de dag tha dad par brtag par mi bya'o //
translated: They should not be imagined as separate.

original: tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rgyu gsungs pa /
analyzed: tha dad pa ma yin pa'i rgyu gsungs pa /
translated: The reason for their inseparability is stated:

original: de bzhin nyid ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Thusness and so forth.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He declares that very thing:

original: bdag med ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bdag med ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Selfless and so forth.

original: de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid can sna tshogs kho na bdag med ma ste /
analyzed: de bzhin nyid kyi bdag nyid can sna tshogs kho na bdag med ma ste /
translated: The nature of thusness is the variety itself, which is Nairātmya.

original: de yang bde ba chen po dang snying rje chen po'i bdag nyid can rdo rjes 'khyud pa nyid do //
analyzed: de yang bde ba chen po dang snying rje chen po'i bdag nyid can rdo rjes 'khyud pa nyid do //
translated: And that is the nature of great bliss and great compassion, which is Vajra-Empowerment.

original: de dag nye bar bsdus pa zung 'jug ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nye bar bsdus pa zung 'jug ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Their summary is the union, and so forth.

original: de'i phyir lhun gyis grub pa nyid kyis zung 'jug gi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor 'grub ces pa'i don to //
analyzed: de'i phyir lhun gyis grub pa nyid kyis zung 'jug gi rang bzhin gyi dkyil 'khor 'grub ces pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, the natural mandala of union is accomplished by the very spontaneity.

original: gal te rang bzhin gyis 'grub pa la'ang zung 'jug de gang du gsal bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te rang bzhin gyis 'grub pa la'ang zung 'jug de gang du gsal bar 'gyur te /
translated: If it is asked, “In the accomplishment by nature, where is that union clarified?”

original: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam par rtog pas 'khrul pa'i phyir ro zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: It is because of the delusion of various conceptual thoughts.🔽He declares:

original: sems zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: sems zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Mind and so forth.

original: yang na gang grub pa'i gnas skabs su yang zung 'jug 'di'i rnal 'byor pa gang yang rung ste /
analyzed: yang na gang grub pa'i gnas skabs su yang zung 'jug 'di'i rnal 'byor pa gang yang rung ste /
translated: Or, “in whatever situation it is accomplished, that is the union of any yogin or yoginī.

original: 'jug pa dang ldog pa la sogs te 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i bsam pa'i bye brag dang spyod pa'i bye brag rnams kyang rnam par rtog pa yin la /
analyzed: 'jug pa dang ldog pa la sogs te 'jug pa dang ldog pa'i bsam pa'i bye brag dang spyod pa'i bye brag rnams kyang rnam par rtog pa yin la /
translated: The distinctions of the thought of engagement and disengagement, and the distinctions of the conduct, are also conceptualization.

original: de yang zung 'dug gi rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: de yang zung 'dug gi rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: And that is the nature of the union.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: sa ra ha'i zhabs @15a * //
analyzed: sa ra ha'i zhabs @15a * //
translated: By the venerable Saraha:

original: kyis ; / gang du chu la chu ni zhugs gyur pa //
analyzed: kyis ; / gang du chu la chu ni zhugs gyur pa //
translated: Where water enters into water,

original: de ni ro mnyam nyid du 'gyur ba yin //
analyzed: de ni ro mnyam nyid du 'gyur ba yin //
translated: It becomes of the same taste.

original: skyon dang yon tan sems kyi rang bzhin gyis //
analyzed: skyon dang yon tan sems kyi rang bzhin gyis //
translated: Faults and virtues are of the nature of mind.

original: rmongs pa mi mthun phyogs ni gang yang med /
analyzed: rmongs pa mi mthun phyogs ni gang yang med /
translated: There is no other side of confusion.

original: ces so // 'di ltar gang las zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ces so // 'di ltar gang las zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, from what? It is said:🔽In every way, etc.

original: rnam kun zhes pa la sogs te thams cad du rnam pa'i mchog 'di la zhes pa rnam pa kun gyi mchog go //
analyzed: rnam kun zhes pa la sogs te thams cad du rnam pa'i mchog 'di la zhes pa rnam pa kun gyi mchog go //
translated: The supreme of all aspects is here.

original: de ltar gyur kyang de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig pa'i bde ba chen po dmigs pa med pa khong du chud cing thob pa'i dbang po dang rnam pa thams cad mchog tu nye bar mdzes pa bde ba dam pa'i rang bzhin nyid la'ang ji ltar stong pa nyid
analyzed: de ltar gyur kyang de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig pa'i bde ba chen po dmigs pa med pa khong du chud cing thob pa'i dbang po dang rnam pa thams cad mchog tu nye bar mdzes pa bde ba dam pa'i rang bzhin nyid la'ang ji ltar stong pa nyid
translated: Even though that is the case, the one who has the faculty of understanding and attaining the non-apprehended great bliss that is of one taste with suchness, and who is most beautiful with all the supreme aspects, the nature of the highest bliss, is also empty.🔽How is it of one taste with emptiness?

original: dang ro gcig pa nyid ce na gsungs pa /
analyzed: dang ro gcig pa nyid ce na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

original: dngos dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dngos dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The nature of entity and non-entity🔽is the entity that arises constantly.

original: dngos dang dngos med pa'i bdag nyid can ni dngos po byas nas rtag tu 'byung ba der 'gyur ro zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: dngos dang dngos med pa'i bdag nyid can ni dngos po byas nas rtag tu 'byung ba der 'gyur ro zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: The nature of entity and non-entity is the entity that arises constantly.

original: 'di dag ji ltar bya zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di dag ji ltar bya zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How are these done? It is said:🔽Without superimposition,

original: sgro ma btags zhes pa la sogs pa'i sgro btags ni 'di kho na zhes lhag par zhen pa ste /
analyzed: sgro ma btags zhes pa la sogs pa'i sgro btags ni 'di kho na zhes lhag par zhen pa ste /
translated: superimposition is the excessive attachment to “this is just this.”

original: de gang la med pa de bzhin du de'o //
analyzed: de gang la med pa de bzhin du de'o //
translated: That which is free from that is just that.

original: yid la byed pa ni rnam par rtog pa ste //
analyzed: yid la byed pa ni rnam par rtog pa ste //
translated: Mental activity is conceptualization.

original: 'di ni de ltar yin gyi 'di ltar ma yin zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di ni de ltar yin gyi 'di ltar ma yin zhes pa'o //
translated: This is so, not like this.

original: de med pa'i phyir yid la mi byed pa'o //
analyzed: de med pa'i phyir yid la mi byed pa'o //
translated: Because of the absence of that, there is no mental activity.

original: sgro 'dogs dang yid la byed pa dag kho nas dngos po dang dngos po med pa 'di dag tha dad par rnam par gzhag go zhes pa'o //
analyzed: sgro 'dogs dang yid la byed pa dag kho nas dngos po dang dngos po med pa 'di dag tha dad par rnam par gzhag go zhes pa'o //
translated: It is just by superimposition and mental activity that these entities and non-entities are established as different.

original: ngo bo nyid du na rtag pa'i chos sku dang rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid las de 'byung ste khyab pa nyid kyi bde ba chen po yang ngo //
analyzed: ngo bo nyid du na rtag pa'i chos sku dang rtag pa'i ngo bo nyid las de 'byung ste khyab pa nyid kyi bde ba chen po yang ngo //
translated: In reality, it arises from the Dharma Body of permanence and the nature of permanence, and is the pervasion itself of great bliss.

original: 'di dag nyid rgyas par ston pa skye ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste skyes pa'i dngos po kho na mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa ltar don dam par ma skyes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag nyid rgyas par ston pa skye ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste skyes pa'i dngos po kho na mgal me'i 'khor lo la sogs pa ltar don dam par ma skyes pa'o //
translated: These are taught extensively in the lines beginning with “arisen,” and so forth. The entity that is arisen is, like the circle of a whirling firebrand, ultimately non-arisen.

original: 'di dag gis longs spyod rdzogs pa'i rang bzhin gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di dag gis longs spyod rdzogs pa'i rang bzhin gsungs so //
translated: These lines teach the nature of the Enjoyment Body.

original: 'od gsal ba nyid mdor bstan pa /
analyzed: 'od gsal ba nyid mdor bstan pa /
translated: The clear light itself is taught in brief:

original: bems po min phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bems po min phyir zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Because it is not an insentient entity,” and so forth.

original: bems po'i don las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin nyid las so //
analyzed: bems po'i don las bzlog pa'i rang bzhin nyid las so //
translated: The nature itself is the opposite of the meaning of an insentient entity.

original: shes par bya min zhes yid kyi rnam par rtog pa thams cad nub pa'i rang bzhin nyid las so //
analyzed: shes par bya min zhes yid kyi rnam par rtog pa thams cad nub pa'i rang bzhin nyid las so //
translated: From the nature of the disappearance of all mental processes, which are not to be known.

original: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i bgrod bya ma yin pa nyid las mthong bya min pa'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa'i dbang po'i bgrod bya ma yin pa nyid las mthong bya min pa'o //
translated: Not to be seen is because of not being the domain of the sense faculties such as the eyes.

original: yang na gang kun gzhi dang nyon mongs pa'i yid kyis so //
analyzed: yang na gang kun gzhi dang nyon mongs pa'i yid kyis so //
translated: Or else, it is because of the alaya and the afflicted mind.

original: rnam par shes pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug rnams kyis nye bar dmigs pa ma yin @15b pa'i phyir rim pas tshig gnyis so //
analyzed: rnam par shes pa dang 'jug pa'i rnam par shes pa drug rnams kyis nye bar dmigs pa ma yin @15b pa'i phyir rim pas tshig gnyis so //
translated: The two phrases in order are because it is not the object of the consciousnesses and because it is not the object of the six engaging consciousnesses.

original: gal te de dngos po'am dngos po med pa yin /
analyzed: gal te de dngos po'am dngos po med pa yin /
translated: If it is an entity or a nonentity,

original: dngos po yin na'ang rtag pa'am mi rtag pa yin /
analyzed: dngos po yin na'ang rtag pa'am mi rtag pa yin /
translated: if it is an entity, it is either permanent or impermanent.🔽If it is a permanent entity, it would have continuity, and if it is impermanent, it would be inconsistent before and after.

original: dngos po rtag pa nyid na rgyun dang ldan par 'gyur zhing mi rtag pa nyid la ni snga ma dang phyi ma mi mthun par 'gyur ro zhes pa de dag spong ba /
analyzed: dngos po rtag pa nyid na rgyun dang ldan par 'gyur zhing mi rtag pa nyid la ni snga ma dang phyi ma mi mthun par 'gyur ro zhes pa de dag spong ba /
translated: To reject those, it is said,

original: gzugs med ces pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs med ces pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “formless,” and so on.

original: rnam pa'i 'khor lo nye bar dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rnam pa'i 'khor lo nye bar dmigs pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the wheel of aspects is not observed.

original: gar mi gnas zhes pa snga ma dang phyi ma ma zhig pa dbyug pa lta bu mi ldan pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gar mi gnas zhes pa snga ma dang phyi ma ma zhig pa dbyug pa lta bu mi ldan pa'i phyir zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of not abiding in a place is that it is not like a stick, which does not disintegrate before and after.

original: gzugs can rtag pa ni dngos po tshogs pa la gnas pa rtag par 'gyur la /
analyzed: gzugs can rtag pa ni dngos po tshogs pa la gnas pa rtag par 'gyur la /
translated: A permanent entity would be permanent in the sense of abiding in the collection of things.

original: de dag kyang mi srid de dngos po rnams skad cig 'jig pa nyid las so //
analyzed: de dag kyang mi srid de dngos po rnams skad cig 'jig pa nyid las so //
translated: But that is impossible, because things are momentary.

original: 'o na ji ltar rtag pa yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'o na ji ltar rtag pa yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Well, then, how is it permanent? It is said:

original: rnam 'gyur med phyir zhes pa ji srid nam mkha' rnam par 'gyur ba mi ston pa bzhin no //
analyzed: rnam 'gyur med phyir zhes pa ji srid nam mkha' rnam par 'gyur ba mi ston pa bzhin no //
translated: Because it is without manifestation, just as space does not manifest any manifestation.

original: des na dngos po med par 'gyur ro zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: des na dngos po med par 'gyur ro zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Well, then, it would be a non-entity? It is said:

original: kun rdzob ces pa la sogs pa ste 'khor ba ji srid par gnas pa dang / kun rdzob tu skye ba 'byung ba'i phyir chad pa yang mi srid do //
analyzed: kun rdzob ces pa la sogs pa ste 'khor ba ji srid par gnas pa dang / kun rdzob tu skye ba 'byung ba'i phyir chad pa yang mi srid do //
translated: Conventionally, and so on. As long as there is cyclic existence, it abides, and because it arises conventionally, it is not possible that it is annihilated.

original: 'on kyang chos rnams thams cad kyi gdod ma nas grub pa'i rang bzhin 'di kho na ste rang bzhin gzhan gyis dngos por 'gyur ba med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang chos rnams thams cad kyi gdod ma nas grub pa'i rang bzhin 'di kho na ste rang bzhin gzhan gyis dngos por 'gyur ba med do //
translated: However, this is the primordial nature of all phenomena, and it is not possible that it becomes an entity by some other nature.

original: de nyid gsungs pa lhan cig skyes zhes pa la sogs pa ste chos rnams kyis ma byas pa'i rang bzhin la lhan cig skyes pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa lhan cig skyes zhes pa la sogs pa ste chos rnams kyis ma byas pa'i rang bzhin la lhan cig skyes pa zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: That is taught by “coemergent,” etc. The nature that is not made by phenomena should be called “coemergent.”

original: de yang 'jig rten mtha' dag las 'das pa mchog tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: de yang 'jig rten mtha' dag las 'das pa mchog tu dga' ba'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Moreover, it is beyond the whole world, the nature of supreme joy.

original: yang na de ni chos rnams thams cad kyi lhan cig skyes te ming gzhan 'od gsal ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de ni chos rnams thams cad kyi lhan cig skyes te ming gzhan 'od gsal ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: Or, it is the coemergent of all phenomena, with another name, “clear light,” etc.🔽The nature of coemergent joy

original: lhan cig skyes dga'i rang bzhin dang // zhes pa lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin nyid bla ma'i bka' drin las gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: lhan cig skyes dga'i rang bzhin dang // zhes pa lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'i rang bzhin nyid bla ma'i bka' drin las gsal bar 'gyur ro zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: is clarified by the kindness of the guru.🔽This is because it is “self-consecration” and “self-arisen,”

original: 'di ni / rang byin brlab dang rang 'byung dang // zhes pa rang nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ro //🔽gzhom du med cing zhes pa rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'o ;
analyzed: 'di ni / rang byin brlab dang rang 'byung dang // zhes pa rang nyid la gnas pa'i phyir ro // gzhom du med cing zhes pa rnam par 'gyur ba med pa'o ;
translated: and it “abides in oneself.”🔽It is “indestructible,” because it is unchanging.

original: /'jig med pa zhes pa rtag pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: /'jig med pa zhes pa rtag pa'i phyir ro //
translated: It is “imperishable,” because it is permanent.

original: gal te rnam par rtog pas nye bar dmigs pa med pa'i rang bzhin bde ba chen po ji ltar bsgom zhing ma bsgoms na yang mngon sum du mi 'gyur ro zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: gal te rnam par rtog pas nye bar dmigs pa med pa'i rang bzhin bde ba chen po ji ltar bsgom zhing ma bsgoms na yang mngon sum du mi 'gyur ro zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: If one asks, “How can one meditate on the nature of great bliss, which is not an object of conceptualization, and if one does not meditate, how can it be realized?”🔽[The Bhagavān] declares,

original: skye ba med pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: skye ba med pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “unborn,” and so on.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: He declares that:

original: @16a * // gang tshe skye ba spangs pa yis //
analyzed: @16a * // gang tshe skye ba spangs pa yis //
translated: When, by abandoning birth,

original: skye med de nyid blo gros kyang //
analyzed: skye med de nyid blo gros kyang //
translated: the mind also is unborn,

original: de yis rnam par brten pa las //
analyzed: de yis rnam par brten pa las //
translated: then, by the support of that,

original: de tshe de nyid 'di rtogs bzhin //🔽zhes so // gsungs pa'i gtan tshigs nyid bstan par byed pa /
analyzed: de tshe de nyid 'di rtogs bzhin // zhes so // gsungs pa'i gtan tshigs nyid bstan par byed pa /
translated: at that time, that reality is realized.

analyzed: shes rab nyid ces pa la sogs pa ste chos thams cad rang bzhin med par 'dzin pa'i blo ni shes rab po //
translated: The reason stated is taught by “wisdom,” and so on. The mind that apprehends all phenomena as lacking intrinsic nature is wisdom.

original: de nyid bsam gtan te de dang ro gcig pa nyid kyis gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid bsam gtan te de dang ro gcig pa nyid kyis gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: That itself is meditative concentration, because it is the state of being of one taste with that.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He declares that:

analyzed: chos kun zhes pa la sogs pa ste gang gi'am gang gis chos thams cad yongs su shes pa de bzhin du ste ma ning ngo //
translated: “All phenomena” and so forth. Just as that which is known as all phenomena, in the same way, that is, as neuter,

original: 'di nyid bde chen mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ste /
analyzed: 'di nyid bde chen mngon par rdzogs par byang chub ste /
translated: this very one is manifestly and completely enlightened as great bliss.

original: nam mkha'i khams mtha' dag khyab pa thun mong pa rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: nam mkha'i khams mtha' dag khyab pa thun mong pa rgyun mi 'chad pa nyid dang ldan pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because it is endowed with the common, uninterrupted pervasion of the entire realm of space.

original: yang na de chen po yang yin la bde ba yang ste lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
analyzed: yang na de chen po yang yin la bde ba yang ste lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba'o //
translated: Or else, that is great and also bliss, that is, the connate joy.

analyzed: de'i mngon du phyogs pas yang dag par rdzogs pa'i byang chub thob par 'gyur ba 'di'i zhes pa de'i skyes bu'i drug pa'o //
translated: Because it is directed toward that, one attains perfect complete enlightenment. This is the sixth case, the genitive, of that person.

original: gal te ji ltar chos kyi rang bzhin de rnams las phye nas nye bar bstan zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: gal te ji ltar chos kyi rang bzhin de rnams las phye nas nye bar bstan zhes gsungs pa /
translated: If it is asked, “How is that nature of phenomena taught as differentiated from them?”

original: chos zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [The Bhagavān] declares phenomena and so forth.

original: chos rnams kyi'am yang na chos kho na de nyid de /
analyzed: chos rnams kyi'am yang na chos kho na de nyid de /
translated: The phenomena are those of all phenomena, or it is just those phenomena themselves.

original: chos kyi sgras kyang chos nyid mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: chos kyi sgras kyang chos nyid mngon par brjod pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because the term “phenomena” also expresses the intrinsic nature of phenomena.

analyzed: de la 'jug pa ni de rim gyis rtogs pa'i don du ste ngo bo nyid du na dbye ba med pa kho na'o //
translated: Entering that is for the purpose of gradually realizing that, which is only non-different in terms of its nature.

analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

analyzed: bden pa gnyis po de dag zung 'jug ldan //

analyzed: zhes so // de'i phyir 'jig rten pa'i yang dga' ba la sogs pa la 'di kho nas khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, since this is pervaded by the mundane joys and so forth,🔽these

analyzed: 'di dag gis / rgyu la 'bras bus rgyas gdab cing //
translated: are stated:🔽The cause is sealed by the result,

translated: and the result is sealed by the cause.

original: gzhan du bsgoms na dngos grub ni //
analyzed: gzhan du bsgoms na dngos grub ni //
translated: If one meditates otherwise,

analyzed: bskal pa bye bar 'byung mi 'gyur // zhes pa de brjod do //
translated: accomplishment will not occur in ten million eons.🔽How are these to be realized?

analyzed: 'di dag ji ltar rtogs par bya zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: It is said:

analyzed: bla ma dam pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “The sublime guru…” and so on.

original: bla ma dam pa'i gdams ngag las kyang 'di dag gar du gsal bar 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: bla ma dam pa'i gdams ngag las kyang 'di dag gar du gsal bar 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If it is asked from what instructions of the sublime guru these

analyzed: bde mchog ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: appear, it is the Cakrasaṃvara and so on.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /

analyzed: ae yig cha byad bzang po gang //

analyzed: yang na ae yig shes rab kyi bdag nyid sprul pa dang longs spyod rdzogs pa'i sku 'khor lo'i rang bzhin lte ba dang mgrin pa la bam yig thabs kyi bdag nyid chos thams cad bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i rang bzhin nyid snying ga dang spyi bo'i gnas
translated: Alternatively, the letter e, which is the nature of wisdom, is the emanation and enjoyment bodies, the nature of the cakra at the navel and throat. The letter vam, which is the nature of method, is the nature of the cakra of great bliss of all phenomena at the heart and head.🔽

original: kyis kha sbyar ba bsgoms na lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: kyis kha sbyar ba bsgoms na lhan cig skyes pa'i dga' ba 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Or else, if one meditates on the letter A, which is the nature of wisdom, and the letter Bam, which is the nature of method, as united at the navel and throat, which are the nature of the emanation and enjoyment bodies, and at the heart and head, which are the nature of the wheel of great bliss of all phenomena, then coemergent bliss will arise.

original: yang na ae yig de bzhin nyid la bam yig sems rab tu zhugs na ji ltar gsungs pa ltar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na ae yig de bzhin nyid la bam yig sems rab tu zhugs na ji ltar gsungs pa ltar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Or else, if the mind enters the letter A, which is suchness, and the letter Bam, then it will be as taught.

analyzed: de gsungs pa /

translated: the innate
