translated: Because in the world, that kind is impossible.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is said:

original: de phyir bsod nams phung po bsags pa'i sku gang 'ga' zhig de ni phyogs gcig pa //
analyzed: de phyir bsod nams phung po bsags pa'i sku gang 'ga' zhig de ni phyogs gcig pa //
translated: Therefore, I pay homage to those who have accumulated the body of merit, who are in one place,

original: phyag rgya'i 'khrig la yid ni g-yo med grub pa de rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
analyzed: phyag rgya'i 'khrig la yid ni g-yo med grub pa de rnams la phyag 'tshal lo //
translated: Whose minds are unmoving in the embrace of the consort, and who have accomplished that.

original: zhes pa'o // gal te snga ma dang phyi ma dag ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // gal te snga ma dang phyi ma dag ji ltar mi 'gal zhe na /
translated: If it is asked how the former and latter are not contradictory,

original: ma yin te snga mas ni 'gyur ba'i bde ba kho na smad pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ma yin te snga mas ni 'gyur ba'i bde ba kho na smad pa'i phyir ro //
translated: it is not so, because the former is only a criticism of the bliss of change.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /🔽zla ba rdo rje la 'phos slar yang 'di ni dgos pa ci yang med //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa / zla ba rdo rje la 'phos slar yang 'di ni dgos pa ci yang med //
translated: That is stated:

original: ces pa ste /
analyzed: ces pa ste /
translated: The moon has been transferred to the vajra, and again there is no purpose.

original: mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba la ltos nas ni ma yin no //
analyzed: mi 'gyur ba'i bde ba la ltos nas ni ma yin no //
translated: It is not in relation to unchanging bliss.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: de phyir 'gyur med bde ba kho na skye bor nams kyis shin tu 'bad pas bsten //
analyzed: de phyir 'gyur med bde ba kho na skye bor nams kyis shin tu 'bad pas bsten //
translated: Therefore, unchanging bliss alone is to be served with great effort by all people.

original: de la yun ring gnas nas mnyam par gzhag pa'i de nyid skyes pa slar yang zung //
analyzed: de la yun ring gnas nas mnyam par gzhag pa'i de nyid skyes pa slar yang zung //
translated: Having remained there for a long time, the reality of equipoise arises again.

original: zhes so // yang na gang 'dod pa snga ma ni rgyu las 'bras bur mngon par zhen pa bzlog pa'i phyir dang / phyi ma ni rgyu bstan pa'i don du'o zhes pa ste 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: zhes so // yang na gang 'dod pa snga ma ni rgyu las 'bras bur mngon par zhen pa bzlog pa'i phyir dang / phyi ma ni rgyu bstan pa'i don du'o zhes pa ste 'gal ba med do //
translated: Or, the former is in order to reverse the conception of the result from the cause, and the latter is for the sake of teaching the cause, so there is no contradiction.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de yang lhan cig skyes pa zhes brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de yang lhan cig skyes pa zhes brjod par bya ste /
translated: For that very reason, that is also to be called “innate.”

original: de ltar thabs dang bcas par goms par byas na 'dis 'jig rten las 'das pa thob pa'i phyir ro //🔽de ltar yang mngon par 'dod pa'i lha mo'i gzugs su skye ba'i las kyi phyag rgya'am ;
analyzed: de ltar thabs dang bcas par goms par byas na 'dis 'jig rten las 'das pa thob pa'i phyir ro // de ltar yang mngon par 'dod pa'i lha mo'i gzugs su skye ba'i las kyi phyag rgya'am ;
translated: If one is accustomed to that along with the method, then one attains the supramundane.🔽Thus, one should cultivate the yoga of one’s own excellent deity, who is embraced by either a karma consort or a gnosis consort in the form of a goddess who is the object of one’s desire.

original: yang na ye shes kyi phyag rgyas 'khyud pa rang gi lhag pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas dpe las byung ba'i bde ba de nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa dang kha sbyor dang bde ba chen po dang rang bzhin med pa dang snying rje dang rgyun chad med
analyzed: yang na ye shes kyi phyag rgyas 'khyud pa rang gi lhag pa'i lha'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pas dpe las byung ba'i bde ba de nyid longs spyod rdzogs pa dang kha sbyor dang bde ba chen po dang rang bzhin med pa dang snying rje dang rgyun chad med
translated: One should cultivate the yoga endowed with the seven aspects, which is described as the bliss that arises from the example, the union of the enjoyment body, great bliss, the absence of intrinsic existence, compassion,🔽the absence of a break, and the absence of cessation.

original: pa dang 'gag pa med par brjod pa ni yan lag @17b bdun dang ldan pa bsgom par bya zhing 'jig rten las 'das par rdzogs par bya'o zhes pa man ngag go //
analyzed: pa dang 'gag pa med par brjod pa ni yan lag @17b bdun dang ldan pa bsgom par bya zhing 'jig rten las 'das par rdzogs par bya'o zhes pa man ngag go //
translated: One should complete the supramundane [yoga].

original: 'on kyang ye shes kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa snyoms par 'jug pa yang bsgom pa mthar thug pa nas las kyi phyag rgya'i snyoms par 'jug pa kho na phul du byung zhing mthar thug pa'i thabs su 'gyur ro zhes bla ma rnams so //
analyzed: 'on kyang ye shes kyi phyag rgya la sogs pa snyoms par 'jug pa yang bsgom pa mthar thug pa nas las kyi phyag rgya'i snyoms par 'jug pa kho na phul du byung zhing mthar thug pa'i thabs su 'gyur ro zhes bla ma rnams so //
translated: However, the meditative cultivation of the union with the gnosis consort and so forth is the supreme and ultimate method, the union with the karma consort, from the ultimate meditative cultivation.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus, the Gurus.

original: rdo rje snying po'i dbang bskur sbyin //
analyzed: rdo rje snying po'i dbang bskur sbyin //
translated: The consecration of the vajra essence

original: thig le mchog nyid bkug pa nyid //
analyzed: thig le mchog nyid bkug pa nyid //
translated: is the supreme drop itself, the summoning.

original: ces pa ste zhar la 'ongs pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa ste zhar la 'ongs pa'o //
translated: This is a digression.

original: skabs su 'bab pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: skabs su 'bab pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, what is relevant should be stated.

original: gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pa rkang pa gnyis kyi bzhi pa ste /
analyzed: gsang ba zhes pa la sogs pa rkang pa gnyis kyi bzhi pa ste /
translated: The fourth line of the two lines beginning with “secret”

original: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhes pa phung po rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas thams cad kyi zhes pa phung po rnams kyi'o //
translated: “of all the Buddhas” is of the aggregates.

original: 'dus pa ni ro gcig tu gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'dus pa ni ro gcig tu gyur pa'o //
translated: The “assembly” is the single taste.

original: 'di thams cad ni bla ma'i bka' drin kho nas rtogs par nus zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir slar gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di thams cad ni bla ma'i bka' drin kho nas rtogs par nus zhes bstan par bya ba'i phyir slar gsungs pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate that all of this can be understood only through the kindness of the Guru, it is stated again:

original: rang byin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rang byin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “self-consecration” and so forth.

original: le'u gsum pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u gsum pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: Chapter Three

original: // / zhu pa gsum pa'i lan gdab pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / zhu pa gsum pa'i lan gdab pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: The reply to the third request is stated:

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Then, etc.

original: gang zhes pa la brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can gyis dngos po gang yin pa de dang de rnams thams cad ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin te gnas so zhes pa'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
analyzed: gang zhes pa la brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i bdag nyid can gyis dngos po gang yin pa de dang de rnams thams cad ni 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i rang bzhin te gnas so zhes pa'i tshig gi lhag ma'o //
translated: Whatever means whatever things that have the nature of the animate and inanimate world, all of them abide in the nature of the four great elements. The rest of the sentence is understood.

original: de rnams kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de rnams kyang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Those are also twofold,

original: phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi dbye ba las so //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi dbye ba las so //
translated: from the point of view of the division into outer and inner.

original: de la de rnams gnyis ka'i thun mong du las dang rang bzhin yang gsungs pa sa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de la de rnams gnyis ka'i thun mong du las dang rang bzhin yang gsungs pa sa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: There, the function and nature of those are also stated in common for both, with the words earth, etc.

original: de la zhes pa de rnams la'o //
analyzed: de la zhes pa de rnams la'o //
translated: There means in those.

original: sa zhes pa sa'i'o //
analyzed: sa zhes pa sa'i'o //
translated: Earth is of the earth.

original: yang na sa nyid de dngos po gang 'ga' zhig srab dang mkhregs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
analyzed: yang na sa nyid de dngos po gang 'ga' zhig srab dang mkhregs pa la sogs pa'i mtshan nyid rnams so //
translated: Or, earth itself is any thing whatsoever that has the characteristics of solidity, hardness, etc.

original: 'dis ni sa'i mtshan nyid las 'dzin pa dang rang bzhin srab yang ngo //
analyzed: 'dis ni sa'i mtshan nyid las 'dzin pa dang rang bzhin srab yang ngo //
translated: This shows the characteristic of earth as bearing and its nature as solidity.

original: me yis thams cad du 'tshed do //
analyzed: me yis thams cad du 'tshed do //
translated: Fire cooks everything.

original: zhes pa 'dis me'i rang bzhin dro ba dang byed las smin par byed pa yang ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa 'dis me'i rang bzhin dro ba dang byed las smin par byed pa yang ngo //
translated: This shows the nature of fire as heat and its function as ripening.

original: chu yis 'ju bar byed pa yin //
analyzed: chu yis 'ju bar byed pa yin //
translated: Water moistens.

original: zhes pa chu'i rang bzhin gsher ba nyid dang byed las sdud par byed pa yang ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa chu'i rang bzhin gsher ba nyid dang byed las sdud par byed pa yang ngo //
translated: This shows the nature of water as fluidity and its function as cohesion.

original: rlung gis lhan cig bskyod par byed //
analyzed: rlung gis lhan cig bskyod par byed //
translated: Wind moves in unison.

original: ces pa rlung gi rang bzhin g-yo ba dang byed las bskyod par byed pa yang ngo //
analyzed: ces pa rlung gi rang bzhin g-yo ba dang byed las bskyod par byed pa yang ngo //
translated: This shows the nature of wind as motility and its function as movement.🔽Space is the domain.

original: nam mkha'i yul zhes pa thog mar de'i rang bzhin stong pa dang byed las go skabs 'byed pa yang ngo //
analyzed: nam mkha'i yul zhes pa thog mar de'i rang bzhin stong pa dang byed las go skabs 'byed pa yang ngo //
translated: This shows the nature of space as emptiness and its function as providing room.

original: de nyid gsungs @18a * //🔽pa ; stong par gnas pa des ni skye //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs @18a * // pa ; stong par gnas pa des ni skye //
translated: The same text says:🔽Things arise in that which is empty.

original: zhes pa stong par gnas pa la dngos po thams cad skye bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: zhes pa stong par gnas pa la dngos po thams cad skye bar 'gyur te /
translated: All things arise in that which is empty.🔽Therefore,

original: des na zhes pa go skabs sbyin pa'i gtan tshigs 'dis so //
analyzed: des na zhes pa go skabs sbyin pa'i gtan tshigs 'dis so //
translated: by this reason of providing room,

original: de nyid kyi phyir nam mkha' ni 'byung ba chen po ma yin no //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir nam mkha' ni 'byung ba chen po ma yin no //
translated: Therefore, space is not a great element.

original: 'on kyang rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir khams nyid dang sa la sogs pa bzhi po kho na 'byung ba chen po rnams so zhes pa mdor bstan pa'i tshig rgyas par ston pa 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: 'on kyang rang gi mtshan nyid 'dzin pa'i phyir khams nyid dang sa la sogs pa bzhi po kho na 'byung ba chen po rnams so zhes pa mdor bstan pa'i tshig rgyas par ston pa 'gal ba med do //
translated: However, because it holds its own characteristics, it is an element. Only the four such as earth are the great elements. There is no contradiction with the words of the brief presentation.

original: gal te 'di rnams kyi mtshan nyid rang las grub pa'am ma yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: gal te 'di rnams kyi mtshan nyid rang las grub pa'am ma yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: If the characteristics of these are established from themselves or not, it is said:

original: gang du zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dis phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa brtags pa tsam gyi bdag nyid can nyid gsungs so //
analyzed: gang du zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'dis phan tshun ltos pa dang bcas pa brtags pa tsam gyi bdag nyid can nyid gsungs so //
translated: “Where?” and so on. This teaches that they have the nature of mere imputation, mutually dependent.

original: gsungs pa'i don nges par byed pa rtsa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gsungs pa'i don nges par byed pa rtsa zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The meaning of what is said is ascertained by the root text.

original: rtsa la sogs pa snod kyi 'jig rten gyi 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kho na'o //
analyzed: rtsa la sogs pa snod kyi 'jig rten gyi 'byung ba chen po bzhi rnams kho na'o //
translated: The four great elements of the world of the environment such as the roots and so on are only the four great elements.

original: bems po rnam par shes pa tsam //
analyzed: bems po rnam par shes pa tsam //
translated: Inanimate and consciousness only.

original: zhes pa'i tshig gi don gnyis kho na ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig gi don gnyis kho na ste /
translated: There are only two topics of the words.

original: bems po dang bems po ma yin pa'i dbye ba las so //
analyzed: bems po dang bems po ma yin pa'i dbye ba las so //
translated: From the division of the insentient and the sentient.

original: de nyid kyi phyir tsam zhes pa lhag ma'i don sel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir tsam zhes pa lhag ma'i don sel bar byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, the meaning of “only” is to eliminate the remainder.

original: yang na tshig gi don ni rab tu gsal ba tsam gyi bdag nyid las bems po yang rnam par shes pa nyid do //
analyzed: yang na tshig gi don ni rab tu gsal ba tsam gyi bdag nyid las bems po yang rnam par shes pa nyid do //
translated: Or, the meaning of the word is that the nature of mere clarity is also consciousness, even in the insentient.

original: 'gro ba drug po zhes pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi po zhes pa snga ma dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: 'gro ba drug po zhes pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi po zhes pa snga ma dang 'brel lo //
translated: The six types of beings, the four great elements, etc., are connected with the previous.

original: de ltar na sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten du ji ltar dbye zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ltar na sems can dang snod kyi 'jig rten du ji ltar dbye zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: Thus, how is it divided into the world of sentient beings and the world of the environment? It is said:

original: rnam shes dang ni lhan cig 'jug / ces pa gang rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa de rnams ni sems can du rnam par gzhag par bya'o /
analyzed: rnam shes dang ni lhan cig 'jug / ces pa gang rnam par shes pa dang lhan cig 'jug pa de rnams ni sems can du rnam par gzhag par bya'o /
translated: “It operates together with consciousness.” Whatever operates together with consciousness should be posited as sentient beings.

original: de nyid gsungs pa des na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa des na zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: That is stated: “Therefore, etc.”

original: des na zhes pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i sbyor ba yis so //
analyzed: des na zhes pa 'byung ba chen po bzhi'i sbyor ba yis so //
translated: “Therefore” means by the combination of the four great elements.

original: kun la zhes pa 'gro ba thams cad la lus kyi gong bur 'gyur ro zhes pa srid pa'i dngos po blo dang ldan pas shes par bya'o //
analyzed: kun la zhes pa 'gro ba thams cad la lus kyi gong bur 'gyur ro zhes pa srid pa'i dngos po blo dang ldan pas shes par bya'o //
translated: “To all” means to all migrating beings. The intelligent one should know the nature of existence.

original: thams cad kyi tshe'i 'byung ba bzhi'i rang bzhin nyid la sems can rnams kyi 'chi ba la sogs pa 'gyur ba ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: thams cad kyi tshe'i 'byung ba bzhi'i rang bzhin nyid la sems can rnams kyi 'chi ba la sogs pa 'gyur ba ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is it that the death, etc., of sentient beings is due to the nature of the four elements at all times? It is said:

original: 'chi sogs rnams la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'chi sogs rnams la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “In death, etc.,” and so on.

original: bskyod byed ces pa bskyod do zhes pa'i don to //🔽yan lag nyid lag thams cad la //
analyzed: bskyod byed ces pa bskyod do zhes pa'i don to // yan lag nyid lag thams cad la //
translated: “Agitator” means “agitates.”

original: zhes pa thams cad du lus thams cad dang yan lag thams cad @18b la 'gro ste /
analyzed: zhes pa thams cad du lus thams cad dang yan lag thams cad @18b la 'gro ste /
translated: “To all the limbs and all the parts of the body” means that it goes everywhere, to the whole body and all the parts of the body.

original: gang gi tshe rlung bskyod pa de'i tshe tshor ba med par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gang gi tshe rlung bskyod pa de'i tshe tshor ba med par 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: When the wind agitates, then there is no sensation. This is the meaning.

original: skabs nye bar sdud pa skye ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: skabs nye bar sdud pa skye ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The summary is stated: “Birth,” and so on.

original: 'byung ba thams cad 'gro zhes pa 'byung ba rnams ni thams cad du 'gro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'byung ba thams cad 'gro zhes pa 'byung ba rnams ni thams cad du 'gro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “All the elements go” means that the elements go everywhere. This is the meaning.

original: thams cad du 'gro ba nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: thams cad du 'gro ba nyid gsungs pa /
translated: It is said that they go everywhere.

original: lha zhes ba la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: lha zhes ba la sogs pa ste /
translated: The gods, etc.,🔽are not without the elements.

original: 'byung ba med par min zhes pa 'byung ba rnams kyis mnan na gang yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba med par min zhes pa 'byung ba rnams kyis mnan na gang yang skye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: The meaning is that if they are pressed down by the elements, nothing will arise.

original: de nyid ston pa lha zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de nyid ston pa lha zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: That is taught by the gods, etc.

original: 'jig rten skyong ba la sogs pa lha thams cad kyi lus rnams la yang skyong ba dang lhan cig gnas so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'jig rten skyong ba la sogs pa lha thams cad kyi lus rnams la yang skyong ba dang lhan cig gnas so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that the bodies of all the gods, such as the Lokapalas, also abide together with the protectors.

original: de dag gis 'di ltar gsungs te de rnams thams cad kyang 'chi bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gis 'di ltar gsungs te de rnams thams cad kyang 'chi bar 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: They say this: “All of them will die.”

original: yang na de rnams kho na skye ba dang 'chi bar 'gyur gyi bcom ldan 'das sems kyi rdo rje ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yang na de rnams kho na skye ba dang 'chi bar 'gyur gyi bcom ldan 'das sems kyi rdo rje ni ma yin no zhes pa'o //
translated: Or, “Only they are born and die, but not the Bhagavat, the mind-vajra.”

original: gal te 'di rnams sems las tha dad med do zhes gsungs la ;
analyzed: gal te 'di rnams sems las tha dad med do zhes gsungs la ;
translated: If it is said that they are not different from the mind,

original: de yang thams cad kyi tshe cha mthun par rgyun dug nas pa yin na /
analyzed: de yang thams cad kyi tshe cha mthun par rgyun dug nas pa yin na /
translated: and that is always in a continuous state of conformity,

original: de ji ltar 'byung ba rnams kyi cha mthun pa dang cha mthun pa ma yin pa nyams pa dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid 'chi ba dang skye ba yin zhe na /
analyzed: de ji ltar 'byung ba rnams kyi cha mthun pa dang cha mthun pa ma yin pa nyams pa dang skye ba'i mtshan nyid 'chi ba dang skye ba yin zhe na /
translated: How do death and birth occur? They are characterized by the loss and arising of the concordant and discordant aspects of the elements.

original: gsungs pa / mtha' dag ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsungs pa / mtha' dag ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The meaning of this is stated in the line: “The entire world is always…”

original: 'di'i don ni rtag tu zhes pa 'khor ba thog ma med par ji ltar gsungs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir sems las tha dad pa dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi rig byed kyi mtha' la sogs pa'i bstan bcos de rnams rmongs pa rnams kyis 'dod cing sgom par byed de 'jig rten du'ang de las byung ba'i lta ba ngan pa 'byung ste /
analyzed: 'di'i don ni rtag tu zhes pa 'khor ba thog ma med par ji ltar gsungs pa'i rang bzhin yongs su ma shes pa'i phyir sems las tha dad pa dang / rtag pa dang mi rtag pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin nyid kyi rig byed kyi mtha' la sogs pa'i bstan bcos de rnams rmongs pa rnams kyis 'dod cing sgom par byed de 'jig rten du'ang de las byung ba'i lta ba ngan pa 'byung ste /
translated: The meaning of this is that because of not fully understanding the nature of cyclic existence as it is taught to be beginningless, the treatises of the Mīmāṃsakas and so on, which assert that the self is different from the mind and has a nature that is permanent, impermanent, and so on, are accepted and contemplated by the confused. In the world, bad views arise from them.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in the line:🔽“The bad views of the world arise from them.”

original: 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis /
analyzed: 'phags pa lha'i zhabs kyis /
translated: Āryadeva’s statement is:

original: mu stegs bye ba mang po rnams //
analyzed: mu stegs bye ba mang po rnams //
translated: The many millions of tīrthikas

original: don med rgyur gyur mthong nas ni //
analyzed: don med rgyur gyur mthong nas ni //
translated: are seen to be causes of meaninglessness.

original: skye bo chos 'dod pa rnams la //
analyzed: skye bo chos 'dod pa rnams la //
translated: For those who desire the dharma,

original: gang gi snying rje 'byung mi 'gyur //
analyzed: gang gi snying rje 'byung mi 'gyur //
translated: Where does compassion not arise?

original: zhes pa'o // gal te 'dzin pa las snang ba tha dad pas phye ba'i gzung ba yang ji ltar sems dang tha mi dad pa yin zhe na gsungs pa /🔽gang du thams cad la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // gal te 'dzin pa las snang ba tha dad pas phye ba'i gzung ba yang ji ltar sems dang tha mi dad pa yin zhe na gsungs pa / gang du thams cad la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: If the apprehended is distinguished by the appearance from the apprehender, how is it not different from the mind?🔽It is said:

original: gang gi phyir gang las thams cad du 'byung ba thams cad la thams cad 'gro'o zhes ba kun 'gro'o //🔽rnam par @19a * //
analyzed: gang gi phyir gang las thams cad du 'byung ba thams cad la thams cad 'gro'o zhes ba kun 'gro'o // rnam par @19a * //
translated: Since everything arises from it, everything goes to it, it is all-pervading.

original: shes pa'i khams gnas zhes pa gnas par gyur pa sa las skyes pa thams cad de 'byung ba las gyur pa yang de nyid do //
analyzed: shes pa'i khams gnas zhes pa gnas par gyur pa sa las skyes pa thams cad de 'byung ba las gyur pa yang de nyid do //
translated: The consciousness element is the abode, and everything born from the earth element arises from it, and it is also the other elements.

original: yang na gang gi phyir thams cad la thams cad kun 'gro rnam par shes pa'i khams dang sa las skyos pa zhes pa 'byung ba gzhan yang gnas par 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
analyzed: yang na gang gi phyir thams cad la thams cad kun 'gro rnam par shes pa'i khams dang sa las skyos pa zhes pa 'byung ba gzhan yang gnas par 'gyur ro zhes 'brel to //
translated: Or, since everything goes to everything, the consciousness element and the earth element are the abode, and the other elements also become the abode.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de ma thag gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de ma thag gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is said immediately after:

original: gang du gcig ni gnas pa der //
analyzed: gang du gcig ni gnas pa der //
translated: Where one abides,

original: bzhi po de kun nye bar gnas //
analyzed: bzhi po de kun nye bar gnas //
translated: All four of these are present.

original: zhes so // de dag gis 'di ltar brjod de rang las grub pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir rang gi sems 'ba' zhig gis byas pa rnams par rtog pa tsam gyi bdag nyid la tha dad pa mi srid ces so //
analyzed: zhes so // de dag gis 'di ltar brjod de rang las grub pa'i rang bzhin med pa'i phyir rang gi sems 'ba' zhig gis byas pa rnams par rtog pa tsam gyi bdag nyid la tha dad pa mi srid ces so //
translated: They say this: because there is no intrinsic nature established from itself, the imagination of what is just one’s own mind is not possible as something different.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:🔽“The other four elements are the primary one.”

original: 'byung ba bzhi po gzhan gtso bo zhes pa 'byung ba bzhi po rnams las gzhan rnam par shes pa kho na gtso bo ste /
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi po gzhan gtso bo zhes pa 'byung ba bzhi po rnams las gzhan rnam par shes pa kho na gtso bo ste /
translated: From among the four elements, consciousness alone is the primary one.

original: de rnams sprul pa nyid las te //
analyzed: de rnams sprul pa nyid las te //
translated: From that, they are emanations.

original: bstan bcos kun la yang dag 'dod //
analyzed: bstan bcos kun la yang dag 'dod //
translated: They are accepted in all the treatises.

original: ces pa'o // yang na mtha' dag ces pa phyi ma'i bstan bcos mtha' dag la'ang de rnams nyid 'dod cing sgom par byed do //
analyzed: ces pa'o // yang na mtha' dag ces pa phyi ma'i bstan bcos mtha' dag la'ang de rnams nyid 'dod cing sgom par byed do //
translated: Or, “all” refers to the later treatises, in which they are accepted and cultivated.

original: de bas na de rnams kho na gtso bor gyur pa zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: de bas na de rnams kho na gtso bor gyur pa zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Therefore, they alone are the primary ones.

original: de dag nyid bstan par byed pa thams cad la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de dag nyid bstan par byed pa thams cad la zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: They are taught in all the treatises.

original: thams cad la zhes ba kun 'gro rnams so ;
analyzed: thams cad la zhes ba kun 'gro rnams so ;
translated: All means the omnipresent ones.

original: / yang na kun la zhes pa thams cad la bya ba'i khyad par ro //
analyzed: / yang na kun la zhes pa thams cad la bya ba'i khyad par ro //
translated: Or else, all is a particular of the locative case.

original: thams cad ces brjod pa la'ang de bzhin no //
analyzed: thams cad ces brjod pa la'ang de bzhin no //
translated: The same applies to the expression all.

original: sa la skyes zhes pa dgu'i bdag nyid can la skyes pa zhes pa de rnams thams cad la gnas zhes 'brel lo //
analyzed: sa la skyes zhes pa dgu'i bdag nyid can la skyes pa zhes pa de rnams thams cad la gnas zhes 'brel lo //
translated: Born in the earth means born in the nine-fold self. In all is the connection with abiding.

original: sa la skyes zhes pa ni bdun pa'i mang po'i tshig ste /
analyzed: sa la skyes zhes pa ni bdun pa'i mang po'i tshig ste /
translated: The expression born in the earth is the plural form of the seventh case.

original: gzugs med pa'i khams na yang nyan thos kyi 'dod pa gzhan gyis don cung zad 'byung ba srid do zhes ba skyon med do //
analyzed: gzugs med pa'i khams na yang nyan thos kyi 'dod pa gzhan gyis don cung zad 'byung ba srid do zhes ba skyon med do //
translated: It is not a fault to say that in the formless realm, it is possible that a little of the sravaka's desire for the benefit of others may occur.

original: bshad pa nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: bshad pa nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa /
translated: The summary of the explanation is stated:

original: 'byung ba bzhi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The four elements, etc.

original: 'di dag gis 'byung ba bzhi la yang dag bar brten pa kho nas sngags kyi tshul gyis rnal 'byor pa bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor goms par bya'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis 'byung ba bzhi la yang dag bar brten pa kho nas sngags kyi tshul gyis rnal 'byor pa bskyed pa dang rdzogs pa'i rim pa'i rnal 'byor goms par bya'o zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: By these, it is explained that the practitioner should cultivate the yoga of the generation and perfection stages, relying on the four elements alone, by the method of mantra.

original: thun mong gi mtshan nyid mngon par brjod nas khyad par gyi mtshan nyid nang gi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: thun mong gi mtshan nyid mngon par brjod nas khyad par gyi mtshan nyid nang gi 'byung ba'i mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
translated: Having stated the common characteristics, he states the special characteristics, the characteristics of the internal elements.

original: srog ces pa la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: srog ces pa la sogs pa ste //
translated: Life and so on.

original: srog byed pa dang / @19b rgyu ba'i phyir srog ni rlung ngo //
analyzed: srog byed pa dang / @19b rgyu ba'i phyir srog ni rlung ngo //
translated: Life is wind, because it moves and causes movement.

original: yang dag gnas zhes pa shes par bya ste /
analyzed: yang dag gnas zhes pa shes par bya ste /
translated: Correct placement should be understood.

original: rlung ni 'byung ba dang / rngub pa'i bdag nyid rnam par shes pas skyor bar gyur par shes par bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: rlung ni 'byung ba dang / rngub pa'i bdag nyid rnam par shes pas skyor bar gyur par shes par bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: It is the intention that wind should be understood to be the support of consciousness, in the form of inhalation and exhalation.

original: me ni tsha ba'i mtshan nyid de //
analyzed: me ni tsha ba'i mtshan nyid de //
translated: Fire has the characteristic of heat.

original: zhes pa tsha ba'i mtshan nyid ni me ste gzi brjid rang bzhin skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa tsha ba'i mtshan nyid ni me ste gzi brjid rang bzhin skyed par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The characteristic of fire is heat, because it generates the nature of brilliance.

original: chu ni bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chu ni bdud rtsi'i rang bzhin no //
translated: Water has the nature of nectar.

original: zhes pa 'chi ba mi 'chi bar byed pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa 'chi ba mi 'chi bar byed pa'o //
translated: It prevents death from occurring.

original: de'i phyir chu ni 'chi med rang bzhin zhes pas te tshim par byed pa'i tshul gyis brtan par byed pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir chu ni 'chi med rang bzhin zhes pas te tshim par byed pa'i tshul gyis brtan par byed pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Therefore, water has the nature of immortality, because it stabilizes by the method of satisfaction.

original: sa ni rten tsam nyid du'o //
analyzed: sa ni rten tsam nyid du'o //
translated: Earth is merely a support.

original: zhes pa zhing lta bur skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'phel ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir sa ni rten yin no //
analyzed: zhes pa zhing lta bur skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'phel ba'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir sa ni rten yin no //
translated: The earth is the support because it is the cause of the generation, maintenance, and growth of the seed.

original: don 'di yin te 'dir nams nyid 'khor ba'i gnas skabs su yul rnams dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas skabs su bde ba chen po la rim pa ji lta bar bskul ba dang gzi brjid dang tshim pa dang 'dzin pa rnams kyis sems kyi rgyal po la 'khyud nas rjes su 'dzin cing gnas so zhes pa'o //
analyzed: don 'di yin te 'dir nams nyid 'khor ba'i gnas skabs su yul rnams dang / 'jig rten las 'das pa'i gnas skabs su bde ba chen po la rim pa ji lta bar bskul ba dang gzi brjid dang tshim pa dang 'dzin pa rnams kyis sems kyi rgyal po la 'khyud nas rjes su 'dzin cing gnas so zhes pa'o //
translated: The meaning is this: the five objects of sense pleasure, in the state of cyclic existence, and great bliss, in the state of transcendent wisdom, embrace the king of consciousness in the same order as above, with stimulation, radiance, and satisfaction, and they support it.

original: yang na lus kyi za ma thog tu de rnams nyid la yang dag par brten nas sems kyi rgyal po gnas te /
analyzed: yang na lus kyi za ma thog tu de rnams nyid la yang dag par brten nas sems kyi rgyal po gnas te /
translated: Or else, the king of consciousness is supported on the body, and on those very objects, and it abides.

original: 'di rnams gang yang rung ba med na 'chi ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa thun mong ma yin pa rjes su 'dzin par gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di rnams gang yang rung ba med na 'chi ba'i phyir rnam par shes pa thun mong ma yin pa rjes su 'dzin par gsungs so //
translated: Since it dies if any of them is absent, it is said to be supported by the uncommon consciousness.

original: nam mkha' ni rnam par shes pa las shin tu dbyer med pa'o //
analyzed: nam mkha' ni rnam par shes pa las shin tu dbyer med pa'o //
translated: Space is not at all different from consciousness.

original: 'on kyang de dang ro mnyam pa nyid kyis gnas so zhes pa ste so sor ma bstan to //
analyzed: 'on kyang de dang ro mnyam pa nyid kyis gnas so zhes pa ste so sor ma bstan to //
translated: But it is not taught separately, since it abides as identical in taste with that.

original: yang na go skabs sbyin pa nyid de'i rjes su 'dzin pa ste /
analyzed: yang na go skabs sbyin pa nyid de'i rjes su 'dzin pa ste /
translated: Or, it is the granting of an opportunity, which is the support of that.

original: de yang thun mong gi mtshan nyid kyi skabs su gsungs so //
analyzed: de yang thun mong gi mtshan nyid kyi skabs su gsungs so //
translated: And that is taught in the context of the common characteristics.

original: de dag nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de dag nyid gsungs pa /
translated: Those very [characteristics] are taught.

original: de la rtag tu gnas pa'i lha //
analyzed: de la rtag tu gnas pa'i lha //
translated: Among them, the god who always abides

original: rnam shes mchog gi dbang phyug go //
analyzed: rnam shes mchog gi dbang phyug go //
translated: is the lord of supreme consciousness.

original: zhes pa lha'i ngang tshul nyid las lha'o //🔽da ni rnam pa lnga ni ji ltar lha //
analyzed: zhes pa lha'i ngang tshul nyid las lha'o // da ni rnam pa lnga ni ji ltar lha //
translated: The god is from the nature of the god.🔽 Now, in order to answer the question, How are the five aspects gods?

original: zhes zhus pa'i lan gdab pa'i phyir gsungs pa /🔽de'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: zhes zhus pa'i lan gdab pa'i phyir gsungs pa / de'i zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: it is said:🔽The god of that...

original: de'i zhes pa 'byung ba lnga dang ldan pa'i rnam shes kyi'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes pa 'byung ba lnga dang ldan pa'i rnam shes kyi'o //
translated: The god of that refers to the consciousness endowed with the five elements.

original: kun du 'jug ces pa kun nas rnam pa thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: kun du 'jug ces pa kun nas rnam pa thams cad 'byung bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It is said pervades because all aspects arise from it.

original: lha zhes pa lha yi'o //
analyzed: lha zhes pa lha yi'o //
translated: The god is of the god.

original: rnam pa lnga'i lha rnams ni //
analyzed: rnam pa lnga'i lha rnams ni //
translated: The gods of the five aspects

original: zhes pa rnam pa lnga rnams dang lha lnga yang ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa rnam pa lnga rnams dang lha lnga yang ngo //
translated: refers to both the five aspects and the five gods.

original: de la rnam pa lnga ni phung po lnga dang ye shes @20a * //
analyzed: de la rnam pa lnga ni phung po lnga dang ye shes @20a * //
translated: The five aspects are the five aggregates and the five pristine

original: lnga rnams so //
analyzed: lnga rnams so //
translated: awarenesses.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: He states that:

original: gzugs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Form and so forth.

original: gzugs zhes pa gzugs sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid can so sor snang ba'o //
analyzed: gzugs zhes pa gzugs sna tshogs pa'i bdag nyid can so sor snang ba'o //
translated: Form is the appearance of the various natures of form.

original: de ltar tshor ba la sogs pa yang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar tshor ba la sogs pa yang ngo //
translated: Likewise, it is the same for feeling and so forth.

original: me long zhes pa me long ye shes te /
analyzed: me long zhes pa me long ye shes te /
translated: The mirror is mirror-like pristine awareness.

original: de ltar gzhan rnams kyang ngo //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan rnams kyang ngo //
translated: Likewise, it is the same for the others.

original: ye shes 'di rnams rab tu gnas //
analyzed: ye shes 'di rnams rab tu gnas //
translated: These pristine awarenesses are fully present.

original: zhes pa / gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa 'di rnams ye shes kyi rang bzhin kho na'o //
analyzed: zhes pa / gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa 'di rnams ye shes kyi rang bzhin kho na'o //
translated: These aggregates of form and so forth are exclusively the nature of pristine awareness.

original: yang na ye shes kyi sgra las mngon du me long la sogs pa'i sgra 'di rnams so sor gnas so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang na ye shes kyi sgra las mngon du me long la sogs pa'i sgra 'di rnams so sor gnas so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Alternatively, the term pristine awareness is a general term for the five pristine awarenesses, and the terms mirror and so forth are specific terms for the individual pristine awarenesses.

original: de'i phyir me long ye shes dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes zhes pa la sogs par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir me long ye shes dang mnyam pa nyid kyi ye shes zhes pa la sogs par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, it is said that mirror-like pristine awareness, the pristine awareness of reality’s expanse, and so forth.

original: lha lnga ston ba rnam par snang mdzad zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: lha lnga ston ba rnam par snang mdzad zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The five deities are Vairocana and so forth.

original: 'di dag kyang rim pa ji lta ba me long la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin rnams te gtso bor sa la sogs pa'i khams la brten pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag kyang rim pa ji lta ba me long la sogs pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa rnam par dag pa'i rang bzhin rnams te gtso bor sa la sogs pa'i khams la brten pa'o //
translated: These are the natures of the mirror-like and other pristine awarenesses, the natures of the purified aggregates of form and so forth, and they are based primarily on the elements of earth and so forth.

original: de rnams kyang spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo'i rang bzhin rnams so //🔽de dag gi rnam par dag pa kho na'i bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom pa pos mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa rnam pa lngas bsgom par bya'o zhes ston pa rnam pa lnga zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de rnams kyang spyan ma la sogs pa'i lha mo'i rang bzhin rnams so // de dag gi rnam par dag pa kho na'i bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom pa pos mngon par rdzogs par byang chub pa rnam pa lngas bsgom par bya'o zhes ston pa rnam pa lnga zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: They are also the natures of the goddesses Locanā and so forth.🔽The meditator should cultivate the generation stage of their purities by means of the five aspects of manifest complete enlightenment.🔽The five aspects are the realization of perfect enlightenment by means of their oneness.

original: rnam pa lnga po rnams gcig pa nyid kyis rdzogs pa'i byang chub rtogs pa 'di'i zhes pa drug pa rdo rje 'chang ngo //🔽lnga pa yul drug zhus pa'i lan gdab pa'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: rnam pa lnga po rnams gcig pa nyid kyis rdzogs pa'i byang chub rtogs pa 'di'i zhes pa drug pa rdo rje 'chang ngo // lnga pa yul drug zhus pa'i lan gdab pa'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: The five aspects are the realization of perfect enlightenment by means of their oneness.

original: yul zhes pa la sogs pa /
analyzed: yul zhes pa la sogs pa /
translated: The reply to the question about the six objects is stated in the line beginning with “object.”

original: rnam pa kun gyi mchog gnas pa ;
analyzed: rnam pa kun gyi mchog gnas pa ;
translated: The supreme of all aspects is the abiding.

original: ; yul gyi rnam dag rtogs par bya //
analyzed: ; yul gyi rnam dag rtogs par bya //
translated: The purity of the objects is to be understood.

original: zhes pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar du'o //
translated: Up to here.

original: de la yul zhes pa 'dis yul can yang brjod de yul rnams ni yul can la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de la yul zhes pa 'dis yul can yang brjod de yul rnams ni yul can la ltos pa dang bcas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Here, the word “object” also expresses the subject, because the objects are related to the subject.

original: 'di dag gis skye mched bcu gnyis por nams gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di dag gis skye mched bcu gnyis por nams gsungs so //
translated: These are said to be the twelve sense-fields.

original: 'di rnams zhes pa 'di rnams kyi'o//
analyzed: 'di rnams zhes pa 'di rnams kyi'o//
translated: “ These” is of these.

original: rnam dag ces pa rnam par dag pa'o //
analyzed: rnam dag ces pa rnam par dag pa'o //
translated: “ Purity” is purity.

original: bshad ces pa gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa dang sa'i snying po la sogs pa rab tu grags pa rnams so //
analyzed: bshad ces pa gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa dang sa'i snying po la sogs pa rab tu grags pa rnams so //
translated: “ Explained” is the well-known Vajra-form and so on, and the well-known Akashagarbha and so on.

original: khams ni bco brgyad dag tu dran //
analyzed: khams ni bco brgyad dag tu dran //
translated: The elements are remembered as eighteen.

original: zhes pa de rnams kho na'i dbye bas khams bco brgyad do //
analyzed: zhes pa de rnams kho na'i dbye bas khams bco brgyad do //
translated: By the division of just those, there are eighteen elements.

original: phung po'i rang bzhin 'di rnams @20b las ;
analyzed: phung po'i rang bzhin 'di rnams @20b las ;
translated: From these, which have the nature of the aggregates,🔽“ These” is just these.

original: / zhes pa 'di rnams kho na mdor bsdus pa las phung po lnga'i rang bzhin nyid do //
analyzed: / zhes pa 'di rnams kho na mdor bsdus pa las phung po lnga'i rang bzhin nyid do //
translated: “ In brief” is the nature of the five aggregates.

original: 'gyur med mchog ni bsgom par bya //
analyzed: 'gyur med mchog ni bsgom par bya //
translated: The unchanging supreme is to be cultivated.

original: zhes pa slar yang de nyid 'gyur med mchog rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa slar yang de nyid 'gyur med mchog rdo rje sems dpar 'gyur ro //
translated: Again, that very [nature] is the supreme unchanging, Vajrasattva.

original: sangs rgyas nyid 'bras rgyu ru 'gyur //
analyzed: sangs rgyas nyid 'bras rgyu ru 'gyur //
translated: Buddhahood is the result and cause.

original: zhes pa de nyid sangs rgyas nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'bras bu dang de'i rgyur yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa de nyid sangs rgyas nyid kyi mtshan nyid 'bras bu dang de'i rgyur yang 'gyur ro //
translated: That very [nature] is the characteristic of Buddhahood, and also its result and cause.

original: ji ltar 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is that? It is said:

original: mig sogs rnams la bsgom bya ste //
analyzed: mig sogs rnams la bsgom bya ste //
translated: Meditate on the eyes, etc.

original: zhes pa / rang nyid rdo rje sems dpar gyur nas mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams la bcom ldan 'das de nyid 'bras bu dang de'i rgyur yang 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zhes pa / rang nyid rdo rje sems dpar gyur nas mig la sogs pa'i skye mched rnams la bcom ldan 'das de nyid 'bras bu dang de'i rgyur yang 'gyur ro //
translated: Having become Vajrasattva oneself, the Bhagavat himself, in the eyes, etc., the sense-fields, is the result and also the cause of that.

original: gzugs kyis bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gzugs kyis bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Meditate on the form, is the meaning.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is said:

original: bcom ldan 'das de nyid sa'i snying po'i rnam pas mig gi skye mched la gnas nas gzugs gsum rnam par sbyang te rdo rje'i mig gi skye mched de steng bar mdzad do zhes rgyas par ro //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das de nyid sa'i snying po'i rnam pas mig gi skye mched la gnas nas gzugs gsum rnam par sbyang te rdo rje'i mig gi skye mched de steng bar mdzad do zhes rgyas par ro //
translated: The Bhagavat himself, in the aspect of Ksitigarbha, having dwelt in the sense-field of the eye, having purified the three forms, makes that sense-field of the vajra eye superior.

original: de rnams nyid ston pa /
analyzed: de rnams nyid ston pa /
translated: He teaches just those:

original: mig gi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: mig gi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The eye, etc.

original: mig gi dbang po dang yul gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa ni bcom ldan 'das thugs rdo rje sems dpa'i rnam 'phrul yin no //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po dang yul gzugs dang mig gi rnam par shes pa ni bcom ldan 'das thugs rdo rje sems dpa'i rnam 'phrul yin no //
translated: The eye faculty, the object form, and the eye consciousness are the magical emanations of the Bhagavat, the mind-vajra.

original: mig gi dbang po'i sgras mig gi yul yang brjod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: mig gi dbang po'i sgras mig gi yul yang brjod pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Because the word “eye faculty” also expresses the object of the eye.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: gsum zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gsum zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The three, etc.

original: de bzhin du yul gyi sgras kyang yul can bstan te bshad ma thag pa nyid do //
analyzed: de bzhin du yul gyi sgras kyang yul can bstan te bshad ma thag pa nyid do //
translated: Likewise, the word “object” also teaches the subject, as was just explained.

original: bstan pa'i rim pa 'di yang yul dang yul can dag la don dam par dbye ba med par rtogs pa'i don du'o //
analyzed: bstan pa'i rim pa 'di yang yul dang yul can dag la don dam par dbye ba med par rtogs pa'i don du'o //
translated: And this order of teaching is for the purpose of realizing that ultimately there is no division between the object and the subject.

original: gsum po 'di dag ni rang bzhin rnam dag don 'od gsal gyi go 'phang gi rten du 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: gsum po 'di dag ni rang bzhin rnam dag don 'od gsal gyi go 'phang gi rten du 'gyur ro zhes pa'i don to //
translated: These three become the basis for the state of clear light, the pure nature.

original: rnam shes zhes pa rna ba'i rnam shes te de ltar bzhi yang ngo //
analyzed: rnam shes zhes pa rna ba'i rnam shes te de ltar bzhi yang ngo //
translated: Consciousness is the ear consciousness.

original: rnam shes zhes pa'i tshig ni de dang de'i dbang po las skyes ba zhes shes par bya'o //
analyzed: rnam shes zhes pa'i tshig ni de dang de'i dbang po las skyes ba zhes shes par bya'o //
translated: The word consciousness should be understood as produced from that and that faculty.

original: sgra'i zhes pa sgra'o //
analyzed: sgra'i zhes pa sgra'o //
translated: Sound is sound.

original: dmigs pa med pa'i rang bzhin las //
analyzed: dmigs pa med pa'i rang bzhin las //
translated: From the nature of the absence of an object,

original: 'od gsal gyi ni go 'phang zhes pa snga ma dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi ni go 'phang zhes pa snga ma dang 'brel lo //
translated: the state of luminosity is connected with the previous.

original: snom byed dri dang zhes pa sna dang dri'o //
analyzed: snom byed dri dang zhes pa sna dang dri'o //
translated: The smell-sniffer is smell.

original: rnam dag de bzhin nyid du dran //
analyzed: rnam dag de bzhin nyid du dran //
translated: Recollection is pure suchness.

original: zhes pa chos dang chos nyid dag la dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa chos dang chos nyid dag la dbye ba med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: This is because there is no division between phenomena and the true nature of phenomena.

original: rnam dag nyid las zhes pa rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir ro /
analyzed: rnam dag nyid las zhes pa rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir ro /
translated: From pureness itself means because of pureness itself.

original: @21a * // lus dang reg bya lus rnams shes //
analyzed: @21a * // lus dang reg bya lus rnams shes //

analyzed: zhes pa dang po'i mang po'i tshig go // yid dang chos dang yid rnam shes //
translated: This is a plural particle at the beginning.🔽The mind, phenomena, and mind consciousness

original: zhes pa yid kyi dbang po dang chos kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pa yid kyi dbang po dang chos kyi khams dang yid kyi rnam par shes pa rnams so //
translated: are the mind faculty, the phenomena element, and the mind consciousness.🔽They are pure in the heart center.

original: snying ga nyid du rnam par dag / ces pa khyab byed kyang snying gar gnas pa'o //
analyzed: snying ga nyid du rnam par dag / ces pa khyab byed kyang snying gar gnas pa'o //
translated: The pervader also abides in the heart center.

original: rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir //
analyzed: rnam par dag pa nyid kyi phyir //
translated: Because of the state of purity,

original: 'od gsal gyi ni go 'phang zhes pa snga ma dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: 'od gsal gyi ni go 'phang zhes pa snga ma dang 'brel lo //
translated: the state of luminosity.

original: nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: nye bar bsdu ba gsungs pa /
translated: The summary is stated:

original: drug ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: drug ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The six, etc.

original: kun gzhi zhes pa kun gzhi la'o //
analyzed: kun gzhi zhes pa kun gzhi la'o //
translated: The alaya is in the alaya.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa gti mug rdo rje la sogs pa'o ;
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa zhes pa gti mug rdo rje la sogs pa'o ;
translated: The Tathagatas are Mohavajra, etc.

original: / dpal he ru ka'i ting 'dzin gnas //
analyzed: / dpal he ru ka'i ting 'dzin gnas //
translated: Dwelling in the samadhi of Sri Heruka,

original: zhes pa dang po'o //
analyzed: zhes pa dang po'o //
translated: is the first.

original: yul dang yul can rnal 'byor gyis //
analyzed: yul dang yul can rnal 'byor gyis //
translated: The object and subject by the yoga,

original: zhes pa yul gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa dang / yul can gti mug rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyis snyoms par 'jug pas gnas na rtog pa med pa'i bde pa skye ba'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa yul gzugs rdo rje ma la sogs pa dang / yul can gti mug rdo rje la sogs pa'i rnal 'byor gyis snyoms par 'jug pas gnas na rtog pa med pa'i bde pa skye ba'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: is the object, Rupaloka, etc. and the subject, Mohavajra, etc. by the yoga of union, if one dwells, the bliss of non-thought arises.

original: de dag nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de dag nyid gsungs pa /
translated: Those are stated:

original: yul gyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: yul gyi zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The object, etc.

original: stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig gis sangs rgyas ma yin te /
analyzed: stong pa nyid 'ba' zhig gis sangs rgyas ma yin te /
translated: It is not only emptiness that is Buddhahood,

original: 'on kyang rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa nyid kyis so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'on kyang rnam pa thams cad mchog dang ldan pa nyid kyis so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: but rather, it is the state endowed with the highest of all aspects.

original: de dag gis 'di skad gsungs te /🔽bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom pa pos rdo rje sems dpa'i sku ru dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas bcom ldan 'das nyid stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i sku 'di'i zhes nges par gzung ste mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams🔽kyang rang bzhin med pa nyid du mngon du byas nas ji lta ba bzhin sa bon dang mtshan ma yongs su gyur pas /
analyzed: de dag gis 'di skad gsungs te / bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom pa pos rdo rje sems dpa'i sku ru dmigs pa sngon du 'gro bas bcom ldan 'das nyid stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa'i sku 'di'i zhes nges par gzung ste mig la sogs pa'i dbang po rnams dang gzugs la sogs pa'i yul rnams kyang rang bzhin med pa nyid du mngon du byas nas ji lta ba bzhin sa bon dang mtshan ma yongs su gyur pas /
translated: They say this:🔽The one who meditates on the creation stage, having visualized the body of Vajrasattva beforehand, should definitely apprehend the body of the Bhagavān as one taste with emptiness.

original: mig la sogs pa rnams gzugs rdo rje la sogs pas 'khyud pa'i gti mug rdo rje la sogs pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: mig la sogs pa rnams gzugs rdo rje la sogs pas 'khyud pa'i gti mug rdo rje la sogs pa rnams bsgom par bya'o //
translated: Having actualized the eyes and so on, the sense organs, and forms and so on, the sense objects, as devoid of intrinsic nature, one should meditate on the eyes and so on as Mohavajrā and so on, arisen from the seed and sign as they are.

original: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pas ni de bzhin nyid dang dbyer med pa rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba lhan cig skyes pa chen po'i bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa' nyid brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po mtha' dag la khyab pa
analyzed: rdzogs pa'i rim pa la gnas pas ni de bzhin nyid dang dbyer med pa rnam par rtog pa dang bral ba lhan cig skyes pa chen po'i bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das dpal rdo rje sems dpa' nyid brtan pa dang g-yo ba'i dngos po mtha' dag la khyab pa
translated: animate and inanimate, by virtue of his very nature.

original: nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa'o zhes bla ma'i gdams ngag las bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: nyid kyis rnam par gnas pa'o zhes bla ma'i gdams ngag las bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, it should be meditated upon by the instructions of the guru.

original: da ni zhu ba drug pa'i lan gdab pa'i @21b phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni zhu ba drug pa'i lan gdab pa'i @21b phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to give the reply to the sixth question, he says:

original: sangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa rang bzhin no zhes pa'i bar ji srid pa ste /
analyzed: sangs rgyas zhes pa la sogs pa rang bzhin no zhes pa'i bar ji srid pa ste /
translated: The Buddha, etc., up to the nature.

original: zung 'jug gi bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das gcig kho na sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun du brtags te phye ba las so //
analyzed: zung 'jug gi bdag nyid bcom ldan 'das gcig kho na sangs rgyas dang chos dang dge 'dun du brtags te phye ba las so //
translated: The Blessed One, who is the nature of union, is the one only, imagined as the Buddha, Dharma, and Sangha, and divided by analysis.

original: sangs rgyas ni gzugs sku'i rang bzhin nyid las so //
analyzed: sangs rgyas ni gzugs sku'i rang bzhin nyid las so //
translated: The Buddha is from the nature of the form body.

original: chos ni chos sku'i rang bzhin nyid las so //
analyzed: chos ni chos sku'i rang bzhin nyid las so //
translated: The Dharma is from the nature of the truth body.

original: dge 'dun ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pas phye ba'i sa rnams la yang de nyid gnas pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dge 'dun ni rab tu dga' ba la sogs pas phye ba'i sa rnams la yang de nyid gnas pa'i phyir te /
translated: The Sangha is also the three jewels, because it abides in the stages of the joyful and so on.

original: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa thob pa kho na dge 'dun no //
analyzed: rab tu dga' ba la sogs pa'i sa thob pa kho na dge 'dun no //
translated: Only those who have attained the stages of the joyful and so on are the Sangha.

original: de dag nyid skyabs gsum mo //
analyzed: de dag nyid skyabs gsum mo //
translated: They are the three jewels.

original: de nyid sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi de nyid rnams te de nyid gsum mo //
analyzed: de nyid sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi de nyid rnams te de nyid gsum mo //
translated: They are the three realities of body, speech and mind, the three realities.

original: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams te rnam par thar pa gsum mo //
analyzed: stong pa nyid dang mtshan ma med pa dang / smon pa med pa rnams te rnam par thar pa gsum mo //
translated: They are the three doors of liberation, emptiness, signlessness and wishlessness.

original: 'di dag rnam par dag pa zhal gsum ste 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal lo //
analyzed: 'di dag rnam par dag pa zhal gsum ste 'dir bcom ldan 'das kyi zhal lo //
translated: Their purities are the three faces, the faces of the Bhagavat here.

original: lha gsum zhes pa rtag pa dang snang ba mtha' yas dang mi bskyod pa rnams so //
analyzed: lha gsum zhes pa rtag pa dang snang ba mtha' yas dang mi bskyod pa rnams so //
translated: The three deities are Amitabha, Akshobhya and the eternal one.

original: dkyil 'khor gsum zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi 'khor lo rnams so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gsum zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi 'khor lo rnams so //
translated: The three mandalas are the mandalas of body, speech and mind.

original: rnal 'byor gsum zhes pa ting nge 'dzin rgyal po mchog dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog dang / las kyi rgyal po mchog rnams so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor gsum zhes pa ting nge 'dzin rgyal po mchog dang / dkyil 'khor rgyal po mchog dang / las kyi rgyal po mchog rnams so //
translated: The three yogas are the King of Concentrations, the King of Mandalas, and the King of Actions.

original: lam gsum zhes pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i dbye ba las lam gsum po rnams so //
analyzed: lam gsum zhes pa nyan thos dang rang sangs rgyas dang byang chub sems dpa'i dbye ba las lam gsum po rnams so //
translated: The three paths are the three paths due to the divisions of the Hearers, Solitary Buddhas, and Bodhisattvas.

original: dam tshig gsum zhes pa lha dang sngags dang phyag rgya rnams sam /
analyzed: dam tshig gsum zhes pa lha dang sngags dang phyag rgya rnams sam /
translated: The three pledges are the deity, mantra, and seal,

original: yang na rdo rje dang dril bu dang lha'am /
analyzed: yang na rdo rje dang dril bu dang lha'am /
translated: or the vajra, bell, and deity,

original: yang na sdom pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa rnam pa gsum mo //
analyzed: yang na sdom pa'i tshul khrims la sogs pa rnam pa gsum mo //
translated: or the three types of ethical precedents such as the vow.

original: dge ba gsum zhes pa thog ma dang bar ma dang tha ma rnams so //
analyzed: dge ba gsum zhes pa thog ma dang bar ma dang tha ma rnams so //
translated: The three virtues are the beginning, middle, and end.

original: gsang gsum zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba rnams so //
analyzed: gsang gsum zhes pa sku dang gsung dang thugs kyi gsang ba rnams so //
translated: The three secrets are the secrets of body, speech, and mind.

original: chos kyi 'byung gnas rang bzhin las //
analyzed: chos kyi 'byung gnas rang bzhin las //
translated: From the nature of the source of phenomena

original: zhes pa chos 'byung gru gsum gyi phyag rgya'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa chos 'byung gru gsum gyi phyag rgya'i rang bzhin gyis gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: means that the source of phenomena is the nature of the seal of the triangle.

original: 'khor gsum mi dmigs rnal 'byor gyis//
analyzed: 'khor gsum mi dmigs rnal 'byor gyis//
translated: The yogi/nī who does not observe the three spheres

original: zhes pa bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa po dang sgom pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: zhes pa bsgom par bya ba dang sgom pa po dang sgom pa rnams kyis so //
translated: Thus, by the object of meditation, the meditator, and the meditation.🔽The nature of the three mantras,

original: sngags gsum gyi ni rang bzhin dang // zhes pa ni snying po dang nye ba'i snying po dang phreng ba'i sngags rnams so //
analyzed: sngags gsum gyi ni rang bzhin dang // zhes pa ni snying po dang nye ba'i snying po dang phreng ba'i sngags rnams so //
translated: means the essence mantra, the near essence mantra, and the garland mantra.

original: phyi dang nang gi zhes pa la sogs pa zhu ba bdun pa'i lan gdab pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi zhes pa la sogs pa zhu ba bdun pa'i lan gdab pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In response to the seven questions beginning with “outer and inner,”🔽he says,

analyzed: @22a * // phyi rol zhes ba la sogs pa yongs grags zhes pa'i bar du'o //

analyzed: de la phyi rol dang zhes pa snod kyi 'jig rten te de rnam par dag pa gzhal yas khang ngo //
translated: There, “outer” is the world vessel, and its purification is the celestial mansion.

original: nang gi zhes pa sems can gyi 'jig rten te /
analyzed: nang gi zhes pa sems can gyi 'jig rten te /
translated: “Inner” is the world of sentient beings.

original: de rnam par dag pa lha'i 'khor lo'i //
analyzed: de rnam par dag pa lha'i 'khor lo'i //
translated: Its purification is the circle of deities.

original: dgos pa gsungs pa phyi zhes ba la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dgos pa gsungs pa phyi zhes ba la sogs pa'o //
translated: The purpose is stated with “outer” and so forth.

original: de la lha'i 'khor lo'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la lha'i 'khor lo'i dbang du byas nas gsungs pa /
translated: There, with reference to the circle of deities, he says,

original: chos zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chos zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “dharma” and so forth.

original: lha rnams dmigs pa zhes pa dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi po rnams bsgom pa'o //
analyzed: lha rnams dmigs pa zhes pa dpa' bo nyi shu rtsa bzhi po rnams bsgom pa'o //
translated: The gods are the visualized objects, that is, the twenty-four heroes.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin du //
translated: In the nature of the realm of phenomena,

original: so sor zhes 'brel lo //
analyzed: so sor zhes 'brel lo //
translated: individually,🔽one should imagine the goddesses

original: rnam pa kun gyi rang bzhin las //🔽lha mor yongs su brtag par bya //
analyzed: rnam pa kun gyi rang bzhin las // lha mor yongs su brtag par bya //
translated: in the nature of all aspects.

original: zhes pa rnam pa'i 'khor lo'i rang bzhin lha mo rnams so //
analyzed: zhes pa rnam pa'i 'khor lo'i rang bzhin lha mo rnams so //
translated: The goddesses are in the nature of the wheel of aspects.

original: yang na gang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi rnam pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
analyzed: yang na gang byang chub kyi phyogs kyi chos sum cu rtsa bdun gyi rnam pa'i rang bzhin rnams so //
translated: Or else, they are in the nature of the aspects of the thirty-seven factors of awakening.

original: dang po lha yi gzugs kyis ni //
analyzed: dang po lha yi gzugs kyis ni //
translated: First, in the form of a god,

original: rdo rje sems dpa' rnam par bzhugs //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa' rnam par bzhugs //
translated: Vajrasattva abides.

original: zhes pa dang po lha'i gzugs ni dbus kyi gtso bo'o //
analyzed: zhes pa dang po lha'i gzugs ni dbus kyi gtso bo'o //
translated: First, the form of a god is the central principal.

original: dkyil 'khor ba'i lha rnams dgod pa'i gnas gsungs pa /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor ba'i lha rnams dgod pa'i gnas gsungs pa /
translated: The abode of the gods of the maṇḍala is stated:

original: gnas dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnas dang zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The abode, etc.

original: de bzhin zhes pa la sogs pas spro ba gsungs te /
analyzed: de bzhin zhes pa la sogs pas spro ba gsungs te /
translated: Emanation is stated by “thus, etc.”

original: ji ltar gzhal yas khang gi nang na lha rnams bzhugs pa de kho na ltar kha sbyor bde ba chen po'i tshul gyis grangs med pa spros nas phyogs bcu rnams su 'gro ba'i don mdzad do zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: ji ltar gzhal yas khang gi nang na lha rnams bzhugs pa de kho na ltar kha sbyor bde ba chen po'i tshul gyis grangs med pa spros nas phyogs bcu rnams su 'gro ba'i don mdzad do zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: Just as the deities reside in the celestial mansion, so also, having emanated countless [deities] in the manner of the great bliss of union, they perform the welfare of transmigrators in the ten directions.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That itself is stated:

original: grangs med pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: grangs med pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The countless, etc.

original: grangs ni dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa rnams kho nas te spros pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: grangs ni dkyil 'khor la bzhugs pa rnams kho nas te spros pa rnams kyis ni ma yin no zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: The thought is that the number is only those who reside in the mandala, not those who are emanated.

original: spros pa rnams kyi grangs ni gzhal du med pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: spros pa rnams kyi grangs ni gzhal du med pa'i phyir bsam gyis mi khyab pa'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: The number of the emanations is inconceivable because it is immeasurable, so it is stated:

original: bsam gyis mi khyab ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: inconceivable, etc.

original: 'di dag gang las spro zhe na gsungs pa dpal zhes pa la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gang las spro zhe na gsungs pa dpal zhes pa la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
translated: From what do these emanate? It is stated: the glorious, etc. It is easy to understand.

original: yang na dbal he ru ka yang dag sbyor //
analyzed: yang na dbal he ru ka yang dag sbyor //
translated: Or else, the glorious Heruka's union

original: zhes pa bde mchog dang phag mo nyid mkha' 'gro ma'i gzugs kyis gnas so zhes pa lhag ma ste de dag kyang don dam par dbye ba med do //
analyzed: zhes pa bde mchog dang phag mo nyid mkha' 'gro ma'i gzugs kyis gnas so zhes pa lhag ma ste de dag kyang don dam par dbye ba med do //
translated: They also are ultimately undifferentiated.

original: 'di dag gis bsdu ba gsungs so //
analyzed: 'di dag gis bsdu ba gsungs so //
translated: This is the teaching of the summary.

original: de nyid gsungs pa //
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa //
translated: The reality is stated:

original: de dag ces pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag ces pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The those and so forth.

original: 'bras bu gsungs pa //
analyzed: 'bras bu gsungs pa //
translated: The result is stated:

original: @22b de rnams kun zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: @22b de rnams kun zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The all of those and so forth.

original: 'di dag ji ltar bslab par bya zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di dag ji ltar bslab par bya zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How should one train in these? It is stated:

original: rags pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rags pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The coarse and so forth.

original: 'di ltar gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsungs te /
translated: This is what is stated:

original: bla ma'i zhal las rim pa mtha' dag bzung ste bsgoms pas sems rtse gcig pa goms pa phul du byung ba'i gnas skabs rtog pa dang bral ba'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bla ma'i zhal las rim pa mtha' dag bzung ste bsgoms pas sems rtse gcig pa goms pa phul du byung ba'i gnas skabs rtog pa dang bral ba'i ye shes skye bar 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: By meditating on all the stages taken from the guru's mouth, the state of the culmination of the cultivation of one-pointed mind is the arising of the gnosis free from conceptuality.

original: yang na de kho na rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: yang na de kho na rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: Alternatively, that reality is twofold:

original: bla mas rab tu bstan pa dang de nyams su myong ba'i tshul lo //
analyzed: bla mas rab tu bstan pa dang de nyams su myong ba'i tshul lo //
translated: the teaching of the guru and the experience of that.

original: de gnyis ka'i 'bras bu ni gsum pa'o //
analyzed: de gnyis ka'i 'bras bu ni gsum pa'o //
translated: The result of those two is the third.

original: de gsungs pa /
analyzed: de gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

original: thag pa'i zhabs kyis /
analyzed: thag pa'i zhabs kyis /
translated: The foot of the rope

original: de nyid ye shes rnam gnyis te /
analyzed: de nyid ye shes rnam gnyis te /
translated: is the two kinds of intuition.

original: gang yang brjod bcas brjod med do //
analyzed: gang yang brjod bcas brjod med do //
translated: It is also said to be with and without sound.

original: zhes pa'o // yang na rags pa sgra zhes pa rags pa ni sgra'i bdag nyid can /
analyzed: zhes pa'o // yang na rags pa sgra zhes pa rags pa ni sgra'i bdag nyid can /
translated: Or, the gross is sound, the gross is of the nature of sound,

original: a'a: dang h'um gi yi ge la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: a'a: dang h'um gi yi ge la sogs pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: the nature of the syllables A and Hum, etc.

original: phra mo bsam pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa de bsgom pa'i rim pa ni bla ma'i gdams ngag las so //
analyzed: phra mo bsam pa'i rang bzhin zhes pa de bsgom pa'i rim pa ni bla ma'i gdams ngag las so //
translated: The subtle is the nature of thought, the process of meditation on that is from the guru's instruction.

original: bsam pa dang bral ba'i de kho na rtogs pa zhes pa de goms pa las rtog pa dang bral ba'i bde ba rtog par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bsam pa dang bral ba'i de kho na rtogs pa zhes pa de goms pa las rtog pa dang bral ba'i bde ba rtog par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: The realization of thatness free from thought, from the practice of that, the bliss free from conceptualization will be realized.

original: 'byung ba bzhi la sogs pa zhu ba lnga'i yul gcig nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: 'byung ba bzhi la sogs pa zhu ba lnga'i yul gcig nyid du bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to teach the single object of the five melts such as the four elements,

original: le'u gcig nyid kyis lan btab par mdzad do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: le'u gcig nyid kyis lan btab par mdzad do zhes pa'o //
translated: the reply is made with a single chapter.

original: de ltar le'u gzhan du yang shes par bya'o //
analyzed: de ltar le'u gzhan du yang shes par bya'o //
translated: Thus it should be understood in other chapters as well.

original: le'u bzhi pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bzhi pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the explanation of the fourth chapter.

original: // / zla ba nyid ma ji ltar lha //
analyzed: // / zla ba nyid ma ji ltar lha //
translated: How is the moon itself the god?

original: zhes ba zhu ba brgyad pa'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes ba zhu ba brgyad pa'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated in terms of the eighth request.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'i le'u 'dir ni rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang 'tsho ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa dge ba dang mi dge ba mtha' dag ston ba dang / rdo rje'i bzlas pa'i rim pa'i yan lag rlung gi de nyid ni brjod par bya ba'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'i le'u 'dir ni rnam par shes pa'i rten du gyur pa bde ba dang sdug bsngal dang 'tsho ba dang 'chi ba la sogs pa dge ba dang mi dge ba mtha' dag ston ba dang / rdo rje'i bzlas pa'i rim pa'i yan lag rlung gi de nyid ni brjod par bya ba'o //
translated: In this chapter, beginning with the words “Then,” all that is virtuous and nonvirtuous, such as happiness and suffering, life and death, is taught as the support of consciousness, and the reality of the winds, which is a branch of the stage of vajra repetition, is to be expressed.🔽Moreover, it is based on the two nāḍīs that are well known as lalanā and rasanā.

original: de yang la la n'a dang ra sa n'a ra grags pa'i rtsa gnyis la yang dag par brten to zhes thog mar rtsa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de yang la la n'a dang ra sa n'a ra grags pa'i rtsa gnyis la yang dag par brten to zhes thog mar rtsa gnyis kyi mtshan nyid gsungs pa /
translated: The characteristics of the two nāḍīs are first taught:

original: zla ba zhes pa la sogs pa rim pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi bar ni mdor bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zla ba zhes pa la sogs pa rim pa ji lta ba bzhin gyi bar ni mdor bstan pa'o //
translated: The moon and so on.

original: mgrin pa zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par bshad pa'o //
analyzed: mgrin pa zhes pa la sogs pa rgyas par bshad pa'o //
translated: The words “throat” and so on are the extensive explanation.

original: 'og gi kha zhes pa gal te yang 'di'i bu ga gnyis ka yang kha yin pa de lta na yang blang ba dang dor bar byed pa nyid kyis 'og gi lte ba'i rtsa ni kha bzhin du 'di'i kha'o /
analyzed: 'og gi kha zhes pa gal te yang 'di'i bu ga gnyis ka yang kha yin pa de lta na yang blang ba dang dor bar byed pa nyid kyis 'og gi lte ba'i rtsa ni kha bzhin du 'di'i kha'o /
translated: The lower opening is the navel channel, which is like the mouth, since it is the very one that takes up and discards.

original: zhes pa 'og gi kha'o //🔽de bzhin @23a * //
analyzed: zhes pa 'og gi kha'o // de bzhin @23a * //
translated: This is the lower opening.

original: du steng gi kha yang ngo //
analyzed: du steng gi kha yang ngo //
translated: Likewise, the upper opening.

original: rab tu 'jug pa zhes pa g-yas pa nas 'thon te yul bzung nas de ma thag rlung la zhon pa'i rnam par shes pa la la n'a nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rab tu 'jug pa zhes pa g-yas pa nas 'thon te yul bzung nas de ma thag rlung la zhon pa'i rnam par shes pa la la n'a nas 'jug pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The one that enters is the one that emerges from the right, takes up an object, and then immediately enters the lalanā, riding on the wind.

original: de dag nyid gsungs pa sna'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid gsungs pa sna'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: He states just those: the nose, etc.

original: da ni skabs su bab pa rlung gi 'gyur ba dang mi 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid brjod pa'i ched du phyi'i nyin mtshan rnams la nyin mtshan gyi rnam par gzhag pa kho na re zhig gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni skabs su bab pa rlung gi 'gyur ba dang mi 'gyur ba'i mtshan nyid brjod pa'i ched du phyi'i nyin mtshan rnams la nyin mtshan gyi rnam par gzhag pa kho na re zhig gsungs pa /
translated: Now, in order to state the characteristics of the changeability and unchangeability of the winds, which is the present topic, he first states the arrangement of day and night in terms of the external days and nights.

original: nyi ma zhes pa la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: nyi ma zhes pa la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
translated: The sun, etc. is easy to understand.

original: thun brgyad kyi bdag nyid can nyin mtshan gcig la rnal mar gnas pa khams snyoms pa'i rlung rim pas rgyu ba de bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: thun brgyad kyi bdag nyid can nyin mtshan gcig la rnal mar gnas pa khams snyoms pa'i rlung rim pas rgyu ba de bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to demonstrate the gradual movement of the wind of balanced elements in a single day and night of eight periods, he says, “The transits,” and so on.

original: 'pho ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: 'pho ba zhes pa la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
translated: This is easy to understand.

original: gal te nyin mtshan gyis 'pho ba bcu drug rgyu ba la sna bug gang kho nas nyi ma gcig la nyi ma shar ba nas brtsams te rlung rgyu bar 'gyur ba de kho nas rnal mar gnas pa thams cad kyi tshe rgyu bar 'gyur te /
analyzed: gal te nyin mtshan gyis 'pho ba bcu drug rgyu ba la sna bug gang kho nas nyi ma gcig la nyi ma shar ba nas brtsams te rlung rgyu bar 'gyur ba de kho nas rnal mar gnas pa thams cad kyi tshe rgyu bar 'gyur te /
translated: If the sixteen transits of day and night move in the same nostril, then the wind moves in the same nostril for a single day, beginning from sunrise.

original: ji ltar nyi ma bzhi pa'i snga dro la sna bug gzhan gyis rlung rgyu bar 'gyur zhe na brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: ji ltar nyi ma bzhi pa'i snga dro la sna bug gzhan gyis rlung rgyu bar 'gyur zhe na brjod par bya ste /
translated: If one asks, “How does the wind move in the other nostril in the morning of the fourth day?”

original: 'dir nyin mtshan gcig la dkyil 'khor dgu bcu rtsa drug 'pho par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'dir nyin mtshan gcig la dkyil 'khor dgu bcu rtsa drug 'pho par 'gyur ro //
translated: Here, in a single day and night, there are ninety-six mandala transits.

original: da la dkyil 'khor gcig nas dkyil 'khor gzhan du 'pho ba na 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis bdud kyi bu mor grags pa'i rtsal dbugs phyed phyed zad pa las dkyil 'khor dgu bcu rtsa drug rnams kyi dbugs bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad zad pas zhag gsum gyis bzhi
analyzed: da la dkyil 'khor gcig nas dkyil 'khor gzhan du 'pho ba na 'chad par 'gyur ba'i tshul gyis bdud kyi bu mor grags pa'i rtsal dbugs phyed phyed zad pa las dkyil 'khor dgu bcu rtsa drug rnams kyi dbugs bzhi bcu rtsa brgyad zad pas zhag gsum gyis bzhi
translated: When the winds move from one mandala to another mandala, as will be explained, the winds of the ninety-six mandalas are exhausted in forty-eight half-breath periods, which is the strength of the daughters of Mara.

original: bcu rtsa bzhi lhag pa'i dbugs brgya chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bcu rtsa bzhi lhag pa'i dbugs brgya chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: In three days, the winds that remain, forty-four, are cut.

original: de bzhin du mtshan mo dang nyin mo mnyam pa'i dus su sna bug gcig nas sna bug gzhan du 'pho ba na cung zad dman pa'i dbugs kyi rkang pa gsum lhag pa'i dbugs nyi shu rtsa lnga sna bug gnyis ka'i rab tu rgyu ba las /
analyzed: de bzhin du mtshan mo dang nyin mo mnyam pa'i dus su sna bug gcig nas sna bug gzhan du 'pho ba na cung zad dman pa'i dbugs kyi rkang pa gsum lhag pa'i dbugs nyi shu rtsa lnga sna bug gnyis ka'i rab tu rgyu ba las /
translated: In the same way, when the winds move from one nostril to the other at the time of the equalizing of day and night, twenty-five winds remain, three and a half feet of inferior winds, from the complete movement of the winds in both nostrils.
