original: phye dang bcas pa'i brgya phrag bcu gsum gyi bdag nyid sna bug gcig gi rgyu ba chad par 'gyur ro zhes pa nyi ma bzhi pa'i snga dro la sna bug gzhan gyis rgyu bar 'gyur zhes song ba ni 'phros pa'o //
analyzed: phye dang bcas pa'i brgya phrag bcu gsum gyi bdag nyid sna bug gcig gi rgyu ba chad par 'gyur ro zhes pa nyi ma bzhi pa'i snga dro la sna bug gzhan gyis rgyu bar 'gyur zhes song ba ni 'phros pa'o //
translated: The statement that “the movement [of the breath] in the other nostril continues” in the morning of the fourth day is an extension.

original: skabs su bab pa brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: skabs su bab pa brjod par bya ste /
translated: Now, what is relevant should be stated.

original: rnam par gzhag pa 'di la dbyu gu'i rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: rnam par gzhag pa 'di la dbyu gu'i rnam par gzhag pa ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is the division of the hours in this presentation? It is stated:

original: rlung ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o//
analyzed: rlung ni zhes pa la sogs pa'o//
translated: The winds, etc.

original: @23b de la re zhig chu srin gyi 'pho ba la nyin mo dbyu gu'i tshad ston pa srog rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: @23b de la re zhig chu srin gyi 'pho ba la nyin mo dbyu gu'i tshad ston pa srog rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Therein, first, the teaching of the measure of the hours by the Dvādaśāyatana cycle is the life-winds, etc.

original: de rkang pa yang dag ldan pa rnams kyis zhes pa dbugs gsum po rnams kyang so sor rkang pa dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: de rkang pa yang dag ldan pa rnams kyis zhes pa dbugs gsum po rnams kyang so sor rkang pa dang ldan pa'o //
translated: “With the full complement of legs” means that each of the three breaths has legs.

original: de'i phyir chu srang lnga bcu dang dbugs gsum dang dbugs kyi rkang pa gsum ni byang bgrod kyi nyi ma'i dbyu gu gcig go //
analyzed: de'i phyir chu srang lnga bcu dang dbugs gsum dang dbugs kyi rkang pa gsum ni byang bgrod kyi nyi ma'i dbyu gu gcig go //
translated: Therefore, fifty water measures, three breaths, and three breath legs are one hour of the northward sun.

original: dbugs kyi tshogs kyis ni rkang pa gcig gis dman pa'i dbugs bzhi lhag pa'i dbugs sum brgya'o //
analyzed: dbugs kyi tshogs kyis ni rkang pa gcig gis dman pa'i dbugs bzhi lhag pa'i dbugs sum brgya'o //
translated: By the group of breaths, there are four breaths less than a foot, and three hundred extra breaths.

original: mtshan mo'i dbyug gu la ni rkang pa dang bcas pa'i dbugs lnga lhag pa'i chu srang drug cu rtsa gcig rnams so//
analyzed: mtshan mo'i dbyug gu la ni rkang pa dang bcas pa'i dbugs lnga lhag pa'i chu srang drug cu rtsa gcig rnams so//
translated: In the night staff, there are fifty-nine breaths with a foot, and sixty-one extra finger lengths.

original: dbugs kyi tshogs kyis rkang pa dang bcas pa bdun cu rtsa gcig lhag pa'i dbugs sum brgya rnams so //
analyzed: dbugs kyi tshogs kyis rkang pa dang bcas pa bdun cu rtsa gcig lhag pa'i dbugs sum brgya rnams so //
translated: By the group of breaths, there are seventy-one with a foot, and three hundred extra breaths.

original: 'di lta bu'i dbyu gu'i tshad 'dis mtshan mo sum cu rtsa gnyis zhes pa'o //
analyzed: 'di lta bu'i dbyu gu'i tshad 'dis mtshan mo sum cu rtsa gnyis zhes pa'o //
translated: By this measure of a staff, the night is thirty-two.

original: de nas nyi ma byang du bgrod pa las //
analyzed: de nas nyi ma byang du bgrod pa las //
translated: Then, from the sun moving north,

original: de ma thag tu so sor nyin mo'i dbyu gu 'phel ba dang mtshan mo'i dbyu gu 'bri bar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de ma thag tu so sor nyin mo'i dbyu gu 'phel ba dang mtshan mo'i dbyu gu 'bri bar 'gyur ro //
translated: immediately the day staff increases and the night staff decreases.

original: gal te zla ba re la ji tsam 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur zhing /
analyzed: gal te zla ba re la ji tsam 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur zhing /
translated: If it is asked how much it increases and decreases each month,

original: nyi ma so so la yang ji tsam zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: nyi ma so so la yang ji tsam zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: and how much each day, it is said:

original: dbugs rnams kyis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs rnams kyis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: By the breaths, etc.

original: zla ba gcig las dbyu gu gcig la rkang pa gcig lhag pa'i dbugs bcu gcig lhag par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: zla ba gcig las dbyu gu gcig la rkang pa gcig lhag pa'i dbugs bcu gcig lhag par 'gyur ro //
translated: In one month, the breaths increase by eleven, with one quarter added.

original: de'i phyir bco lnga pa lhag pa'i dbugs sum brgya ni bum pa'i 'pho ba'i nyin mo'i dbyu gur 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir bco lnga pa lhag pa'i dbugs sum brgya ni bum pa'i 'pho ba'i nyin mo'i dbyu gur 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the breaths that increase by fifteen, three hundred, are the ghatis of the day of the movement of the vase.

original: mtshan mo ni drug cu lhag pa'i dbugs sum brgya rnams dbyu gu gcig go //
analyzed: mtshan mo ni drug cu lhag pa'i dbugs sum brgya rnams dbyu gu gcig go //
translated: The night is three hundred breaths plus sixty.

original: de ltar 'pho ba so so la ste ji srid lhor bgrod pa'i bar du'o ;
analyzed: de ltar 'pho ba so so la ste ji srid lhor bgrod pa'i bar du'o ;
translated: Thus, it is for each movement, until the southern movement.

original: / zhag so so la ji tsam 'phel ba dang 'grib pas rkang pa dang bcas pa'i dbugs bcu gcig tu 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: / zhag so so la ji tsam 'phel ba dang 'grib pas rkang pa dang bcas pa'i dbugs bcu gcig tu 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How many breaths, with quarters, increase and decrease in each day? It is said:

original: dbugs kyi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /🔽nyi shu rtsa bzhi cha lhag pa'i dbugs sum cha 'phel lo zhes snga ma dang 'brel lo //
analyzed: dbugs kyi zhes pa la sogs pa ste / nyi shu rtsa bzhi cha lhag pa'i dbugs sum cha 'phel lo zhes snga ma dang 'brel lo //
translated: The breaths, etc.🔽One third of the breaths, with a quarter added, increase.

original: gal te dbyu gu so so la nyi shu rtsa bzhi cha lhag pa'i dbugs sum cha 'phel ba'i phyir dbyu gu sum cu rtsa gnyis kho nar 'gyur ro //
analyzed: gal te dbyu gu so so la nyi shu rtsa bzhi cha lhag pa'i dbugs sum cha 'phel ba'i phyir dbyu gu sum cu rtsa gnyis kho nar 'gyur ro //
translated: If one third of the breaths, with a quarter added, increase in each ghati, then there are only thirty-two ghatis.

original: de'i phyir chu srang gnyis so //🔽phyi rol gyi bstan bcos dang rgyud gzhan rdo rje mkha' 'gro la sogs par nyi ma so sor chu srang bzhi 'phel lo zhes 'dod do //
analyzed: de'i phyir chu srang gnyis so // phyi rol gyi bstan bcos dang rgyud gzhan rdo rje mkha' 'gro la sogs par nyi ma so sor chu srang bzhi 'phel lo zhes 'dod do //
translated: Therefore, there are two ghaṭikās.

original: gang yang chu @24a * //
analyzed: gang yang chu @24a * //
translated: In the external treatises and in other tantras, such as the Vajradāka, it is asserted that each day the sun increases by four ghaṭikās.🔽The length of a ghaṭikā is sixty kṣaṇas.

original: srang drug cu'i bdag nyid kyi dbyu gu'i tshad kyis byang du bgrod pa'i nyin mo la dbyu gu nyi shu rtsa bzhi nyid de /
analyzed: srang drug cu'i bdag nyid kyi dbyu gu'i tshad kyis byang du bgrod pa'i nyin mo la dbyu gu nyi shu rtsa bzhi nyid de /
translated: In the northern course, the day has twenty-four ghaṭikās.

original: de yang dbugs kyi grangs kyis bzhi bcu dang bcas pa drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag brgyad kyi dbugs rnams so //
analyzed: de yang dbugs kyi grangs kyis bzhi bcu dang bcas pa drug brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag brgyad kyi dbugs rnams so //
translated: That is, it has 8,460 breaths, with 600 breaths in excess.

original: rgyud 'di'i rim pas bdun brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag dgu rnams byang du bgrod pa'i nyin mo'i dbugs kyi tshogs te /
analyzed: rgyud 'di'i rim pas bdun brgya lhag pa'i stong phrag dgu rnams byang du bgrod pa'i nyin mo'i dbugs kyi tshogs te /
translated: By the method of this tantra, the total number of breaths in the northern course is 9,700.

original: de ni 'dir brgya dang bcu lhag pa'i stong phrag gcig gis mang bas khyad par ches so zhe na 'dir brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: de ni 'dir brgya dang bcu lhag pa'i stong phrag gcig gis mang bas khyad par ches so zhe na 'dir brjod par bya ste /
translated: If one says that this is a great difference, since it is 1,100 breaths in excess, we reply:

original: gnyis ka'i yul tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir skyon 'di med do //
analyzed: gnyis ka'i yul tha dad pa nyid kyi phyir skyon 'di med do //
translated: This is not a fault, because the two countries are different.

original: de ltar yang rgyud 'di ni nang gi rnam par gzhag pa ste /
analyzed: de ltar yang rgyud 'di ni nang gi rnam par gzhag pa ste /
translated: Thus this tantra is an internal presentation.🔽The winds of the sixteen branches of the movement

original: 'pho ba'i yan lag bcu drug gi / rlung ni nyin zhag gcig gis 'gyur //
analyzed: 'pho ba'i yan lag bcu drug gi / rlung ni nyin zhag gcig gis 'gyur //
translated: move in one day and night.

original: sna yi bu ga la rtag tu //
analyzed: sna yi bu ga la rtag tu //
translated: They always move

original: thun ni phyed phyed yang dag rgyu //
analyzed: thun ni phyed phyed yang dag rgyu //
translated: in the nostrils in half periods.

original: zhes bar ma chad par gsungs pa'i phyir ro //🔽de la mnyam pa'i mtshan mo dang nyin mo la rtsa drug cu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid can /
analyzed: zhes bar ma chad par gsungs pa'i phyir ro // de la mnyam pa'i mtshan mo dang nyin mo la rtsa drug cu rtsa bzhi'i bdag nyid can /
translated: This is stated without interruption.🔽In this regard, in an equal night and day, the nirmāṇacakra, which has the nature of sixty-four nāḍīs, has 30.5 movements of the vāyu in each nāḍī.

original: sprul pa'i 'khor lo rtsa re re la phyed dang bcas pa sum cu rtsa bdun lhag pa'i dbugs sum brgya rgyu ba'i rnam par gzhag pa'i rim pas rtsa drug cu rtsa bzhi rgyu ba'i phyir /
analyzed: sprul pa'i 'khor lo rtsa re re la phyed dang bcas pa sum cu rtsa bdun lhag pa'i dbugs sum brgya rgyu ba'i rnam par gzhag pa'i rim pas rtsa drug cu rtsa bzhi rgyu ba'i phyir /
translated: In the order of the presentation of the movement of the sixty-four nāḍīs,

original: dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi rnams so //
translated: there are sixty-four ghaṭīs.

original: de bzhin du rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can /
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis kyi bdag nyid can /
translated: In the same way, the saṃbhogacakra, which has the nature of thirty-two nāḍīs, has thirty-two ghaṭīs.

original: spyi bo bde pa chen po'i 'khor lo rtsa re re la de nyis 'gyur gyis bdun bcu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i dbugs drug brgya rgyu ba'i rnam par gzhag pa dang / rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis rgyu ba'i phyir chu chod sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams so //
analyzed: spyi bo bde pa chen po'i 'khor lo rtsa re re la de nyis 'gyur gyis bdun bcu rtsa lnga lhag pa'i dbugs drug brgya rgyu ba'i rnam par gzhag pa dang / rtsa sum cu rtsa gnyis rgyu ba'i phyir chu chod sum cu rtsa gnyis rnams so //
translated: In the great bliss wheel at the top of the head, each of the channels has 75 breaths more than double that, for a total of 600.

original: de bzhin du rtsa bcu drug gi bdag nyid can longs spyod 'khor lor rtsa re re la de nyis 'gyur gyis phyed dang bcas pa'i dbugs brgya phrag bcu gsum rgyu ba'i rnam par gzhag pas thun phyed bcu drug rnams so //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa bcu drug gi bdag nyid can longs spyod 'khor lor rtsa re re la de nyis 'gyur gyis phyed dang bcas pa'i dbugs brgya phrag bcu gsum rgyu ba'i rnam par gzhag pas thun phyed bcu drug rnams so //
translated: In the enjoyment wheel at the level of the throat, which has the nature of 16 channels, each channel has 1300 breaths, for a total of 20,800.

original: de bzhin du rtsa brgyad kyi bdag nyid can chos kyi 'khor lor rtsa re re la dbugs brgya phrag nyi shu rtsa bdun rgyu ba la thun brgyad do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin du rtsa brgyad kyi bdag nyid can chos kyi 'khor lor rtsa re re la dbugs brgya phrag nyi shu rtsa bdun rgyu ba la thun brgyad do zhes pa'o //
translated: In the dharma wheel at the heart, which has the nature of eight channels, each channel has 2700 breaths, for a total of 21,600.

original: de bzhin du yang brtag pa gnyis pa'i rgyal po las /
analyzed: de bzhin du yang brtag pa gnyis pa'i rgyal po las /
translated: In the same way, the second chapter of the Kalachakra Tantra states:

original: zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / a'a li dang k'a li dang 'pho ba bcu drug dang dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi dang chu tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis dang thun tshod brgyad rnams so zhes so //
analyzed: zla ba dang / nyi ma dang / a'a li dang k'a li dang 'pho ba bcu drug dang dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi dang chu tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis dang thun tshod brgyad rnams so zhes so //
translated: The moon, the sun, the vowels and consonants, the sixteen movements, the sixty-four finger lengths, the thirty-two nāḍīs, and the eight periods.🔽The Vajraḍāka and so on are external classifications because they are the primary calculations.

original: rdo rje mkha' 'gro la sogs @24b par ni rtsis kyi byed pa gtso bo nyid kyis phyi rol gyi rnam par gzhag pa'o zhes pa ste de yis 'di la 'gal ba med do //
analyzed: rdo rje mkha' 'gro la sogs @24b par ni rtsis kyi byed pa gtso bo nyid kyis phyi rol gyi rnam par gzhag pa'o zhes pa ste de yis 'di la 'gal ba med do //
translated: There is no contradiction with this.

original: yang na 'di ni phyi dang nang thun mong gi rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'di ni phyi dang nang thun mong gi rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: Or, this is a common external and internal classification.

original: de ltar yang nyi ma shar ba zhes pa la sogs pa nyin mo thun bzhi dang mtshan mo thun bzhi'i rnam par dbye ba las nyin zhag gi thun brgyad dang / thun phyed bcu drug dang / thun bzhi cha'i thun tshod kyi tshogs kyis chu tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis dang /
analyzed: de ltar yang nyi ma shar ba zhes pa la sogs pa nyin mo thun bzhi dang mtshan mo thun bzhi'i rnam par dbye ba las nyin zhag gi thun brgyad dang / thun phyed bcu drug dang / thun bzhi cha'i thun tshod kyi tshogs kyis chu tshod sum cu rtsa gnyis dang /
translated: Thus, the eight periods of day and night are divided into four periods of the day and four periods of the night, beginning with the rising of the sun. The thirty-two nāḍīs are the collection of the eight periods and the sixteen half-periods.

original: de'i tshad dbyu gu'i rnam par gzhag pas dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi rnams so //
analyzed: de'i tshad dbyu gu'i rnam par gzhag pas dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi rnams so //
translated: The measure of that is established in the form of ghaṭikās, which are sixty-four ghaṭikās.

original: zhes pa phyi rol kho na'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa phyi rol kho na'i rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: This is the external establishment.

original: dbyu gu'i tshad ni rang gi 'dod pas rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te /
analyzed: dbyu gu'i tshad ni rang gi 'dod pas rnam par gzhag pa'i phyir te /
translated: The measure of a ghaṭikā is established by one’s own desire,

original: de ltar yang bha sa ta'i rtsis mdzad pas nyin zhag gcig la dbyu gu brgya byas so //
analyzed: de ltar yang bha sa ta'i rtsis mdzad pas nyin zhag gcig la dbyu gu brgya byas so //
translated: because the astrologer Bhasata made one day sixty ghaṭikās.

original: 'dir ni dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi rnams nyid kyis nang dang thun mong gi rnam par gzhag pa yin te bshad ma thag pa ji ltar ba bzhin no//
analyzed: 'dir ni dbyu gu drug cu rtsa bzhi rnams nyid kyis nang dang thun mong gi rnam par gzhag pa yin te bshad ma thag pa ji ltar ba bzhin no//
translated: Here, the internal and common establishment is by sixty-four ghaṭikās, just as was explained immediately above.

original: de'i phyir yang 'di nyid mdzes so //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang 'di nyid mdzes so //
translated: Therefore, this is also beautiful.

original: de ltar na 'pho ba chen po bzhi ste /
analyzed: de ltar na 'pho ba chen po bzhi ste /
translated: Thus, there are four great transits,

original: gang mnyam pa gnyis dang byang du bgrod pa dang lhor bgrod pa'o //
analyzed: gang mnyam pa gnyis dang byang du bgrod pa dang lhor bgrod pa'o //
translated: which are the two equinoctial transits and the northern and southern transits.

original: de rnams la gtso bo'i phyir dang rnam par gzhag pa bya sla ba'i phyir yang mnyam pa'i dbyu gu'i nang dang phyi'i dbugs kyi mtshan nyid dang chu srang gi rnam grangs gzhan srog gi mtshan nyid sngon du 'gro ba can gyis rnam par gzhag pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de rnams la gtso bo'i phyir dang rnam par gzhag pa bya sla ba'i phyir yang mnyam pa'i dbyu gu'i nang dang phyi'i dbugs kyi mtshan nyid dang chu srang gi rnam grangs gzhan srog gi mtshan nyid sngon du 'gro ba can gyis rnam par gzhag pa gsungs pa /
translated: In order to make it easier to understand and set forth those, the characteristics of the internal and external breaths of the equalizing ghaṭikās and the characteristics of the prāṇa, which is another name for the cārus, are set forth in terms of the preliminaries.

original: srog rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: srog rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The number of breaths, and so on,

original: srog lnga bcu pa'i dbugs ji snyed pa de rnams kyis dbugs kyi grangs rim pas gzhag pa rnams dang / de'i steng du gsum rnams te dang po stong pa gzhag pas ji ltar gyur pa rnams kyis /🔽de rkang yan lag ldan rnams kyis //
analyzed: srog lnga bcu pa'i dbugs ji snyed pa de rnams kyis dbugs kyi grangs rim pas gzhag pa rnams dang / de'i steng du gsum rnams te dang po stong pa gzhag pas ji ltar gyur pa rnams kyis / de rkang yan lag ldan rnams kyis //
translated: is the number of breaths that are set forth in sequence by the breaths of the fifty prāṇas. In addition to that, there are three, and by the first empty, there are one thousand.

original: zhes pa de'i rkang pa sum cu'o //
analyzed: zhes pa de'i rkang pa sum cu'o //
translated: Those are the thirty parts of the legs.

original: de rkang de yis yang dag ldan //
analyzed: de rkang de yis yang dag ldan //
translated: Those are the legs that possess that.

original: rnams kyis mnyam pa'i dbyu gu'o //
analyzed: rnams kyis mnyam pa'i dbyu gu'o //
translated: Those are the equalizing ghaṭikās.

original: zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: That is the remainder.

original: 'di dag gis phyed dang bcas pa sum cu rtsa bdun lhag pa'i sum brgya ni mnyam pa'i dbyu gu ste snga ma bzhin no //
analyzed: 'di dag gis phyed dang bcas pa sum cu rtsa bdun lhag pa'i sum brgya ni mnyam pa'i dbyu gu ste snga ma bzhin no //
translated: These, together with the half, are the 375 equal ghatis, as before.

original: byang du bgrod pa dang lhor bgrod pa'i nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i dbyu gu rnam par dbye ba'i don du gsungs pa /
analyzed: byang du bgrod pa dang lhor bgrod pa'i nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i dbyu gu rnam par dbye ba'i don du gsungs pa /
translated: In order to divide the ghatis of the day and night of the northern and southern courses, it is said:

original: byang du bgrod pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: byang du bgrod pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The northern course, etc.

original: 'di dag gi chu srang bzhi bcu rtsa lnga rnams @25a * //
analyzed: 'di dag gi chu srang bzhi bcu rtsa lnga rnams @25a * //
translated: Here, the ghatis of the northern course of the day are 45 palas

original: kyis byang du bgrod pa'i nyin mo'i dbyu gu ste dbugs kyi tshogs kyis bdun cu lhag pa'i nyis brgyar gyur to //
analyzed: kyis byang du bgrod pa'i nyin mo'i dbyu gu ste dbugs kyi tshogs kyis bdun cu lhag pa'i nyis brgyar gyur to //
translated: of breath, which is 250 breaths.🔽The ghatis of the night are 67.5 palas,🔽which is 450 breaths.

original: mtshan mo'i dbyu gu ni phyed dang bcas pa'i chu srang drug cu rtsa bdun rnams kyis te /
analyzed: mtshan mo'i dbyu gu ni phyed dang bcas pa'i chu srang drug cu rtsa bdun rnams kyis te /
translated: The ghatis of the southern course of the day are 67.5 palas,

original: dbugs kyi tshogs kyis ni lha lnga lhag pa'i bzhi brgya yis so ;
analyzed: dbugs kyi tshogs kyis ni lha lnga lhag pa'i bzhi brgya yis so ;
translated: which is 450 breaths.

original: / byang du bgrod pa'i nyin mo'i dbyu gu ji lta pa de bzhin du lhor bgrod pa'i mtshan mo'i dbyu gu'o //
analyzed: / byang du bgrod pa'i nyin mo'i dbyu gu ji lta pa de bzhin du lhor bgrod pa'i mtshan mo'i dbyu gu'o //
translated: The ghatis of the southern course of the night are 45 palas,🔽which is 250 breaths.

original: de dag 'gyur ba ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: de dag 'gyur ba ji ltar zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How do they change? It is said:

original: dbyu gu dbyu gur zhes pa mdor bstan pa ste /
analyzed: dbyu gu dbyu gur zhes pa mdor bstan pa ste /
translated: The hours are in the hours. This is the brief presentation.

original: de'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i rgyas par bshad pa gsungs pa /
translated: The extensive explanation is stated:

original: dbugs rnams kyis zhes pa la sogs pa ste //
analyzed: dbugs rnams kyis zhes pa la sogs pa ste //
translated: By the breaths, etc.

original: drag po rkang pa dang bcas pa rnams dang // drag po rkang pa dang bcas pa rnams te //
analyzed: drag po rkang pa dang bcas pa rnams dang // drag po rkang pa dang bcas pa rnams te //
translated: The breaths of Mars and Mercury, and the breaths of Mars and Jupiter,

original: de rnams kyis 'pho ba so so la 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de rnams kyis 'pho ba so so la 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur ro //
translated: increase and decrease in each revolution.

original: 'di dag gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'di dag gsungs pa /
translated: This is stated:

original: srang gi 'pho ba la sogs pa byang du bgrod pa ji srid pa dang / lug gi 'pho ba la sogs pa lhor bgrod pa ji srid par 'pho ba gsum gyis 'phro ba so sor dbyu gu re re la phyed dang bcas pa'i dbugs nyi shu rtsa gnyis rnams mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i rnam par dbye bas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin
analyzed: srang gi 'pho ba la sogs pa byang du bgrod pa ji srid pa dang / lug gi 'pho ba la sogs pa lhor bgrod pa ji srid par 'pho ba gsum gyis 'phro ba so sor dbyu gu re re la phyed dang bcas pa'i dbugs nyi shu rtsa gnyis rnams mtshan mo dang nyin mo'i rnam par dbye bas rim pa ji lta ba bzhin
translated: For as long as the ascendant of Aries, etc. moves north, and for as long as the ascendant of Aries, etc. moves south, in each revolution, by the three ascendants, in each hour, twenty-two and a half breaths, by the division into night and day, in order,

original: 'phel ba dang bri ba dang / bri ba dang 'phel ba dag gis phyed dang bcas pa'i dbugs drug cu rtsa bdun 'phel ba dang 'bri ba las kyang ji ltar brjod pa'i dbyu gu nyid du 'gyur ro //
analyzed: 'phel ba dang bri ba dang / bri ba dang 'phel ba dag gis phyed dang bcas pa'i dbugs drug cu rtsa bdun 'phel ba dang 'bri ba las kyang ji ltar brjod pa'i dbyu gu nyid du 'gyur ro //
translated: By the increase and decrease, and the decrease and increase, of the half-breath, there is the increase and decrease of sixty-seven breaths, and from that, the above-mentioned ghatis.

original: gal te zhag so sor mtshan mo dbyu gu gcig la ji tsam 'phel ba dang / nyin mo dbyu gu gcig la ji tsam 'grib pas zla ba gcig gi phyed dang bcas pa'i dbugs nyi shu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur zhe na /
analyzed: gal te zhag so sor mtshan mo dbyu gu gcig la ji tsam 'phel ba dang / nyin mo dbyu gu gcig la ji tsam 'grib pas zla ba gcig gi phyed dang bcas pa'i dbugs nyi shu rtsa gnyis su 'gyur zhe na /
translated: If, in each day, the increase by the amount of one ghatika at night and the decrease by the amount of one ghatika in the day, how many breaths are there in half a month?

original: dbugs kyi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dbugs kyi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The verse says, “The third part of the breath.”

original: dbugs kyi sum cha ni cha shas gsum ste de yis so //
analyzed: dbugs kyi sum cha ni cha shas gsum ste de yis so //
translated: The third part of the breath is three parts.

original: dbyu gu drug cu rtsa gnyis rnams kyis ji tsam gyis 'phel ba dang 'bri bar 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: dbyu gu drug cu rtsa gnyis rnams kyis ji tsam gyis 'phel ba dang 'bri bar 'gyur zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: By how much do the sixty-two ghatis increase and decrease? It is said,

original: de rkang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de rkang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “The foot.”

original: rkang yig ni zla ba 'phel ba bsdus pas rjes su 'gugs pa'i don to //
analyzed: rkang yig ni zla ba 'phel ba bsdus pas rjes su 'gugs pa'i don to //
translated: The foot is the increase of the moon, and it has the sense of attraction.

original: zla ba 'phel ba bsdus pa nyid rkang pa drug chas zhes pa chu srang gi rkang pas dbugs kyi rkang ba drug gi bdag nyid can gyis phyed dang bcas pa'i dbugs dang lhan cig go //
analyzed: zla ba 'phel ba bsdus pa nyid rkang pa drug chas zhes pa chu srang gi rkang pas dbugs kyi rkang ba drug gi bdag nyid can gyis phyed dang bcas pa'i dbugs dang lhan cig go //
translated: The waxing and waning of the moon is just that, with six pādas. With six pādas of breath, together with a half-breath, by the pāda of a ghaṭikā.

original: 'di dag @25b gis dbyu gu gsum cu rtsa gnyis rnams kyis mtshan mo dang nyin mo so so la dbugs nyi shu rtsa bzhis 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
analyzed: 'di dag @25b gis dbyu gu gsum cu rtsa gnyis rnams kyis mtshan mo dang nyin mo so so la dbugs nyi shu rtsa bzhis 'phel ba dang 'grib par 'gyur ro zhes bshad pa yin no //
translated: This explains that in each night and day, the breaths increase and decrease by twenty-four, by the thirty-two nāḍīs.

original: rnal mang gnas pa'i gnas skabs bstan nas /
analyzed: rnal mang gnas pa'i gnas skabs bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the state of abiding in the natural state,

original: bzlog pa dang de'i 'bras bu yang gsungs pa /
analyzed: bzlog pa dang de'i 'bras bu yang gsungs pa /
translated: the reversal and its result are also explained.

original: thun ni phyed zhes pa la sogs pa go sla'o //
analyzed: thun ni phyed zhes pa la sogs pa go sla'o //
translated: The half-period, and so on, are easy to understand.

original: 'gyur ldan zhes pa nyi ma drug rgyun nyi shu rtsa bzhi chad pa'i lo gsum las so //
analyzed: 'gyur ldan zhes pa nyi ma drug rgyun nyi shu rtsa bzhi chad pa'i lo gsum las so //
translated: The “changing” is from three years, with twenty-four days of the sun’s movement interrupted.

original: nyi ma bdun rgyu bas de nyis 'gyur chad pa las so //
analyzed: nyi ma bdun rgyu bas de nyis 'gyur chad pa las so //
translated: From seven suns moving, that is interrupted by twice that.

original: nyi ma brgyad rgyu bas nyi shu rtsa bzhi sum 'gyur chad pa las so //
analyzed: nyi ma brgyad rgyu bas nyi shu rtsa bzhi sum 'gyur chad pa las so //
translated: From eight suns moving, that is interrupted by three times twenty-four.

original: nyi ma dgu rgyu bas nyi shu rtsa bzhi bzhi 'gyur chad pa'i lo gsum las te /
analyzed: nyi ma dgu rgyu bas nyi shu rtsa bzhi bzhi 'gyur chad pa'i lo gsum las te /
translated: The three years are from the twenty-four [breaths] that are subtracted by the movement of the nine suns.

original: skad cig gang la sna bug gzhan du 'pho ba'i skad cig de la 'chi'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: skad cig gang la sna bug gzhan du 'pho ba'i skad cig de la 'chi'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that at the instant when the nostril switches, one dies.

original: de ltar gzhan du yang 'gyur ldan zhes pa'i tshig gi don to //
analyzed: de ltar gzhan du yang 'gyur ldan zhes pa'i tshig gi don to //
translated: Thus, it is the meaning of the word “also” [in the root tantra].

original: dus ma yin pa dang dus kyi 'chi ba nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: dus ma yin pa dang dus kyi 'chi ba nye bar bstan nas /
translated: Having taught untimely and timely death,

original: de slu ba nye bar ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de slu ba nye bar ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: he states the teaching on deceiving them.

original: chog bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: chog bzhin zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: [The root tantra] states, “as much as one likes,” and so on.

original: rtsa zhes pa la la n'a dang ra sa n'a yang ste /
analyzed: rtsa zhes pa la la n'a dang ra sa n'a yang ste /
translated: “ Channel” [refers to] lalanā and rasanā.

original: 'di dag ni 'chi ba slu ba'i yan lag go //
analyzed: 'di dag ni 'chi ba slu ba'i yan lag go //
translated: These are the branches of deceiving death.

original: slu ba'i cho ga ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: slu ba'i cho ga ni 'chad par 'gyur ro //
translated: The rite of deceiving [death] will be explained.

original: bshad pa'i nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i dbugs ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: bshad pa'i nyin mo dang mtshan mo'i dbugs ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: The explanation of the exhalation in the day and night is stated:

original: drug brgya rnams kyis lhag pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: drug brgya rnams kyis lhag pa'i zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Exceeding six hundred,” and so on.

original: da ni gzhan yang rlung gi rnal 'byor pa'i zhi ba la sogs pa'i las 'grub pa'i yan lag gsungs pa /
analyzed: da ni gzhan yang rlung gi rnal 'byor pa'i zhi ba la sogs pa'i las 'grub pa'i yan lag gsungs pa /
translated: Now, moreover, the branches of the yogi’s accomplishment of the activities of pacifying and so on are stated:

original: dbang chen zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dbang chen zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The great power, etc.

original: dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor la byas pas rgyas pa la sogs pa'i las so //
analyzed: dbang chen gyi dkyil 'khor la byas pas rgyas pa la sogs pa'i las so //
translated: Since it is done on the mandala of the great power, it is the rite of increase, etc.

original: de ltar / chu yis don rnams yang dag 'byung //
analyzed: de ltar / chu yis don rnams yang dag 'byung //
translated: Thus, the aims are perfectly accomplished by water.

original: zhes pa zhi ba la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa zhi ba la sogs pa mngon par 'dod pa'i 'bras bu 'grub pa'o //
translated: The desired result, such as pacification, is accomplished.

original: bkres skom zhes pa me'i dkyil 'khor la rlung rgyu na drag po'i las 'grub po zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bkres skom zhes pa me'i dkyil 'khor la rlung rgyu na drag po'i las 'grub po zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning of hunger and thirst is that if the wind moves on the mandala of fire, the rite of violence is accomplished.

original: drag po'i las nyid kyis bye brag bskrad pa la sogs pa rlung las 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa rlung las zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: drag po'i las nyid kyis bye brag bskrad pa la sogs pa rlung las 'grub par 'gyur ro zhes gsungs pa rlung las zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The specific rite of violence, such as expulsion, etc., is accomplished by the wind. This is stated by from the wind, etc.

original: dbang chen zhes pa dbang chen la'o //
analyzed: dbang chen zhes pa dbang chen la'o //
translated: The great power is on the great power.

original: rnyed pa zhes pa rdzas kyi rnyed pa la'o //
analyzed: rnyed pa zhes pa rdzas kyi rnyed pa la'o //
translated: The acquisition is the acquisition of wealth.

original: de thob pa ni rab tu thob pa ste drug pa'i don la dang po'o //
analyzed: de thob pa ni rab tu thob pa ste drug pa'i don la dang po'o //
translated: The attainment of that is the attainment of the first in the sense of the sixth case.

original: sdud pa byed pa 'gro'o zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: sdud pa byed pa 'gro'o zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: The remainder is the agent of attraction goes.

original: chu skyes la sogs pa yang @26a * //
analyzed: chu skyes la sogs pa yang @26a * //
translated: Lotus, etc., is the lotus, the moon, and the sun.

original: ltad mo rnams kyi dbang du byas te'o //
analyzed: ltad mo rnams kyi dbang du byas te'o //
translated: In terms of the spectators, it is the supreme yoga.

original: de'i phyir rnal 'byor mchog gtso bo rlung gi de nyid ces sngar byas te /
analyzed: de'i phyir rnal 'byor mchog gtso bo rlung gi de nyid ces sngar byas te /
translated: Therefore, it was said previously that the reality of the winds is the chief thing.

original: ci 'dra ba'i rlung gi de nyid gtso bo yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ci 'dra ba'i rlung gi de nyid gtso bo yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: What kind of reality of the winds is chief? It is said:

original: rdo rje sems dpa'i gsung ji bzhin //
analyzed: rdo rje sems dpa'i gsung ji bzhin //
translated: Just like the speech of Vajrasattva.

original: zhes pa ji ltar bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas gsungs pa de ltar mchog nyid do zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ji ltar bcom ldan 'das rdo rje sems dpas gsungs pa de ltar mchog nyid do zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It means that just as the Bhagavat Vajrasattva has spoken, so it is supreme.

original: yang na ji ltar rdo rje sems dpa'i gsung rnam pa thams cad du mi slu ba nyid kyis mchog tu tshad mar gyur pa de bzhin du bshad pa dang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rlung gi de nyid kyang gsungs so zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: yang na ji ltar rdo rje sems dpa'i gsung rnam pa thams cad du mi slu ba nyid kyis mchog tu tshad mar gyur pa de bzhin du bshad pa dang 'chad par 'gyur ba'i rlung gi de nyid kyang gsungs so zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: Or else, it is thought that just as the speech of Vajrasattva is supreme authority because it is completely nondeceptive, so also the reality of the winds, which will be explained and which has been explained, is spoken by him.

original: gzhan gyis dris pa las rnal 'byor bas dge ba dang mi dge ba shes par bya'o zhes dris pa shes par bya ba'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
analyzed: gzhan gyis dris pa las rnal 'byor bas dge ba dang mi dge ba shes par bya'o zhes dris pa shes par bya ba'i dbang du byas te gsungs pa /
translated: In terms of the questioner, it is said: The yogi should know virtue and nonvirtue from the questions of others.

original: rlung zhes pa la sogs ba ste go sla'o //
analyzed: rlung zhes pa la sogs ba ste go sla'o //
translated: The meaning is easy to understand.

original: gnas skabs las 'gyur ba'i rlung gi dbye ba bstan nas rang bzhin gyi rlung gi de nyid nye bar ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: gnas skabs las 'gyur ba'i rlung gi dbye ba bstan nas rang bzhin gyi rlung gi de nyid nye bar ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: Having taught the classification of the wind of change in the situation, he teaches the reality of the natural wind.

original: srog ces pa la sogs pa ste rnam par rgyu zhes pa dkyil 'khor gcig nyid la 'od zer lnga'i rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: srog ces pa la sogs pa ste rnam par rgyu zhes pa dkyil 'khor gcig nyid la 'od zer lnga'i rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The life-force and so on. Moving means the five Tathagatas, who are of the nature of the five lights in the one mandala.

original: g-yas nas zhes pa sna bug gcig kho na'i g-yas kyi cha las te /
analyzed: g-yas nas zhes pa sna bug gcig kho na'i g-yas kyi cha las te /
translated: The right means from the right side of the one nostril.

original: de ltar g-yon gyi cha las so //
analyzed: de ltar g-yon gyi cha las so //
translated: Likewise, from the left side.

original: gnyis las zhes pa ni gnyis ka'i dbus kyi cha las so //🔽'og ma zhes pa drang po'i 'og dang phyogs la reg pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis las zhes pa ni gnyis ka'i dbus kyi cha las so // 'og ma zhes pa drang po'i 'og dang phyogs la reg pa'o //
translated: From both means from the middle of both.🔽 The lower means below the straight line, touching the direction.

original: dal bu rab tu rgyu ba ces pa bsil ba 'jam pa myur ba ma yin par 'gro ba'o //
analyzed: dal bu rab tu rgyu ba ces pa bsil ba 'jam pa myur ba ma yin par 'gro ba'o //
translated: Moving slowly means moving gently, not quickly.

original: rdo rje mgon po ni mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: rdo rje mgon po ni mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The vajra lord is Akshobhya.

original: lus kun la ni rjes 'gro zhes pa nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin nyid kyis khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: lus kun la ni rjes 'gro zhes pa nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor gyi rang bzhin nyid kyis khyab pa nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: Following the whole body means pervading with the nature of the space mandala.

original: 'di dag nyid srog la sogs pa'i rlung lnga po rnams so //🔽de la 'od dpag med kyi bdag nyid kyi rlung gyen du mgrin pa la gnas so //
analyzed: 'di dag nyid srog la sogs pa'i rlung lnga po rnams so // de la 'od dpag med kyi bdag nyid kyi rlung gyen du mgrin pa la gnas so //
translated: These are the five winds, life-wind, etc.🔽The wind of Amitābha is the upward-moving wind, located in the throat.

original: don yod grub pa'i bdag nyid mnyam gnas lte ba la gnas so //
analyzed: don yod grub pa'i bdag nyid mnyam gnas lte ba la gnas so //
translated: The wind of Amoghasiddhi is the fire-accompanying wind, located in the navel.

original: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi bdag nyid thur ser gsang ba la'o//
analyzed: rin chen 'byung ldan gyi bdag nyid thur ser gsang ba la'o//
translated: The wind of Ratnasaṃbhava is the downward-voiding wind, located in the genitals.

original: mi bskyod pa'i bdag nyid srog snying ga la gnas so //
analyzed: mi bskyod pa'i bdag nyid srog snying ga la gnas so //
translated: The wind of Akṣobhya is the life-upholding wind, located in the heart.

original: rnam par snang mdzad kyi bdag nyid khyab byed de de'i gnas ni brjod zin to //
analyzed: rnam par snang mdzad kyi bdag nyid khyab byed de de'i gnas ni brjod zin to //
translated: The wind of Vairocana is the pervading wind, and its location has been stated.

original: rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin sgrol ma'i yab nyid kyis don yod grub pa thog mar ston par rigs pa la /
analyzed: rlung gi khams kyi rang bzhin sgrol ma'i yab nyid kyis don yod grub pa thog mar ston par rigs pa la /
translated: It is reasonable that Amoghasiddhi, the nature of the wind element, should be taught first, since the father of Tārā is Amoghasiddhi.

original: rdo rje'i bzlas pa'i rim pa gsung rdo rje'i dbang @26b du byas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rdo rje'i bzlas pa'i rim pa gsung rdo rje'i dbang @26b du byas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: But it is taught last because the stage of vajra repetition is the consecration of the speech vajra.

original: dang po 'od dpag med kyis bstan to //
analyzed: dang po 'od dpag med kyis bstan to //
translated: Therefore Amitābha is taught first.

original: gal te khyab byed du grags pa nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor gyi rgyu ba ma brjod pa ji ltar zhe na mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gal te khyab byed du grags pa nam mkha'i dkyil 'khor gyi rgyu ba ma brjod pa ji ltar zhe na mi srid pa'i phyir ro //
translated: If it is asked why the movement in the middle of the maṇḍala, which is known as the pervader, is not mentioned, it is because it is impossible.

original: de ltar na ji lta ba bzhin du dkyil 'khor la rgyu ba rnam par gzhag ce na /
analyzed: de ltar na ji lta ba bzhin du dkyil 'khor la rgyu ba rnam par gzhag ce na /
translated: As such, if it is asked how the movement in the maṇḍala is arranged,

original: dkyil 'khor bzhi'i rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyis so //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bzhi'i rjes su 'gro ba nyid kyis so //
translated: it is because it follows the four maṇḍalas.

original: de ltar yang rkang pa dang bcas pa nyis brgya'i bdag nyid can dkyil 'khor gcig rgyu ba la /
analyzed: de ltar yang rkang pa dang bcas pa nyis brgya'i bdag nyid can dkyil 'khor gcig rgyu ba la /
translated: As such, in the movement of one maṇḍala, which is two hundred with the legs,

original: dbugs sum cu gcig dang sum cu rtsa gcig gi de ma thag bdud kyi bu mor brjod pa'i rtsa la dbugs re re rgyu ba'i phyir dang lhag ma dbugs gcig gi phyed rgyu ba'i phyir yang bskor ba bdun rnams kyis phyed dang bcas pa'i dbugs bdun khyab byed🔽kyi rgyu'o zhes rnam par gzhag pa'o //
analyzed: dbugs sum cu gcig dang sum cu rtsa gcig gi de ma thag bdud kyi bu mor brjod pa'i rtsa la dbugs re re rgyu ba'i phyir dang lhag ma dbugs gcig gi phyed rgyu ba'i phyir yang bskor ba bdun rnams kyis phyed dang bcas pa'i dbugs bdun khyab byed kyi rgyu'o zhes rnam par gzhag pa'o //
translated: because there is movement of one breath in each of the nāḍīs called the daughters of Māra, which are thirty-one and thirty-one, and because there is movement of half of one breath in the remainder, the seven circuits pervade seven and a half breaths.

original: des na gtso bo rgyu ba ni dkyil 'khor bzhi kho na'o //
analyzed: des na gtso bo rgyu ba ni dkyil 'khor bzhi kho na'o //
translated: The movement of the principal one is only the four maṇḍalas.

original: nam mkha' yi ni de'i rjes su 'gro ba nyid de so so ma yin no //
analyzed: nam mkha' yi ni de'i rjes su 'gro ba nyid de so so ma yin no //
translated: The space element follows it, not separately.

original: gal te bu ga gang la dkyil 'khor ji tsam rgyu zhe na /
analyzed: gal te bu ga gang la dkyil 'khor ji tsam rgyu zhe na /
translated: If one asks, “How much of the maṇḍala moves through which hole?”

original: dkyil 'khor bu ga gang la thog mar rgyu zhe na brjod par bya ste /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bu ga gang la thog mar rgyu zhe na brjod par bya ste /
translated: It should be said that the maṇḍala that moves through which hole at the beginning is

original: mtshan mo dang nyin mo mnyam pa'i dkyil 'khor gcig la dbugs rnams ji snyed pa de snyed kyi chu srang gi rnam grangs gzhan srog rnams te bu ga gcig la'o //
analyzed: mtshan mo dang nyin mo mnyam pa'i dkyil 'khor gcig la dbugs rnams ji snyed pa de snyed kyi chu srang gi rnam grangs gzhan srog rnams te bu ga gcig la'o //
translated: the number of breaths in one maṇḍala, which is equal to the day and night, is the number of prāṇas, or holes.

original: de'i phyir dkyil 'khor rgyu bar 'gyur ro zhes ba bu ga'i dbye bas dkyil 'khor rgyu ba'i rim pa'o //🔽nam mkha' la sogs rtag tu g-yon //
analyzed: de'i phyir dkyil 'khor rgyu bar 'gyur ro zhes ba bu ga'i dbye bas dkyil 'khor rgyu ba'i rim pa'o // nam mkha' la sogs rtag tu g-yon //
translated: Therefore, the maṇḍala moves through the holes. This is the order of the maṇḍala moving through the holes.🔽Space and so on always move through the left.

original: g-yas su rtag tu sa la sogs //
analyzed: g-yas su rtag tu sa la sogs //
translated: Earth and so on always move through the right.

original: zhes pa'i tshig las thim pa dang 'char pa'i rim pas shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshig las thim pa dang 'char pa'i rim pas shes par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: One should understand this from the words “the order of dissolution and arising.”

original: 'chi ltas kyis zhes 'chi ba ni slu ba dag la 'bad par bya zhes pa /
analyzed: 'chi ltas kyis zhes 'chi ba ni slu ba dag la 'bad par bya zhes pa /
translated: One should strive in the deception of death through the signs of death.

original: rtul po dang 'bring dang rnon po'i dbye bas slu ba'i thabs rnam pa gsum gsungs pa rlung ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: rtul po dang 'bring dang rnon po'i dbye bas slu ba'i thabs rnam pa gsum gsungs pa rlung ni zhes pa la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
translated: The three types of methods for deceiving death are taught by the division into the dull, middling, and sharp faculties. The easy to understand words beginning with “wind” are as follows.

original: de ni bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor gyis kyang 'chi ba slu bar ma nus na 'pho ba ston pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de ni bsgom pa'i rnal 'byor gyis kyang 'chi ba slu bar ma nus na 'pho ba ston pa gsungs pa /
translated: If one is unable to deceive death even with the yoga of meditation, then the teaching of transference is stated.

original: snying ga'i zhes pa la sogs pa go 'phang 'thob ces pa'i bar du'o //
analyzed: snying ga'i zhes pa la sogs pa go 'phang 'thob ces pa'i bar du'o //
translated: The meaning of the words beginning with “heart” up to “attain the state” is as follows.

original: don ni 'di yin te lha'i rnal 'byor sngon du 'gro bas snying gar padma'i lte bar zla ba la gnas pa'i h'um yig dkar po la sems brtan par bya ste /
analyzed: don ni 'di yin te lha'i rnal 'byor sngon du 'gro bas snying gar padma'i lte bar zla ba la gnas pa'i h'um yig dkar po la sems brtan par bya ste /
translated: The meaning is this: Having first gone for refuge and generated bodhicitta, one should stabilize the mind on the white letter hūṃ, located on a moon in the center of a lotus at the heart.

original: steng dang 'og gi rlung kha sbyor gyi rang bzhin bsgom par bya'o //
analyzed: steng dang 'og gi rlung kha sbyor gyi rang bzhin bsgom par bya'o //
translated: One should meditate on the nature of the union of the upper and lower vāyus.🔽When one has a little stability in that, one should not be bound by objects and so on.

original: de la cung zad brtan pa na de la yul la sogs kyis mi 'ching zhes pa yul la sogs pa rnams kyis rnal 'byor pa @27a * //🔽'ching ba ma yin te /
analyzed: de la cung zad brtan pa na de la yul la sogs kyis mi 'ching zhes pa yul la sogs pa rnams kyis rnal 'byor pa @27a * //🔽'ching ba ma yin te /
translated: The yogī is not bound by objects and so on.

original: de la sems rab tu mi rgyu ba'i phyir yang dag par brtan pa rnams kyis brtan pa'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de la sems rab tu mi rgyu ba'i phyir yang dag par brtan pa rnams kyis brtan pa'i go 'phang thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Because the mind does not move in that, the steadfast ones attain the state of steadfastness.

original: gang gi tshe yang dag pa'i brtan pa thob par ma gyur na /
analyzed: gang gi tshe yang dag pa'i brtan pa thob par ma gyur na /
translated: When they do not attain steadfastness,

original: de'i tshe sbyor ba 'di nyid kyis 'pho bar bya ste /
analyzed: de'i tshe sbyor ba 'di nyid kyis 'pho bar bya ste /
translated: then by this very practice they should transfer.

original: de ni le'u bcu dgu pa las gsal par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de ni le'u bcu dgu pa las gsal par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: That will be clarified in the nineteenth chapter.

original: de ma thag 'chad par 'gyur ba'i le'u yis lhan cig yul gcig pa nyid yin kyang phal cher rnal mar gnas pa dang / rnal mar gnas pa ma yin pa dang / dus dang dus ma yin par 'chi ba dang / de slu ba rnams kyi rtags su gyur pa rnams bstan pa'i phyir le'u 'di tha dad pa nyid do zhes so //
analyzed: de ma thag 'chad par 'gyur ba'i le'u yis lhan cig yul gcig pa nyid yin kyang phal cher rnal mar gnas pa dang / rnal mar gnas pa ma yin pa dang / dus dang dus ma yin par 'chi ba dang / de slu ba rnams kyi rtags su gyur pa rnams bstan pa'i phyir le'u 'di tha dad pa nyid do zhes so //
translated: Although the immediately following chapter is about the same topic, this chapter is distinct in order to teach the signs of those who mostly abide naturally, those who do not abide naturally, and those who die at the right or wrong time, and to deceive them.

original: le'u lnga pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u lnga pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This completes the explanation of the fifth chapter.

original: // / lam lnga po de ni ji ltar 'gyur zhes zhus pa dgu ba'i lan gdab pa'i phyir /
analyzed: // / lam lnga po de ni ji ltar 'gyur zhes zhus pa dgu ba'i lan gdab pa'i phyir /
translated: In order to answer the ninth question, How are those five paths?

original: bshad pa'i rlung gi de nyid dkyil 'khor lnga'i bdag nyid can lha mo lnga'i rang bzhin nyid kyi khyad par gyis ston pa gsungs pa 'di las zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: bshad pa'i rlung gi de nyid dkyil 'khor lnga'i bdag nyid can lha mo lnga'i rang bzhin nyid kyi khyad par gyis ston pa gsungs pa 'di las zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The statement “from this” and so on is the teaching of the special nature.

original: sngar ni 'od zer lnga'i rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyis bstan to zhes pa slar brjod pa skyon med do //
analyzed: sngar ni 'od zer lnga'i rang bzhin de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid kyis bstan to zhes pa slar brjod pa skyon med do //
translated: It is not faulty to repeat “previously the five lights were taught to be the nature of the five tathagatas.”

original: de nyid kyi phyir la ma lnga zhes pa khams lnga po rnams zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi lam gyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro ;
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir la ma lnga zhes pa khams lnga po rnams zhi ba la sogs pa'i las kyi lam gyi rang bzhin nyid kyi phyir ro ;
translated: Therefore, the five lamas are the nature of the five elements, the path of the action of pacification, and so on.

original: / de dag nyid gsungs pa rang gzhan zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: / de dag nyid gsungs pa rang gzhan zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: Those are taught by “one’s own and others,” and so on.

original: phun tshogs zhes pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: phun tshogs zhes pa phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: “Abundance” means perfection.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi zhes pa dkyil 'khor la'o //
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi zhes pa dkyil 'khor la'o //
translated: “In the mandala” means in the mandala.

original: rgyu ba la zhes pa skabs kyi rlung gi zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rgyu ba la zhes pa skabs kyi rlung gi zhes pa'i don to //
translated: “Moving” means the context of the wind.

original: 'di ltar gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsungs te /
translated: This is stated as follows.

original: dkyil 'khor las dkyil 'khor gzhan du 'pho ba'i dus su bdud kyi bu mor brjod pa'i rtsa la dbugs phyed chad par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa de ni rnal 'byor pa'i dbu mar zhugs pa'o //🔽'di nyid la dgongs te /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor las dkyil 'khor gzhan du 'pho ba'i dus su bdud kyi bu mor brjod pa'i rtsa la dbugs phyed chad par 'gyur ro zhes gang gsungs pa de ni rnal 'byor pa'i dbu mar zhugs pa'o // 'di nyid la dgongs te /
translated: This is the entry into the central nāḍī of the yogi.

original: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpal gsang ba 'dus pa las gsungs pa /
translated: With this in mind, it is said in the glorious Guhyasamāja:

original: rig pa'i tshul gyis cho ga yis //
analyzed: rig pa'i tshul gyis cho ga yis //
translated: By the method of the knowledge,

original: thun bzhi'i rab tu sbyor ba las //
analyzed: thun bzhi'i rab tu sbyor ba las //
translated: through the application of the four periods,🔽the yogi will attain the immortal state.

original: zhes so // de nyid kyi phyir gzhan rnams kyi bdud kyi bu mo gang yin pa de rnal 'byor pa'i 'chi med bu mo zhes bla ma rnams gsung ngo //
analyzed: zhes so // de nyid kyi phyir gzhan rnams kyi bdud kyi bu mo gang yin pa de rnal 'byor pa'i 'chi med bu mo zhes bla ma rnams gsung ngo //
translated: For this very reason, the gurus say that what is the daughter of Māra for others is the immortal daughter for the yogi.

original: bdud kyi bu mo de ci /
analyzed: bdud kyi bu mo de ci /
translated: Is that daughter of Māra in the avadhūti?🔽No, it is not like that.

original: aa wa dh'u t'i yin nam zhe na de lta ma yin te 'on kyang aa wa dh'u t'i la yang dag @27b par brten pa'o //
analyzed: aa wa dh'u t'i yin nam zhe na de lta ma yin te 'on kyang aa wa dh'u t'i la yang dag @27b par brten pa'o //
translated: However, it is based in the avadhūti.

original: de ltar yang /
analyzed: de ltar yang /
translated: Thus it is said:

original: 'khyil gsum 'dod ma khyim dang ni //
analyzed: 'khyil gsum 'dod ma khyim dang ni //
translated: The three coils, the desire, the house,

original: gtum mo 'chi med bu mo'o //
analyzed: gtum mo 'chi med bu mo'o //
translated: and the caṇḍālī are the immortal daughter.

original: zhes pa'o // lnga po 'di rnams ni chos kyi 'khor lor rim pas sa la sogs pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: zhes pa'o // lnga po 'di rnams ni chos kyi 'khor lor rim pas sa la sogs pa'i khams kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: These five are the nature of the elements earth, etc., in the wheel of phenomena, in order.

original: de'i phyir dkyil 'khor las dkyil 'khor gzhan du 'pho bar mtshon par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir dkyil 'khor las dkyil 'khor gzhan du 'pho bar mtshon par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Therefore, one should understand the transference from one mandala to another mandala.

original: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
analyzed: lhag ma ni go sla'o //
translated: The rest is easy to understand.

original: 'dir sngags kyi de kho na nyid kyang nye bar bstan pa khong du chud par bya'o //
analyzed: 'dir sngags kyi de kho na nyid kyang nye bar bstan pa khong du chud par bya'o //
translated: Here, one should understand the teaching of the reality of mantra.

original: yang na gang le'u lnga par snying ga zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis bstan te /
analyzed: yang na gang le'u lnga par snying ga zhes pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis bstan te /
translated: Or, that which is taught in chapter five by three verses beginning with “heart” (I: 3-5),

original: 'dir ni rlung gi de nyid kho na'o //
analyzed: 'dir ni rlung gi de nyid kho na'o //
translated: here it is just the reality of the wind.

original: de'i phyir yang rdo rje'i bzlas pa'i rgyu sngags kyi de kho na'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang rdo rje'i bzlas pa'i rgyu sngags kyi de kho na'o //
translated: Therefore, the reality of mantra is the cause of vajra repetition.

original: de'i rgyu rlung gi de kho nas te 'bras bu'i sngon du 'gro ba bshad pa'i rim pa'o //
analyzed: de'i rgyu rlung gi de kho nas te 'bras bu'i sngon du 'gro ba bshad pa'i rim pa'o //
translated: Its cause is the reality of the wind, which is the antecedent of the effect. This is the order of explanation.

original: de'i phyir yang dang po'i lha'i rnal 'byor pas rlung gi de kho na brtag pa sngon du 'gro ba can sngags kyi de kho na'i rim pas rdo rje'i bzlas pa la yang bslab par bya'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: de'i phyir yang dang po'i lha'i rnal 'byor pas rlung gi de kho na brtag pa sngon du 'gro ba can sngags kyi de kho na'i rim pas rdo rje'i bzlas pa la yang bslab par bya'o zhes bshad par 'gyur ro //
translated: Therefore, the yogi/nī of the deity at the beginning should also train in vajra repetition by the process of mantra reality, preceded by the examination of the reality of the winds.

original: le'u drug pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /🔽// / lus kyi rang bzhin ji ltar lags //
analyzed: le'u drug pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o / // / lus kyi rang bzhin ji ltar lags //
translated: This concludes the explanation of the sixth chapter.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa zhu ba bzhi pa'i lan gdab pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa zhu ba bzhi pa'i lan gdab pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: The reply to the fourth question, “What is the nature of the body?”

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: is stated in the lines beginning with “Then.”

original: de la mang ba nyid kyi phyir re zhig rtsa'i grangs gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la mang ba nyid kyi phyir re zhig rtsa'i grangs gsungs pa /
translated: Therein, because of the many, the number of the channels is stated first:

original: bdun cu rtsa gnyis zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bdun cu rtsa gnyis zhes pa'o //
translated: “Seventy-two.”

original: de la thun mong gi rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis rnams so //
analyzed: de la thun mong gi rtsa stong phrag bdun cu rtsa gnyis rnams so //
translated: Therein, the common channels are seventy-two thousand.

original: de rnams la rlung gi bzhon pa dang rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi gtso bo nyid kyis chos dang longs spyod dang bde ba chen po dang sprul par brjod pa'i 'khor lo bzhi po rnams la /
analyzed: de rnams la rlung gi bzhon pa dang rnam par shes pa'i rten gyi gtso bo nyid kyis chos dang longs spyod dang bde ba chen po dang sprul par brjod pa'i 'khor lo bzhi po rnams la /
translated: Since those are the principal mounts of the vāyu and the support of consciousness, the four cakras are called the dharma, enjoyment, great bliss, and emanation cakras.

original: rim pa ji lta bar brgyad dang bcu drug dang sum cu rtsa gnyis dang drug cu rtsa bzhi'o zhes pa nyi shu lhag pa'i brgya ni gtso bo'o //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta bar brgyad dang bcu drug dang sum cu rtsa gnyis dang drug cu rtsa bzhi'o zhes pa nyi shu lhag pa'i brgya ni gtso bo'o //
translated: In those, there are 120 principal nāḍīs: eight, sixteen, thirty-two, and sixty-four, respectively.

original: de rnams la yang sen mo dang so la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi lus kyi khams rgyas pa dang gnas pa'i rgyu nyid kyis spyi bo la sogs pa gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni gtso bo'o //
analyzed: de rnams la yang sen mo dang so la sogs pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi lus kyi khams rgyas pa dang gnas pa'i rgyu nyid kyis spyi bo la sogs pa gnas nyi shu rtsa bzhi ni gtso bo'o //
translated: In those, there are 24 principal places, such as the crown, because the increase and the abiding of the body element are caused by the twenty-four nails, teeth, and so on.

original: de rnams thams cad la yang yang dag par sdud pa po nyid kyis gtso bo gsum mo //
analyzed: de rnams thams cad la yang yang dag par sdud pa po nyid kyis gtso bo gsum mo //
translated: In all of those, there are three principal ones because they are the compilers.

original: de la yang bde ba chen po bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid kyis dbu ma gtso bo yin no zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la yang bde ba chen po bskyed pa'i rgyu nyid kyis dbu ma gtso bo yin no zhes gsungs pa /
translated: Among those, the madhyamā is said to be the principal one because it is the cause of generating great bliss.

original: rtsa zhes pa la sogs pa sna chu 'bab pa'i zhes pa'i bar gyi don gyi bskyed pa'i rim pa ste /🔽l'u yi pa'i mngon par @28a * //
analyzed: rtsa zhes pa la sogs pa sna chu 'bab pa'i zhes pa'i bar gyi don gyi bskyed pa'i rim pa ste / l'u yi pa'i mngon par @28a * //
translated: The nāḍīs and so forth up to the flow of nasal mucus is the meaning of the generation stage.🔽In the commentary on the direct realization of the Lūipa,

original: rtogs pa'i 'grel par rab tu grags so //
analyzed: rtogs pa'i 'grel par rab tu grags so //
translated: it is well known.

original: rtsa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i khams rnams la nyi ma nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i gdan la gnas pa p'u dza la sogs pa'i yi ge nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams zla tshes dang thig le dang bcas pa bsgom par bya'o zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: rtsa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i khams rnams la nyi ma nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i gdan la gnas pa p'u dza la sogs pa'i yi ge nyi shu rtsa bzhi rnams zla tshes dang thig le dang bcas pa bsgom par bya'o zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say that one should meditate on the twenty-four syllables, such as pūja, on the seats of the twenty-four suns in the elements of the twenty-four nāḍīs, together with the crescent moon and bindu.

original: rtsa rnams kyi gtso bo dang gtso bo ma yin pa dang / grangs dang gnas dang bya ba dang / lus kyi rang bzhin yang bstan nas /
analyzed: rtsa rnams kyi gtso bo dang gtso bo ma yin pa dang / grangs dang gnas dang bya ba dang / lus kyi rang bzhin yang bstan nas /
translated: Having explained the principal and secondary nāḍīs, the number, location, function, and nature of the body,

original: lus kyi gong bu de ji ltar zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: lus kyi gong bu de ji ltar zhes bstan pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: in order to explain how that body is a whole, it is said:

original: de'i tshogs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: de'i tshogs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: the collection of those and so on.

original: de'i zhes pa de rnams kyi'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes pa de rnams kyi'o //
translated: Those refers to those.

original: tshogs kyi gong bu lha'i gzugs su yang dag par skyes pa spyi bo la sogs pa'i gnas kyi rtsa rnams kho na'i tshogs te /
analyzed: tshogs kyi gong bu lha'i gzugs su yang dag par skyes pa spyi bo la sogs pa'i gnas kyi rtsa rnams kho na'i tshogs te /
translated: The aggregate of the assembly is the perfect generation of the form of the deity, the assembly of the channels in the locations of the crown, and so forth.

original: rim pa ji lta bar rab gtum ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams so //
analyzed: rim pa ji lta bar rab gtum ma la sogs pa'i lha mo rnams so //
translated: The goddesses such as Prachaṇḍā are in the sequence of the channels.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Therefore it is said:

original: gzugs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “form” and so forth.

original: gzugs ni rang bzhin gyi gzugs so //
analyzed: gzugs ni rang bzhin gyi gzugs so //
translated: “Form” is the natural form.

original: gong bu zhes pa lus so //
analyzed: gong bu zhes pa lus so //
translated: “Aggregate” is the body.

original: gong bu las 'das pa yang 'od gsal te de nyid lha'o //
analyzed: gong bu las 'das pa yang 'od gsal te de nyid lha'o //
translated: “Beyond the aggregate” is clear light, which is the deity.

original: de dag nyid nye bar sdud pa de phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid nye bar sdud pa de phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The summary of those is “therefore” and so forth.

original: 'di ltar gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsungs te /
translated: This is what is said:

original: bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom pa po nang gi bdag nyid rnam par dag pa rtogs te /
analyzed: bskyed pa'i rim pa sgom pa po nang gi bdag nyid rnam par dag pa rtogs te /
translated: The meditator on the creation stage realizes the inner nature of purity.

original: phyi rol gzhal yas khang gi nang du lha sum cu rtsa bdun gyi 'khor lo cho ga bzhin rnam par bsgoms nas ye shes sems dpa'i dga' ba'i sgras yang dag par bkug pa'i 'gro ba dur khrod la'o //
analyzed: phyi rol gzhal yas khang gi nang du lha sum cu rtsa bdun gyi 'khor lo cho ga bzhin rnam par bsgoms nas ye shes sems dpa'i dga' ba'i sgras yang dag par bkug pa'i 'gro ba dur khrod la'o //
translated: Having meditated on the mandala of thirty-seven deities in the outer celestial mansion according to the rite, the beings summoned by the sound of the gnosis-being’s joy enter the charnel ground.

original: de dam tshig gi 'khor lo la'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i rim pas snang ba med par bya ste /
analyzed: de dam tshig gi 'khor lo la'o zhes pa la sogs pa'i rim pas snang ba med par bya ste /
translated: That is in the commitment wheel and so forth, the stages of making [the deities] invisible.

original: rtog pa dang bral ba de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis gnas nas yang dang yang de las ldang ba dang 'jug pa rnams te /
analyzed: rtog pa dang bral ba de bzhin nyid kyi rang bzhin gyis gnas nas yang dang yang de las ldang ba dang 'jug pa rnams te /
translated: Having remained in the nature of reality free from conceptuality, again and again one arises from that and enters.

original: de dang ro gcig pa thob nas mthar thug pa na bag chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba ldang ba dang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de dang ro gcig pa thob nas mthar thug pa na bag chags dang bral bar 'gyur ba ldang ba dang gnyis su med pa'i ye shes thob par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: Having attained one taste with that, in the end one becomes free from latent tendencies and attains the gnosis of nondual arising.

original: yang na gang rab gtum ma la sogs pa'i lha mo 'di rnams gzhal yas khang gi nang du rnam par bsgoms pa de rnams nyid tshogs pa ste /
analyzed: yang na gang rab gtum ma la sogs pa'i lha mo 'di rnams gzhal yas khang gi nang du rnam par bsgoms pa de rnams nyid tshogs pa ste /
translated: Or else, the assembly of these goddesses, such as Prachaṇḍā, and so on, who are visualized inside the celestial mansion,

original: gong bu zhes pa spyi bo la sogs pa rnams la kun du bsdus pa'i lha'i bdag nyid yang dag par skyes pa'o //
analyzed: gong bu zhes pa spyi bo la sogs pa rnams la kun du bsdus pa'i lha'i bdag nyid yang dag par skyes pa'o //
translated: are the aggregate, the nature of the deity that is completely gathered at the crown, and so on.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
translated: For that very reason, it is said:

original: gzugs las 'das pa zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs las 'das pa zhes pa ste /
translated: Beyond form.

original: @28b phyag dang zhal gyi rnam pa yongs su spangs pas rtsa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: @28b phyag dang zhal gyi rnam pa yongs su spangs pas rtsa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Because of the complete abandonment of the forms of hands and faces, they are realized as having the nature of channels.

original: gong bu zhes pa lus so //
analyzed: gong bu zhes pa lus so //
translated: The “aggregate” is the body.

original: don 'di yin te /
analyzed: don 'di yin te /
translated: The meaning is this.

original: dang po 'di rnams gzhal yas khang la gnas nas spro ba dang bsdu bas 'gro ba'i don byas te /🔽de nas lus la rtsa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rtog pa dang bral ba /
analyzed: dang po 'di rnams gzhal yas khang la gnas nas spro ba dang bsdu bas 'gro ba'i don byas te / de nas lus la rtsa'i rang bzhin du rtogs pa'i rnal 'byor pa rtog pa dang bral ba /
translated: First, these [deities] abide in the celestial mansion, and through emanating and reabsorbing, they perform the welfare of living beings.

original: de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub skyed par byed do zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin phyag rgya chen po'i dngos grub skyed par byed do zhes pa'o //
translated: Then, the yogī who realizes them as having the nature of channels in the body, free from conceptualization, generates the spiritual power of mahāmudrā, the nature of great bliss, which is of one taste with suchness.

original: de nyid kyi phyir de gsal ba zhes pa lha de rnams so //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir de gsal ba zhes pa lha de rnams so //
translated: Therefore, “that clarity” is those deities.

original: de dag nyid nye bar sdud pa de phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de dag nyid nye bar sdud pa de phyir zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Their reabsorption” is “therefore” and so forth.

original: 'bras bu gsungs pa /
analyzed: 'bras bu gsungs pa /
translated: The result is stated:

original: gang gi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: gang gi zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: “Whoever” and so forth.

original: thob 'gyur zhes pa 'thob par byed pa'o //
analyzed: thob 'gyur zhes pa 'thob par byed pa'o //
translated: “Will attain” means will cause attainment.

original: yang na / de yi tshogs las yang dag skyes //
analyzed: yang na / de yi tshogs las yang dag skyes //
translated: Or, “arisen from the perfect assembly of those”

original: zhes pa de rnams kyi tshogs pa las yang dag skyes pa'i rim pas dz'a landha ra las /
analyzed: zhes pa de rnams kyi tshogs pa las yang dag skyes pa'i rim pas dz'a landha ra las /
translated: The aggregate of those is the group.

original: smin ma dang mgrin pa dang snying ga dang rdo rje nor bu'i rtse mo'i bar du skyes bar gyur pa'o //
analyzed: smin ma dang mgrin pa dang snying ga dang rdo rje nor bu'i rtse mo'i bar du skyes bar gyur pa'o //
translated: The arising is the arising from Jalandhara, up to the eyebrows, throat, heart, and the tip of the vajra jewel.

original: gong bu ni gcig tu gyur pa ste rtsa rnams thams cad lhas lha'i bdag nyid can bde ba chen pos rol pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: gong bu ni gcig tu gyur pa ste rtsa rnams thams cad lhas lha'i bdag nyid can bde ba chen pos rol pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The unit is the one, because all the channels are the nature of the deity, and the great bliss plays.

original: gzugs las 'das pa ni dmigs pa las 'das pa ste /
analyzed: gzugs las 'das pa ni dmigs pa las 'das pa ste /
translated: The form beyond is beyond the object,

original: de las mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de las mi 'gyur ba'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not change from that.

original: gong bu zhes pa la lus thams cad khyab pa las rang gi gnas thob pa'o //
analyzed: gong bu zhes pa la lus thams cad khyab pa las rang gi gnas thob pa'o //
translated: The unit is the pervasion of the entire body, and the attainment of one's own place.

original: gong bu las 'das pa zhes pa stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa bde ba chen po nyid thob pa'i phyir de nyid lha'o //
analyzed: gong bu las 'das pa zhes pa stong pa nyid dang ro gcig pa bde ba chen po nyid thob pa'i phyir de nyid lha'o //
translated: The unit beyond is the attainment of the great bliss that is one taste with emptiness, and that is the deity.

original: de'i phyir zhes pa ji ltar gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
analyzed: de'i phyir zhes pa ji ltar gyur pa'i rang bzhin gyis so //
translated: Therefore means in that way, by nature.

original: bsam gyis mi khyab sbyor bas rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas so //
analyzed: bsam gyis mi khyab sbyor bas rnam par rtog pa dang bral bas so //
translated: The inconceivable union is free from conceptuality.

original: kun 'gro de bzhin nyid rang bzhin //
analyzed: kun 'gro de bzhin nyid rang bzhin //
translated: The all-pervading is suchness, the nature.

original: zhes pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin thams cad du 'gro ba'i skur 'gyur ro zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes pa stong pa nyid kyi rang bzhin thams cad du 'gro ba'i skur 'gyur ro zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: The nature of emptiness becomes the body that goes everywhere.

original: de'i byed pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: de'i byed pa gsungs pa /
translated: The function of that is stated:

original: gang zhes pa la sogs pa ste de'i bdag nyid ces pa bde ba dam pa'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin thob nas so //
analyzed: gang zhes pa la sogs pa ste de'i bdag nyid ces pa bde ba dam pa'i bdag nyid kyi rang bzhin thob nas so //
translated: Having attained the nature of that, which is the nature of supreme bliss,

original: thob 'gyur zhes pa sems can rnams la thob par byed ces pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: thob 'gyur zhes pa sems can rnams la thob par byed ces pa lhag ma'o //
translated: one becomes the bestower of that to sentient beings.

original: yang na gsungs ba'i bye brag rnams dang rgyud gzhan rnams las kyang ste /
analyzed: yang na gsungs ba'i bye brag rnams dang rgyud gzhan rnams las kyang ste /
translated: Or, from the various statements and other tantras,

original: gang yang rung bas rab tu byed pa gcig gis 'od gsal gyi go 'phang la gnas te /
analyzed: gang yang rung bas rab tu byed pa gcig gis 'od gsal gyi go 'phang la gnas te /
translated: one should abide in the state of clear light by any means,

original: de'i rang bzhin kho nas dpal he ru ka la sogs pa gcig pa @29a * //
analyzed: de'i rang bzhin kho nas dpal he ru ka la sogs pa gcig pa @29a * //
translated: and by that nature alone, one becomes one with Śrī Heruka, etc.

original: nyid kyi phyir de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig pa lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin thob nas rnam par rtog pa med pa kho nar gdul bya thams cad la mngon par 'dod pa'i gzugs ston pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir gzugs sna tshogs pa'i nor
analyzed: nyid kyi phyir de bzhin nyid dang ro gcig pa lhan cig skyes pa'i bde ba chen po'i rang bzhin thob nas rnam par rtog pa med pa kho nar gdul bya thams cad la mngon par 'dod pa'i gzugs ston pa'i rgyu nyid kyi phyir gzugs sna tshogs pa'i nor
translated: Having attained the nature of coemergent great bliss, which is of one taste with suchness, one is solely nonconceptual, and because one is the cause for displaying forms that are desired by all disciples, one is the jewel of various forms.🔽

original: bu lta bu dang / 'gro ba'i bsam ba rab tu rdzogs par byed pa nyid kyi phyir yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu'i sangs rgyas rnal 'byor pas yang dag par thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: bu lta bu dang / 'gro ba'i bsam ba rab tu rdzogs par byed pa nyid kyi phyir yid bzhin gyi nor bu lta bu'i sangs rgyas rnal 'byor pas yang dag par thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: Having attained the nature of coemergent great bliss, which is of one taste with suchness, the yogi of the Buddha will attain the state of a buddha, which is like a jewel of various forms, because it is the cause for displaying forms that are desired by all disciples, and which is like a wish-fulfilling jewel, because it completely fulfills the wishes of beings.

original: lam gyi tshul mtha' yas pa nyid las mi 'thad pa cung zad kyang med do zhes pa /
analyzed: lam gyi tshul mtha' yas pa nyid las mi 'thad pa cung zad kyang med do zhes pa /
translated: There is not the slightest inconsistency in the infinite ways of the path.

original: bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das kyi dgongs pa'o //
translated: This is the intention of the Bhagavān.

original: de gsungs pa ;
analyzed: de gsungs pa ;
translated: He states:

original: tshul la mkhas pa rnams kyis de la cung zad smad par mi bya ste //
analyzed: tshul la mkhas pa rnams kyis de la cung zad smad par mi bya ste //
translated: Those skilled in the way should not criticize it in the least.

original: 'gro ba rnams la dpag med thabs ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs //
analyzed: 'gro ba rnams la dpag med thabs ni rdzogs pa'i sangs rgyas rnams kyis gsungs //
translated: The perfect buddhas have taught immeasurable methods for beings.

original: zhes so // le'u bdun pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: zhes so // le'u bdun pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: The seventh chapter has been commented upon.

original: // / dam tshig zhes pa la sogs pa zhu ba bcu bzhi pa'i lan gdab pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / dam tshig zhes pa la sogs pa zhu ba bcu bzhi pa'i lan gdab pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: The reply to the fourteenth query is stated with “pledge” and so forth.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Then” and so forth.

original: dam tshig ni rnal 'byor pas gdon mi za bar bya ba nyid kyis 'da' bar bya ba ma yin par sgrub pa'o //
analyzed: dam tshig ni rnal 'byor pas gdon mi za bar bya ba nyid kyis 'da' bar bya ba ma yin par sgrub pa'o //
translated: A pledge is an observance that is not to be transgressed by a yogin because of its necessity.

original: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
analyzed: de yang rnam pa gnyis te /
translated: And that is twofold:

original: bsrung bar bya ba dang / bza' bar bya ba'o //
analyzed: bsrung bar bya ba dang / bza' bar bya ba'o //
translated: that which is to be guarded and that which is to be eaten.

original: de dag gi rnam pa'i rab tu dbye bas mang pos gsungs pa /🔽dam tshig rnams zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de dag gi rnam pa'i rab tu dbye bas mang pos gsungs pa / dam tshig rnams zhes pa'o //
translated: Their varieties are many, as stated with “pledges.”

original: 'bras bu gsungs pa gang gis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: 'bras bu gsungs pa gang gis zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The result is stated with “by whom” and so forth.

original: de la bza' bar bya ba'i dam tshig gi dbang du byas nas gnas dang mchod par bya ba dang / mchod pa'i cho ga dang / yo byad rnams nges par byed pa rim pas gsungs pa /
analyzed: de la bza' bar bya ba'i dam tshig gi dbang du byas nas gnas dang mchod par bya ba dang / mchod pa'i cho ga dang / yo byad rnams nges par byed pa rim pas gsungs pa /
translated: Therein, with reference to the pledge that is to be eaten, the places, the objects of worship, the rite of worship, and the articles are determined in sequence.

original: rang khyim zhes pa la sogs pa //
analyzed: rang khyim zhes pa la sogs pa //
translated: “One’s own house” and so forth.

original: bla med 'bras bu 'dod phyir ro //
analyzed: bla med 'bras bu 'dod phyir ro //
translated: Because of desiring the unsurpassed result.

original: zhes pa'i bar gyis gnas kyi nges pa'o //🔽rnal 'byor zhes pa la sogs pa rab tu bsngags zhes pa'i bar gyis mchod par bya ba'i nges pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i bar gyis gnas kyi nges pa'o // rnal 'byor zhes pa la sogs pa rab tu bsngags zhes pa'i bar gyis mchod par bya ba'i nges pa'o //
translated: This much determines the place.🔽The determination of the object of worship is from yoga up to praise.

original: spyan drangs zhes pa la sogs pa byin brlab bya zhes pa'i bar ni mchod pa'i cho ga'i des pa'o //
analyzed: spyan drangs zhes pa la sogs pa byin brlab bya zhes pa'i bar ni mchod pa'i cho ga'i des pa'o //
translated: The determination of the rite of worship is from invite up to consecrate.

original: sbrad chang la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis yo byad kyi nges pa'o //
analyzed: sbrad chang la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa phyed kyis yo byad kyi nges pa'o //
translated: The determination of the articles is by half a verse beginning wine.

original: lhag ma yis kyang cho ga nyid do //
analyzed: lhag ma yis kyang cho ga nyid do //
translated: The remainder also is the rite.

original: de la / zhing dang sngags skyes gnas skyes dang // zhes pa zhing dang sngags las skyes pa rnams ni zhing dang sngags skyes te de ltar gnas skyes so //
analyzed: de la / zhing dang sngags skyes gnas skyes dang // zhes pa zhing dang sngags las skyes pa rnams ni zhing dang sngags skyes te de ltar gnas skyes so //
translated: There, field-born, mantra-born, and dwelling-born are the field-born and mantra-born, and so on, the dwelling-born.

original: @29b zhing dang gnas ni nye bar mtshon pa ste nye ba'i zhing rnams kyi yang ngo //
analyzed: @29b zhing dang gnas ni nye bar mtshon pa ste nye ba'i zhing rnams kyi yang ngo //
translated: The fields and dwellings are indicated, and also the neighboring fields.

original: sngags skyes zhes pa dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i rim pas skal ba dang ldan par bya ste /
analyzed: sngags skyes zhes pa dbang bskur ba la sogs pa'i rim pas skal ba dang ldan par bya ste /
translated: The mantra-born are those who are made fortunate by the process of consecration and so on.🔽 🔽And so on includes the wisdom-born, the spontaneously-born, and the born-from-a-lotus.

original: bsam gtan dang bzlas pa la sogs pa la gzhol ba rnams so //🔽lha rnams thams cad spyan drang bya //
analyzed: bsam gtan dang bzlas pa la sogs pa la gzhol ba rnams so // lha rnams thams cad spyan drang bya //
translated: Those who are devoted to meditation, recitation, and so forth.🔽All the gods should be invited.

original: zhes pa lha'i gzugs kyis thams cad spyan drang bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa lha'i gzugs kyis thams cad spyan drang bar bya'o //
translated: By the form of the deity, all should be invited.

original: slob dpon dge slong nyid kyang ste //
analyzed: slob dpon dge slong nyid kyang ste //
translated: The master is also a fully ordained monk.

original: zhes pa dge slong nyid slob dpon mchog tu bya'o zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes pa dge slong nyid slob dpon mchog tu bya'o zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: It is said that the fully ordained monk is the best master.

original: ji ltar slob dpon dge slong nyid yin zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ji ltar slob dpon dge slong nyid yin zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: How is the master a fully ordained monk? It is said:🔽Some, abiding in the stage of mantra, are not suitable to be masters.

original: kha cig zhes pa la sogs pa ste gsang sngags kyi tshul gyi rim pas lam la gnas pa de rnams slob dpon nyid du 'gal ba med de /
analyzed: kha cig zhes pa la sogs pa ste gsang sngags kyi tshul gyi rim pas lam la gnas pa de rnams slob dpon nyid du 'gal ba med de /
translated: Those abiding in the path by the stage of mantra are not suitable to be masters, because they are not fully ordained monks.
