original: zab mo'i chos la lhag par ma mos pa'i skye bo rjes su gzung ba'i don du dge slong du gnas pa'o //🔽de gsungs pa /
analyzed: zab mo'i chos la lhag par ma mos pa'i skye bo rjes su gzung ba'i don du dge slong du gnas pa'o // de gsungs pa /
translated: For the sake of guiding people who do not have special devotion to the profound Dharma, they abide as fully ordained monks.

original: rdo rje phreng ba las /
analyzed: rdo rje phreng ba las /
translated: That is said in the Vajra Garland:

original: nad du 'dus pa la dga' zhing //
analyzed: nad du 'dus pa la dga' zhing //
translated: Delighting in assemblies and illness,

original: phyi ru nyan thos spyod pa byed //
analyzed: phyi ru nyan thos spyod pa byed //
translated: externally acting like a śrāvaka.

original: zhes pa dang / de bzhin du /
analyzed: zhes pa dang / de bzhin du /
translated: And similarly:

original: gsang ba'i brtul zhugs la brten nas //
analyzed: gsang ba'i brtul zhugs la brten nas //
translated: On the basis of the secret conduct,

original: bla na med pa'i go 'phang 'grub //
analyzed: bla na med pa'i go 'phang 'grub //
translated: one attains the unexcelled stage.

original: zhes pa gzhan du yang ngo //
analyzed: zhes pa gzhan du yang ngo //
translated: This is also stated elsewhere.

original: kha cig yon tan zhes pa mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan na /
analyzed: kha cig yon tan zhes pa mngon par shes pa la sogs pa'i yon tan dang ldan na /
translated: Some say that if one possesses the qualities of the higher cognitions and so on,

original: dge slong las gzhan yang gtso bo'i slob dpon du bya'o //
analyzed: dge slong las gzhan yang gtso bo'i slob dpon du bya'o //
translated: one should take as the principal master someone other than a fully ordained monk.

original: longs spyod brten zhes pa mchod rten gyi rdzas longs spyod pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod brten zhes pa mchod rten gyi rdzas longs spyod pa'o //
translated: Relying on resources means enjoying the resources of a stupa.

original: mthar lhung spyod ces kha cig klog ste de'i tshe dam tshig gi spyod pa las gzhan du phyogs pa ni mthar lhung ba ste nyan thos la sogs pa'i sdom pa ni mtha' gcig tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: mthar lhung spyod ces kha cig klog ste de'i tshe dam tshig gi spyod pa las gzhan du phyogs pa ni mthar lhung ba ste nyan thos la sogs pa'i sdom pa ni mtha' gcig tu gnas pa'i phyir ro //
translated: Conduct that falls into extremes is read by some, and in that case it refers to those who side with something other than the conduct of the commitments, because the vows of the sravakas and so on are fixed in one extreme.

original: longs spyod ces pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la mtha' gcig tu gnas pa'i chags pa'o //
analyzed: longs spyod ces pa 'dod pa'i yon tan lnga la mtha' gcig tu gnas pa'i chags pa'o //
translated: Resources refers to the attachment that is fixed on the five sense objects.

original: yang na bza' ba la mtha' gcig tu gnas pa ste /
analyzed: yang na bza' ba la mtha' gcig tu gnas pa ste /
translated: Or it refers to the fixation on food.

original: bza' ba las mi phyed pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: bza' ba las mi phyed pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: It means not to deviate from eating.

original: rtag tu sems can ltos pa bcas //
analyzed: rtag tu sems can ltos pa bcas //
translated: Always having compassion for sentient beings,

original: zhes pa sems can rnams la rtag tu 'dzin pa snying brtse zhing mnyes gshin pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa sems can rnams la rtag tu 'dzin pa snying brtse zhing mnyes gshin pa'o //
translated: This is always with regard to sentient beings, holding is compassion, and pleasing is affection.

original: legs pa zhes pa mchog ste /
analyzed: legs pa zhes pa mchog ste /
translated: The good is the supreme.

original: 'khor lo la sogs pa'i phyag rgya'o //🔽gtor ma slob dpon gyis brtag bya //
analyzed: 'khor lo la sogs pa'i phyag rgya'o // gtor ma slob dpon gyis brtag bya //
translated: The wheel and so forth are the seals.🔽The master should examine the sacrificial cake.

original: zhes pa slob dpon gyi 'chad par 'gyur ba'i cho gas gtor ma brtag par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa slob dpon gyi 'chad par 'gyur ba'i cho gas gtor ma brtag par bya'o //
translated: The master should examine the sacrificial cake with the rite to be described.

original: thog mar dam tshig kun spyod las //
analyzed: thog mar dam tshig kun spyod las //
translated: First, the conduct of the commitments.

original: lcags kyu lhan cig ldan pa ste //
analyzed: lcags kyu lhan cig ldan pa ste //
translated: The hook is together with.

original: zhes pa thog @30a * //🔽ma kho nar cho ga ji lta ba bzhin byas pa'i bdud rtsi lnga dang sgron ma lnga'i ril bus dam tshig gi yo byad thams cad la mngon par gtor te /
analyzed: zhes pa thog @30a * // ma kho nar cho ga ji lta ba bzhin byas pa'i bdud rtsi lnga dang sgron ma lnga'i ril bus dam tshig gi yo byad thams cad la mngon par gtor te /
translated: The first is the beginning.

original: 'khor lo'i gnas su bcug nas slob dpon gyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
analyzed: 'khor lo'i gnas su bcug nas slob dpon gyis byin gyis brlab par bya'o //
translated: First, one should sprinkle all the articles of commitment with the pill of the five ambrosias and the five lamps, which are prepared according to the rite, and place them in the place of the wheel. Then the master should bless them.

original: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
analyzed: 'dir bsdus pa'i don ni 'di yin te /
translated: Here is the summary:

original: shin tu sbas par dam tshig dang mi ldan pa 'jug pa bzlog pa'i sgo skyong bzhag ste /
analyzed: shin tu sbas par dam tshig dang mi ldan pa 'jug pa bzlog pa'i sgo skyong bzhag ste /
translated: Having placed the door guardians to block the entrance of those who do not have the commitments,

original: khyim la sogs pa shin tu dben par gdan la sogs pa bshams nas /
analyzed: khyim la sogs pa shin tu dben par gdan la sogs pa bshams nas /
translated: Having arranged the seat and so forth in a very secluded house and so forth,

original: dam tshig gi yo byad la dam tshig gi ril bus bsang gtor bya ste /
analyzed: dam tshig gi yo byad la dam tshig gi ril bus bsang gtor bya ste /
translated: one should sprinkle the pledge articles with the pledge pill.

original: slob dpon sngon du 'gro bas dkyil 'khor pa rnams thams cad kyi zhabs dri bzang po'i chus bkrus nas dbang bskur ba'i rim pas rgan pa ji lta ba bzhin bkod de /
analyzed: slob dpon sngon du 'gro bas dkyil 'khor pa rnams thams cad kyi zhabs dri bzang po'i chus bkrus nas dbang bskur ba'i rim pas rgan pa ji lta ba bzhin bkod de /
translated: The master should go first, and having washed the feet of all the mandala members with fragrant water, one should arrange them according to seniority in the initiation process.

original: aa rgha la sogs pa phul nas dam tshig gi yo byad bshams pa rnams slob dpon gyis cho ga ji lta ba bzhin sbyangs te /
analyzed: aa rgha la sogs pa phul nas dam tshig gi yo byad bshams pa rnams slob dpon gyis cho ga ji lta ba bzhin sbyangs te /
translated: Having offered the argha and so forth, the master should purify the arranged pledge articles according to the rite.

original: me tog la sogs pa phyi rol gyi mchod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi lag pa mchod pa'i tshogs tshim par bya'o //
analyzed: me tog la sogs pa phyi rol gyi mchod pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyi lag pa mchod pa'i tshogs tshim par bya'o //
translated: One should satisfy the assembly of offerings with external offerings such as flowers and so forth.

original: lag pa la 'byar ba'i rdzas ni lha'i zhal las byung ba'i lhag ma lta bur brtags nas /
analyzed: lag pa la 'byar ba'i rdzas ni lha'i zhal las byung ba'i lhag ma lta bur brtags nas /
translated: One should imagine the substances that adhere to the hands as being the remainder that arises from the mouth of the deity.

original: las kyi rdo rjes bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa mtha' dag la bsang gtor bya zhing slob dpon gyis yi ge gsum brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: las kyi rdo rjes bza' ba dang btung ba la sogs pa mtha' dag la bsang gtor bya zhing slob dpon gyis yi ge gsum brjod par bya'o //
translated: The karma vajra should sprinkle the food and drink, etc., with water, and the master should recite the three syllables.

original: de nas bza' ba la sogs pa rnams la phud cung zad cung zad blangs te snod chen por blugs nas tshogs kyi dbus su bzhag ste /
analyzed: de nas bza' ba la sogs pa rnams la phud cung zad cung zad blangs te snod chen por blugs nas tshogs kyi dbus su bzhag ste /
translated: Then, taking a little bit of the food, etc., and putting it in a large vessel, it should be placed in the middle of the gaṇa.

original: gdugs dad rgyal mtshan la sogs pas brgyan pa'i gtor ma chen po dang por dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: gdugs dad rgyal mtshan la sogs pas brgyan pa'i gtor ma chen po dang por dbul bar bya'o //
translated: First, one should offer a great bali, adorned with parasols, victory banners, and so on.

original: de nas mjug tu de'i rjes la las kyi rdo rjes bdud rtsi lnga dang sgron ma lnga'i ril bu gsum dang bcas pa'i so so'i snod lag pa g-yas par bzung ste /
analyzed: de nas mjug tu de'i rjes la las kyi rdo rjes bdud rtsi lnga dang sgron ma lnga'i ril bu gsum dang bcas pa'i so so'i snod lag pa g-yas par bzung ste /
translated: Then, at the end, the karma vajra should take in his right hand the individual vessels with the pills of the five amṛtas and the five lamps, together with the three.

original: g-yon pas ba dan gsum pa'i phyag rgya nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: g-yon pas ba dan gsum pa'i phyag rgya nye bar bstan nas /
translated: Displaying the mudra of the three banners with the left hand,🔽one should recite:

original: mthong ba'i chos ni dag pa la //
analyzed: mthong ba'i chos ni dag pa la //
translated: “The purity of the phenomena of this life

original: med do snyam pa'i rtog pa thong //
analyzed: med do snyam pa'i rtog pa thong //
translated: is not to be thought of as nonexistent.

original: bram ze khyi dang gdol pa rnams ;
analyzed: bram ze khyi dang gdol pa rnams ;
translated: Brahmins, dogs, and untouchables

original: / lhan cig gcig pa nyid du gsol //
analyzed: / lhan cig gcig pa nyid du gsol //
translated: are requested to be the same.”

original: zhes pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di yis slob dpon sngon du 'gro ba thams cad la so sor nye bar dbul bar bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'di yis slob dpon sngon du 'gro ba thams cad la so sor nye bar dbul bar bya'o //
translated: With this verse, one should offer each of the preliminaries to the master.

original: len pa po de rnams kyis kyang phyag rgya de nye bar bstan nas /
analyzed: len pa po de rnams kyis kyang phyag rgya de nye bar bstan nas /
translated: And those who receive it should display that seal.

original: bde gshegs chos la rin thang med //🔽'dod chags @30b dri ma dang bral zhing //
analyzed: bde gshegs chos la rin thang med // 'dod chags @30b dri ma dang bral zhing //
translated: The Sugata's Dharma is priceless,🔽Free from the stain of desire,

original: gzungs dang 'dzin pa rnams spangs pa //
analyzed: gzungs dang 'dzin pa rnams spangs pa //
translated: Abandoning both retention and grasping,

original: de nyid la ni gus pas 'dud //
analyzed: de nyid la ni gus pas 'dud //
translated: I respectfully bow to that very [Dharma].

original: ces pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis blang bar bya ste /
analyzed: ces pa'i tshigs su bcad pa 'dis blang bar bya ste /
translated: With this verse, one should receive [the Dharma].

original: bza' ba la sogs pa gzhan yang de ltar kun du spyad par bya'o //🔽de la gnas dang nye ba'i gnas //
analyzed: bza' ba la sogs pa gzhan yang de ltar kun du spyad par bya'o // de la gnas dang nye ba'i gnas //
translated: One should also consume other things such as food in that way.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis brjod nas 'khor lo'i gtso bo'i lha'i 'khor lo la bstod par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gnyis brjod nas 'khor lo'i gtso bo'i lha'i 'khor lo la bstod par bya'o //
translated: Regarding that, having recited the two verses beginning with The abode and the neighboring abode, one should praise the wheel of the principal deity's retinue.

original: de'i rjes la sbyin pa'i bdag pos mandala byas te /
analyzed: de'i rjes la sbyin pa'i bdag pos mandala byas te /
translated: After that, the patron should make a maṇḍala offering.

original: thal mo sbyar nas bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba sngon du song bas /
analyzed: thal mo sbyar nas bstod pa dang phyag 'tshal ba sngon du song bas /
translated: With palms joined, having praised and prostrated,

original: ji ltar bde bar zhes brjod par bya'o //
analyzed: ji ltar bde bar zhes brjod par bya'o //
translated: One should say, as is pleasant.

original: de la srid pa dang mnyam zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas lha mo dang bcas pa'i 'khor lo mtha' dag la sbyin pa'i bdag po'i don du gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
analyzed: de la srid pa dang mnyam zhes pa la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pas lha mo dang bcas pa'i 'khor lo mtha' dag la sbyin pa'i bdag po'i don du gsol ba gdab par bya'o //
translated: There, with the verse beginning equal to existence, one should supplicate the entire retinue together with the goddess for the sake of the master of generosity.

original: rnal 'byor pa'i tshul nyid kyis de rnams gtso bo yin pa'i phyir de nyid la gsol pa gdab par bya ste ;
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa'i tshul nyid kyis de rnams gtso bo yin pa'i phyir de nyid la gsol pa gdab par bya ste ;
translated: Because of the very nature of the yogi, they are the principal ones, so one should supplicate them.

original: rnal 'byor zhes pa la sogs pa dang / ae yig zhes pa la sogs pa dang / dpal ldan zhes pa la sogs pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis gtso bo la sogs pa la phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor zhes pa la sogs pa dang / ae yig zhes pa la sogs pa dang / dpal ldan zhes pa la sogs pa dang / tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis gtso bo la sogs pa la phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: With the three verses beginning yoga, the syllable e, and the glorious, one should pay homage to the principal ones and so forth.

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa dang / lha mo zhes pa la sogs pa dang ; skye ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis gtso mo la phyag 'tshal ba'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa dang / lha mo zhes pa la sogs pa dang ; skye ba la sogs pa'i tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis gtso mo la phyag 'tshal ba'o //
translated: Then, with the three verses beginning then, the goddess, and birth, one should pay homage to the principal one.

original: ji snyed ces pa la sogs pa dang / dpal he ru ka zhes pa la sogs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med ces pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis 'khor lo'i bstod pa'o //
analyzed: ji snyed ces pa la sogs pa dang / dpal he ru ka zhes pa la sogs pa dang / rnam par rtog pa med ces pa la sogs pa tshigs su bcad pa gsum gyis 'khor lo'i bstod pa'o //
translated: The three verses beginning with “as many as there are” and so on, “the glorious Heruka” and so on, and “without conceptualization” and so on are the praise of the wheel.

original: de la stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i rnal 'byor nyid bdud rtsi'o //
analyzed: de la stong pa nyid dang snying rje dbyer med pa'i rnal 'byor nyid bdud rtsi'o //
translated: There, the yoga of the inseparability of emptiness and compassion itself is the nectar.

original: de gcig ste gnyis su med pa'i ro 'thung bas rnam par dag pa'i sems gang gi yin pa de bzhin du de'o //
analyzed: de gcig ste gnyis su med pa'i ro 'thung bas rnam par dag pa'i sems gang gi yin pa de bzhin du de'o //
translated: That which is the pure mind of the one who drinks the taste of that, which is one and not two, is just like that.

original: phyi dang nang gi gnas la sogs pa lhag par bgrod pas lus dri ma med pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par dag pa'i lus so //
analyzed: phyi dang nang gi gnas la sogs pa lhag par bgrod pas lus dri ma med pa nyid kyi phyir rnam par dag pa'i lus so //
translated: The pure body is because of the stainlessness of the body by the special progress in the outer and inner places and so on.

original: dpal gyi gnas zhes pa rdo rje'i gnas bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i ze'u 'bru'o //
analyzed: dpal gyi gnas zhes pa rdo rje'i gnas bde ba chen po'i 'khor lo'i ze'u 'bru'o //
translated: The “seat of glory” is the anthers of the great-bliss wheel, the vajra seat.

original: chen po'i gsung zhes pa gzhung ngo //
analyzed: chen po'i gsung zhes pa gzhung ngo //
translated: The “great speech” is the text.

original: gang gis zhes pa gang dag gis te /
analyzed: gang gis zhes pa gang dag gis te /
translated: “By whom” means “by which.”

original: bcom ldan 'das ma rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi ston pa po zhes dgongs te zhe @31a * //
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das ma rtsa ba'i rgyud kyi ston pa po zhes dgongs te zhe @31a * //
translated: It is thought that the teacher of the Bhagavatī Root Tantra is Vajradhara.

original: pa ste ; rgyud de'i byed par 'dod pa yang rgyud kyi sgra yod de ji ltar rang rgyud byed pa lta bu'o //
analyzed: pa ste ; rgyud de'i byed par 'dod pa yang rgyud kyi sgra yod de ji ltar rang rgyud byed pa lta bu'o //
translated: The word “tantra” is also used for the agent of that, just as in the case of the word “self-tantra.”

original: bdun la 'gro ba zhes pa bdun 'gro sta nyi ma'o //
analyzed: bdun la 'gro ba zhes pa bdun 'gro sta nyi ma'o //
translated: “ Seven-goer” is the sun, because it moves through the seven, i.e., the seven houses.

original: de nyid mi shes pa'i mun pa dang bral bar 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
analyzed: de nyid mi shes pa'i mun pa dang bral bar 'gro ba nyid kyi phyir ro //
translated: It is a “goer” because it moves free from the darkness of ignorance.

original: lha mo'i phreng ba zhes pa rtsa'i 'khor lo'i rang bzhin lha mo'i tshogs sku'i dbyibs su gsal ba zhes pa ste don gzhan med do //
analyzed: lha mo'i phreng ba zhes pa rtsa'i 'khor lo'i rang bzhin lha mo'i tshogs sku'i dbyibs su gsal ba zhes pa ste don gzhan med do //
translated: “ Goddess-garland” is the collection of goddesses, which is the nature of the channel-wheels, and is clear in the shape of the body. There is no other meaning.

original: de nyid bde ba phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu nyid las /
analyzed: de nyid bde ba phun sum tshogs pa'i rgyu nyid las /
translated: From that, because it is the cause of perfect bliss,

original: rin po che ltar gang gi rin po che'o //
analyzed: rin po che ltar gang gi rin po che'o //
translated: it is “jewel,” i.e., the jewel of the mind.

original: dpa' bo zhes pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i khams rnams kyis so //
analyzed: dpa' bo zhes pa nyi shu rtsa bzhi'i khams rnams kyis so //
translated: “ Hero” is the twenty-four elements.

original: 'khor lor gnas mgon zhes sprul pa'i 'khor lor gnas pa dang / gtso bo nyid kyis sems can thams cad yongs su skyob par nus pa'i phyir mgon por gyur pa'o //
analyzed: 'khor lor gnas mgon zhes sprul pa'i 'khor lor gnas pa dang / gtso bo nyid kyis sems can thams cad yongs su skyob par nus pa'i phyir mgon por gyur pa'o //
translated: “ Protector-in-the-wheel” is the protector in the emanation wheel, because it is able to protect all sentient beings with its own essence.

original: yang na 'khor lor gnas pa ni chos la sogs pa'i 'khor lo la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: yang na 'khor lor gnas pa ni chos la sogs pa'i 'khor lo la gnas pa'o //
translated: Or else, “abiding in the wheel” means abiding in the wheel of Dharma, etc.

original: mgon po ni gang gi yin pa de bzhin du de yi'o //
analyzed: mgon po ni gang gi yin pa de bzhin du de yi'o //
translated: “Lord” is that which is so, of that.

original: lhan skyes dri ma med pa zhes pa rang bzhin nyid kyi me lce 'bar ba ltar rab tu 'bar ba nyid las so //
analyzed: lhan skyes dri ma med pa zhes pa rang bzhin nyid kyi me lce 'bar ba ltar rab tu 'bar ba nyid las so //
translated: “Innate, stainless” means from the blazing of the innate, stainless, like a blazing flame of nature itself.

original: yam yig ni nges par gzung ba'o //
analyzed: yam yig ni nges par gzung ba'o //
translated: The syllable “yam” is a definite determinative.

original: de nyid kyi phyir bde mchog rnal 'byor snying po zhes pa bde mchog gi rnal 'byor gyi snying por gyur pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir bde mchog rnal 'byor snying po zhes pa bde mchog gi rnal 'byor gyi snying por gyur pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Therefore, “the essence of Cakrasaṃvara yoga” means the essence of the yoga of Cakrasaṃvara.

original: ae yig gi dbyibs 'di yi zhes pa ae yig gi dbyibs so //
analyzed: ae yig gi dbyibs 'di yi zhes pa ae yig gi dbyibs so //
translated: “This shape of the syllable e” means the shape of the syllable e.

original: snying por gyur pa'i khu ba'i gnas te padma'i snying po zhes pa sprul pa la sogs pa'i padma'i rten la'o //🔽'pho zhing skyes ba kun gyi bdag nyid can //
analyzed: snying por gyur pa'i khu ba'i gnas te padma'i snying po zhes pa sprul pa la sogs pa'i padma'i rten la'o // 'pho zhing skyes ba kun gyi bdag nyid can //
translated: “The essence of the place of the seminal fluid” is the essence of the lotus, the support of the emanation, etc.

original: zhes pa lus thams cad la khyab pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa lus thams cad la khyab pa'o //
translated: “The nature of all transmigrating beings” means pervading all bodies.

original: kun mkhyen zhes pa rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin nyid las so //
analyzed: kun mkhyen zhes pa rdo rje sems dpa'i rang bzhin nyid las so //
translated: “Omniscient” means from the nature of Vajrasattva.

original: shin tu rnam dag sangs rgyas gnas //
analyzed: shin tu rnam dag sangs rgyas gnas //
translated: The abode of the Buddha, utterly pure.

original: zhes pa mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya nyid las shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid ni sangs rgyas mi bskyod pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa mi bskyod pa'i phyag rgya nyid las shin tu rnam par dag pa'i ye shes kyi bdag nyid ni sangs rgyas mi bskyod pa'o //
translated: The abode of the goddesses, utterly pure, is the abode of the Buddha, Akṣhobhya.

original: lha mo rnams gnas zhes pa lha mo rnams ni rab gtum mal sogs pa'i rang bzhin rtsa rnams nyid de /
analyzed: lha mo rnams gnas zhes pa lha mo rnams ni rab gtum mal sogs pa'i rang bzhin rtsa rnams nyid de /
translated: The goddesses are the channels, the nature of Prachaṇḍā and so forth.

original: gnas gang gi yin pa de bzhin du de'o //
analyzed: gnas gang gi yin pa de bzhin du de'o //
translated: The abode of those is the abode of the goddesses.

original: dri med lhan skyes zhes pa dri ma med pa'i rang bzhin kunda'i mdzes pa nyid las so //
analyzed: dri med lhan skyes zhes pa dri ma med pa'i rang bzhin kunda'i mdzes pa nyid las so //
translated: The stainless innate, the stainless nature, is the beauty of the kuṇḍalini.

original: dpal ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'o //
analyzed: dpal ni 'jig rten las 'das pa'i phun sum tshogs pa'o //
translated: Glory is the excellence of transcending the world.

original: de gang la yod pa de dpal ldan te de'i phyir ro //
analyzed: de gang la yod pa de dpal ldan te de'i phyir ro //
translated: He who has that is glorious.

original: rdo rje ni mi phyed pa'i ye shes so //🔽d'a ni @31b mkha' la 'gro ba la d'a'o //
analyzed: rdo rje ni mi phyed pa'i ye shes so // d'a ni @31b mkha' la 'gro ba la d'a'o //
translated: The vajra is the indivisible gnosis.🔽The da is the da of moving in space.

original: aa ka na ni 'khyog por 'gro ba la aa ka'o //
analyzed: aa ka na ni 'khyog por 'gro ba la aa ka'o //
translated: The ka is the ka of crooked movement.

original: mi phyed pa'i ye shes kyi rdo rje mkha' la 'gro ba dang phyogs bcur 'phros pa las 'khyog por 'gro ba yang ste gang gi yin pa de bzhin du de'o //
analyzed: mi phyed pa'i ye shes kyi rdo rje mkha' la 'gro ba dang phyogs bcur 'phros pa las 'khyog por 'gro ba yang ste gang gi yin pa de bzhin du de'o //
translated: The vajra of indivisible intuition, moving in the sky and spreading in the ten directions, is also the crooked one.

original: de'i phyir aa ki nyid ni gang rnams kyi dad tshul zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de'i phyir aa ki nyid ni gang rnams kyi dad tshul zhes pa'o //
translated: Thus, it is the way of those who are the akas.

original: mkha' 'gro ma de rnams kyi 'khor lo de la bskor ba ni gang gi tshul yin pa de de bzhin du de'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma de rnams kyi 'khor lo de la bskor ba ni gang gi tshul yin pa de de bzhin du de'o //
translated: The wheel of those dakinis is the way of those who are the akas.

original: kun du rtog pa'i 'ching gcod cing //
analyzed: kun du rtog pa'i 'ching gcod cing //
translated: It cuts the bonds of conceptualization.

original: zhes pa gzung ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni kun du rtog pa'i 'ching ba nyid do //
analyzed: zhes pa gzung ba la sogs pa'i rang bzhin ni kun du rtog pa'i 'ching ba nyid do //
translated: The nature of the object, etc., is the bond of conceptualization.

original: gcod pa ste gang rnams la spangs par gyur pa de bzhin du de'o //
analyzed: gcod pa ste gang rnams la spangs par gyur pa de bzhin du de'o //
translated: It cuts, i.e., it is the abandonment of those.

original: dpal he ru ka dpa' bo chen po'i rnal 'byor nyid las dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyang de kho na'o zhes gsungs pa /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka dpa' bo chen po'i rnal 'byor nyid las dkyil 'khor pa rnams kyang de kho na'o zhes gsungs pa /
translated: The maṇḍala is just that, i.e., the yoga of the glorious Heruka, the Great Hero.

original: dpal he ru ka zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: dpal he ru ka zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The glorious Heruka, etc.

original: rnam par rtog med ni sgro ma btags pa'o //
analyzed: rnam par rtog med ni sgro ma btags pa'o //
translated: Non-conceptual is non-superficial.

original: yang dag rtog ba ni yid kyi bya ba ste gang gi yin pa de bzhin du de'o //
analyzed: yang dag rtog ba ni yid kyi bya ba ste gang gi yin pa de bzhin du de'o //
translated: Right thought is mental action, and that which is so is just that.

original: de nyid kyi phyir rab tu mi gnas pa ni 'ga' zhig kyang dmigs pa la gang gi yid ni de bzhin du de'o //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir rab tu mi gnas pa ni 'ga' zhig kyang dmigs pa la gang gi yid ni de bzhin du de'o //
translated: Therefore, not remaining anywhere, the mind of one who is so is just that.

original: dran pa dang yid la byed pa med pa las /
analyzed: dran pa dang yid la byed pa med pa las /
translated: From the absence of mindfulness and mental attention,

original: yid la mi byed dran pa med //
analyzed: yid la mi byed dran pa med //
translated: there is no mental attention, no mindfulness.

original: ces pa bod pa'o //
analyzed: ces pa bod pa'o //
translated: This is the Tibetan translation.

original: mchog gi lus 'dzin ma zhes pa gong na med pa'i sku dang ldan pa'o //
analyzed: mchog gi lus 'dzin ma zhes pa gong na med pa'i sku dang ldan pa'o //
translated: Holding the supreme body means possessing the unsurpassed body.

original: khams gsum gzugs can ma zhes pa khams gsum pa'i rang bzhin no //
analyzed: khams gsum gzugs can ma zhes pa khams gsum pa'i rang bzhin no //
translated: The one with a form in the three realms means having the nature of the three realms.

original: gsum rnams kyis zhes pa rnal 'byor pa dang rnal 'byor dang 'bras bu rnams dang sku dang gsungs dang thugs rnams la dgongs nas tshigs su bcad pa gsum rnams te /
analyzed: gsum rnams kyis zhes pa rnal 'byor pa dang rnal 'byor dang 'bras bu rnams dang sku dang gsungs dang thugs rnams la dgongs nas tshigs su bcad pa gsum rnams te /
translated: With the three means that the three verses are intended for the yogi, yoga, and result, as well as for the body, speech, and mind.

original: so sor chos mthun pa'i phyir ram /
analyzed: so sor chos mthun pa'i phyir ram /
translated: Either because of the similarity of the individual dharmas,

original: yang na gcig tu bstan pa'i phyir zhes pa gsungs so //
analyzed: yang na gcig tu bstan pa'i phyir zhes pa gsungs so //
translated: or because of the teaching as one, it is said.

original: ji ltar bde zhing yid spro bas //
analyzed: ji ltar bde zhing yid spro bas //
translated: How is it blissful and delightful?

original: zhes pa bde ba mi nyams pa'i rim pas ma da na la sogs pa bsten pa la yid spro ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: zhes pa bde ba mi nyams pa'i rim pas ma da na la sogs pa bsten pa la yid spro ba'i phyir ro //
translated: This is the sequence of not letting bliss deteriorate, in order to delight the mind in attending to Manadana and so forth.

original: ki li ki li zhes pa rdo rje'i glu'o //
analyzed: ki li ki li zhes pa rdo rje'i glu'o //
translated: Kilikili is a vajra song.

original: 'di dag nyid ston pa sna tshogs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: 'di dag nyid ston pa sna tshogs zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: These very things are taught by “various” and so forth.

original: phyag rgya sngags kyis zhes pa la sogs pa gar dang glu dag la phyag rgya dang sngags kyi rang bzhin gyis brgyan pa'o //
analyzed: phyag rgya sngags kyis zhes pa la sogs pa gar dang glu dag la phyag rgya dang sngags kyi rang bzhin gyis brgyan pa'o //
translated: “With mudras and mantras” and so forth: dance and song are adorned with the nature of mudras and mantras.

original: gnas mtshan rkang pa rnams kyis zhes pa gnas la sogs pa'i grangs kyi rdo rje rkang pa rnams kyis so //
analyzed: gnas mtshan rkang pa rnams kyis zhes pa gnas la sogs pa'i grangs kyi rdo rje rkang pa rnams kyis so //
translated: “With the number of places and so forth” means with the number of places and so forth, with the vajra steps.

original: tshogs kyi gtso bo zhes pa 'khor lo'i 'dren pa'o //🔽yon bdag dge @32a * //
analyzed: tshogs kyi gtso bo zhes pa 'khor lo'i 'dren pa'o // yon bdag dge @32a * //
translated: “The chief of the assembly” is the leader of the wheel.

original: ba'i bsam pa la //
analyzed: ba'i bsam pa la //
translated: The benefactor is the one who has the intention of virtue.

original: zhes pa yon bdag dge ba'i bsam pa 'di yi zhes pa byas nas so //🔽spros pa'i dkyil 'khor rnam pa ni //
analyzed: zhes pa yon bdag dge ba'i bsam pa 'di yi zhes pa byas nas so // spros pa'i dkyil 'khor rnam pa ni //
translated: “In this” means “in this intention of virtue of the benefactor.”🔽“The various maṇḍalas”

original: zhes pa dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa ji ltar yin pa de ltar spro ba dang bsdu ba zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa dkyil 'khor gyi rnam pa ji ltar yin pa de ltar spro ba dang bsdu ba zhes pa'i don to //
translated: means “the various maṇḍalas,” and the meaning of “emanation and gathering” is “in that way.”

original: lhag ma'i gtor ma bsdus nas ni /
analyzed: lhag ma'i gtor ma bsdus nas ni /
translated: Having gathered the remaining bali,

original: 'byung po 'chol pa rnams la sbyin //
analyzed: 'byung po 'chol pa rnams la sbyin //
translated: give it to the wandering spirits.

original: zhes pa mthar khro bo dang 'byung po rnams la gtor ma nye bar bsdus te'o //
analyzed: zhes pa mthar khro bo dang 'byung po rnams la gtor ma nye bar bsdus te'o //
translated: At the end, having gathered the bali for the wrathful ones and the spirits,🔽it is taught like this: All of the principal members of the ganacakra, having gone first, enjoy the five sense objects just as they desire.

original: 'di ltar gsungs te tshogs kyi gtso bo sngon du 'gro ba can thams cad kyis ji ltar bde ba kho na 'dod pa lnga la nye bar longs spyod de mnyes pa de rnams kyis yon bdag gi dge ba'i sems sngon du byas te de'i dge ba la bsngags
analyzed: 'di ltar gsungs te tshogs kyi gtso bo sngon du 'gro ba can thams cad kyis ji ltar bde ba kho na 'dod pa lnga la nye bar longs spyod de mnyes pa de rnams kyis yon bdag gi dge ba'i sems sngon du byas te de'i dge ba la bsngags
translated: Those who are pleased dedicate the virtue of that to the patron, who has a virtuous attitude beforehand.

original: pa'o // zhi ba la sogs pa de'i mngon par 'dod pa la spros pas phun sum tshogs par bya ba la spros pa'i lha'i 'khor lo yang dag par bsdu ba byas nas /
analyzed: pa'o // zhi ba la sogs pa de'i mngon par 'dod pa la spros pas phun sum tshogs par bya ba la spros pa'i lha'i 'khor lo yang dag par bsdu ba byas nas /
translated: Having performed the elaborate rite of the maṇḍala of the elaborate deities, who are to be pleased with the desired objects of the patron, such as pacification and so on,🔽gather the maṇḍala.

original: lag pa gnyis steng du rab tu brkyangs te 'og tu phyogs pa'i mthe bong gnyis yang dag par sbyar nas mdzub mo gnyis rtse mo sbyar te lhag ma rnams rab tu brkyang ba zhes pa'i phyag rgya 'di yis kha'i thad kar bzhag la chang gis kha bkang ste
analyzed: lag pa gnyis steng du rab tu brkyangs te 'og tu phyogs pa'i mthe bong gnyis yang dag par sbyar nas mdzub mo gnyis rtse mo sbyar te lhag ma rnams rab tu brkyang ba zhes pa'i phyag rgya 'di yis kha'i thad kar bzhag la chang gis kha bkang ste
translated: Having extended the two hands upward, with the two thumbs joined together and facing downward, with the two index fingers joined at the tips, and the rest extended, having placed this mudra at the level of the mouth, fill the mouth with beer,

original: yi ge gsum brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phud yig gis lhag ma'i gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
analyzed: yi ge gsum brjod pa sngon du 'gro ba'i phud yig gis lhag ma'i gtor ma sbyin par bya'o //
translated: and having recited the three syllables, offer the remainder torma with the remainder syllable.

original: de nas sbyin ba'i bdag pos yon dang tam bu la sogs pa yang phul nas mnyes pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis phyag 'tshal te gshegs par bya'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de nas sbyin ba'i bdag pos yon dang tam bu la sogs pa yang phul nas mnyes pa sngon du 'gro ba can gyis phyag 'tshal te gshegs par bya'o zhes pa'o //
translated: Then, the patron having also offered a gift, a tambula, and so on, having pleased him, he should be invited to depart with prostrations.

original: le'u brgyad pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u brgyad pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the explanation of the eighth chapter.

original: // / tstsho ma bshad du gsol zhes pa la sogs pa mtshan ma mthong bar 'gyur zhes pa'i bar zhu ba bco lnga pa la sogs pa bzhi'i lan gdab par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: // / tstsho ma bshad du gsol zhes pa la sogs pa mtshan ma mthong bar 'gyur zhes pa'i bar zhu ba bco lnga pa la sogs pa bzhi'i lan gdab par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: Having been requested, “Please explain the signs,” and so on, up to “one will see signs,” in response to the fifteen questions, and so on, it is said:

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Now, the one who knows this, etc.

original: de la de nas zhes pa la sogs pa gang zhes pa'i bar ni brda bstan pa'o //
analyzed: de la de nas zhes pa la sogs pa gang zhes pa'i bar ni brda bstan pa'o //
translated: There, “now” and so forth up to “who” is the teaching of the convention.

original: mkha' 'gro ma zhes pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam zhes pa'i bar ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi gnas la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma zhes pa la sogs pa sangs rgyas kun dang mnyam zhes pa'i bar ni phyi dang nang gi bdag nyid kyi gnas la sogs pa bstan pa'o //
translated: “ Dakini” and so forth up to “equal to all the Buddhas” is the teaching of the outer and inner nature of the place, etc.

original: gnas ni rab tu dga' ba'i sa //
analyzed: gnas ni rab tu dga' ba'i sa //
translated: The place is the Joyful, etc.🔽There, “place” is the Joyful, etc.

original: zhes pa la sogs pa mi rnams zhes pa'i bar ni bstan pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa la sogs pa mi rnams zhes pa'i bar ni bstan pa'o //
translated: “ People” and so forth up to “the one who knows this” is the teaching.

original: bskor zhing zhes pa nas rab tu skye zhes pa'i bar ni mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
analyzed: bskor zhing zhes pa nas rab tu skye zhes pa'i bar ni mtshan ma bstan pa'o //
translated: “ Circling” and so forth up to “arises” is the teaching of the sign.

original: de lag g-yon gyi ni zhes pa lag pa g-yon pa ste nges pa bzung ba la ni'o //
analyzed: de lag g-yon gyi ni zhes pa lag pa g-yon pa ste nges pa bzung ba la ni'o //
translated: “ In the left hand” is the left hand, and “ni” is the definite article.

original: rnal @32b 'byor zhes ba rnal 'byor ma ste myur du grub pa skye bar 'gyur /
analyzed: rnal @32b 'byor zhes ba rnal 'byor ma ste myur du grub pa skye bar 'gyur /
translated: “ Yoga” is yogini, and “quickly arises” is the arising of the attainment.

original: rnal 'byor pa zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pa zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: “ The yogi” is the remainder.

original: yang na gang gis rnam par shes pa'i rnal 'byor ba de yis myur du grub pa skye bar 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: yang na gang gis rnam par shes pa'i rnal 'byor ba de yis myur du grub pa skye bar 'gyur zhes pa'i don to //
translated: Or, “the one who knows the yoga of the consciousness” is the one who quickly arises with the attainment.

original: 'di ltar gsungs te bzlas pa dang bsam gtan mchog gi rnal 'byor ba gnas pa'am gnas la sogs pas bskor ba na'ang rung ste /
analyzed: 'di ltar gsungs te bzlas pa dang bsam gtan mchog gi rnal 'byor ba gnas pa'am gnas la sogs pas bskor ba na'ang rung ste /
translated: When the yogī of supreme repetition and meditation is in a place or in a place surrounded by yoginīs,

original: rnal 'byor ma rnams de rjes su gzung ba'i phyir brda rnams kyis bdag nyid nye bar ston par byed do //
analyzed: rnal 'byor ma rnams de rjes su gzung ba'i phyir brda rnams kyis bdag nyid nye bar ston par byed do //
translated: in order to be accepted by them, he should display himself with signs.

original: rnal 'byor pas kyang de rnams kyi brda nye bar mthong ba na brda'i lan bya ste /
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas kyang de rnams kyi brda nye bar mthong ba na brda'i lan bya ste /
translated: And when the yogī sees their signs, he should reply with signs.

original: des de rnams mnyes te /
analyzed: des de rnams mnyes te /
translated: By that, they are pleased,

original: yang dag pa'i phan pa dang grub pa nye bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
analyzed: yang dag pa'i phan pa dang grub pa nye bar byed par 'gyur ro zhes pa'o //
translated: and they will bring about the highest benefit and accomplishment.

original: de la rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi yan lag gi brda ni g-yon pa yis te /
analyzed: de la rnal 'byor ma rnams kyi yan lag gi brda ni g-yon pa yis te /
translated: Therein, the sign of the yoginīs’ limbs is with the left,

original: rnal 'byor pas ni brda'i lan g-yas pa yis so //
analyzed: rnal 'byor pas ni brda'i lan g-yas pa yis so //
translated: and the yogī’s reply with signs is with the right.

original: sor mo gcig ces pa mdzub mo'o //
analyzed: sor mo gcig ces pa mdzub mo'o //
translated: “One finger” is the index finger.

original: gang zhes pa ni gang legs par 'ongs sam zhes 'dri ba'i don to //
analyzed: gang zhes pa ni gang legs par 'ongs sam zhes 'dri ba'i don to //
translated: “What” means “What is well?”

original: gnyis kyis zhes pa mdzub mo dang gung mo dag gis lan gyi brda'o //
analyzed: gnyis kyis zhes pa mdzub mo dang gung mo dag gis lan gyi brda'o //
translated: “Two” is the reply with the sign of the index finger and the middle finger.

original: g-yon pa'i mthe bong sdom byed na //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i mthe bong sdom byed na //
translated: If one clenches the left thumb,

original: zhes pa mdzub mo dang gung mo dag gis zhes pa lhag ma'o //
analyzed: zhes pa mdzub mo dang gung mo dag gis zhes pa lhag ma'o //
translated: the index and middle fingers are understood.

original: 'di la g-yas pas de ltar lan gyi phyag rgya'o //
analyzed: 'di la g-yas pas de ltar lan gyi phyag rgya'o //
translated: This is the reply gesture with the right hand.

original: g-yon pa'i sor mo sbyor byed na //
analyzed: g-yon pa'i sor mo sbyor byed na //
translated: If one joins the fingers of the left hand,

original: zhes pa kha cig klog ste /
analyzed: zhes pa kha cig klog ste /
translated: some read it thus.

original: de'i tshe mdzub mo dang gung mo sbyar ba zhes ba'i don to //
analyzed: de'i tshe mdzub mo dang gung mo sbyar ba zhes ba'i don to //
translated: Then the meaning is that one joins the index and middle fingers.

original: phyogs gcig pa zhes pa mdzub mo ste /
analyzed: phyogs gcig pa zhes pa mdzub mo ste /
translated: The one part is the index finger.

original: mthe bong zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: mthe bong zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say thumb.

original: ming med ston byed ces pa reg pa ste /
analyzed: ming med ston byed ces pa reg pa ste /
translated: The demonstrator of the ring finger is the touch gesture.

original: de ltar mgrin pa la'o //
analyzed: de ltar mgrin pa la'o //
translated: Thus, on the throat.

original: dar dpyad zhes khu tshur bcangs te mdzub mo dang gung mo rab tu brkyang zhing sbyar bas dbral bar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dar dpyad zhes khu tshur bcangs te mdzub mo dang gung mo rab tu brkyang zhing sbyar bas dbral bar 'dzin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: The cloth is the fist with the index and middle fingers extended and joined, because one holds it to the throat.

original: rtse gsum zhes pa mthe bong rgan pos mthe'u chung mnan te sor mo lhag ma gsum de dang bral bar brkyang ba'i phyir ro //
analyzed: rtse gsum zhes pa mthe bong rgan pos mthe'u chung mnan te sor mo lhag ma gsum de dang bral bar brkyang ba'i phyir ro //
translated: The trident is the little finger pressed down by the extended thumb, because the remaining three fingers are extended apart from it.

original: sa ni zhes pa sa'o //
analyzed: sa ni zhes pa sa'o //
translated: The earth is the earth.

original: so zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: so zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say teeth.

original: 'khor lo zhes brgan po dang mdzub mo dag rtse mo sbyar ba las so //
analyzed: 'khor lo zhes brgan po dang mdzub mo dag rtse mo sbyar ba las so //
translated: The wheel is the tip of the thumb and forefinger joined.

original: spyi bo zhes ba gtsug tor la reg pa'i phyir ro //

analyzed: lus dang ngag dang yid kyi spyod pa las kyang rnam par shes nas brten par bya'o zhes gsungs pa /

analyzed: g-yon pas zhes @33a * //

original: bud med rnams ni dga' smra ma //
analyzed: bud med rnams ni dga' smra ma //

original: zhes pa bud med rnams la dbyangs kyis smra'o //
analyzed: zhes pa bud med rnams la dbyangs kyis smra'o //

analyzed: dam tshig ldan par des shes bya //

analyzed: rigs kyi sa bon rnams kyis zhes pa rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i sa bon rnams kyis so //

analyzed: rigs kyi bya ba zhes pa rigs gang la skyes pa de'i rigs kyi bya ba'o //

analyzed: rang gi rig pa zlos zhes pa rang gi rigs kyi sngags so //

analyzed: rtag tu rig pa yang dag 'dri //

analyzed: rang gi khyim du 'dri bar dga' //

translated: That aggregate is the nature of the body means that the twenty-four countries, Pullīramalaya, etc., are included in the ten, country, etc., and that the goddesses, Prachaṇḍā, etc., of those countries, and the heroines, Kapālāmukhī, etc., are included in one, the aggregate. The nature of that is the body of the yogin.

original: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir gsungs pa /

analyzed: sangs rgyas kun zhes pa la sogs pa ni /

analyzed: phyi rol gyi gnas la sogs par 'gro bar bya ba ma yin pa kho na'o //

original: de rnams kyi khams zad par 'gyur //
analyzed: de rnams kyi khams zad par 'gyur //

original: @33b de phyir phyi rol nges bsal te //
analyzed: @33b de phyir phyi rol nges bsal te //

original: rnal 'byor rol pas gnas par bya //
analyzed: rnal 'byor rol pas gnas par bya //

original: gal te de nyid med gyur na //
analyzed: gal te de nyid med gyur na //

analyzed: de la 'khrul pa ci yang med //

original: yang na de ni de nyid ldan //
analyzed: yang na de ni de nyid ldan //

analyzed: de la 'khrul pa ci yang med //

original: ces so // yang na nang gi bzlas pa dang bsgom pa la sogs ba nus pa dang lha mo'i snang ba thob pa las phyi'i gnas la sogs pa blta bar bya'o zhes phyi'i zhing la sogs pa rnams su spyod pa byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa ni /
analyzed: ces so // yang na nang gi bzlas pa dang bsgom pa la sogs ba nus pa dang lha mo'i snang ba thob pa las phyi'i gnas la sogs pa blta bar bya'o zhes phyi'i zhing la sogs pa rnams su spyod pa byed pa'i rgyur gyur pa ni /
translated: The cause of engaging in the external fields, etc. is

original: nang du yongs su grags pa'o //
analyzed: nang du yongs su grags pa'o //

original: zhes pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa ste /

analyzed: bskor zhing zhes pa gnas la sogs par ro //

analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /

analyzed: rdo rje phag mos 'khyud pa'i dpal bde mchog gi gzugs su dmigs nas h'um yig gi sgra bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The meaning is that one should imagine oneself in the form of glorious Cakrasaṃvara embraced by Vajravārāhī and utter the sound of the syllable hūṃ.

original: de nyid gsungs pa /
analyzed: de nyid gsungs pa /
translated: That is stated:

analyzed: seng ge zhes pa la sogs pa ste ;

analyzed: le'u dgu pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /

translated: Now, in order to respond to the nineteen questions, “What are your twelve activities?” it is said:

analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //

original: de la las bcu gnyis po rnams ni /
analyzed: de la las bcu gnyis po rnams ni /

analyzed: @34a * // dbye ba dang / bskrad pa dang / smyo bar byed pa rnams so //

analyzed: las thams cad zhi ba'i nang du 'dus pa'i phyir dang por zhi ba kho na bstan to //
translated: The pacification of all activities is included in pacification, therefore pacification is taught first.

original: de la 'di ni man ngag ste /
analyzed: de la 'di ni man ngag ste /

analyzed: zhi ba'i las la zhi ba'i sems kyis gtor ma sbyin pa sngon du 'gro zhing /

analyzed: kha shar du phyogs pa'i bde mchog dkar po phyag gnyis pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa ste /

analyzed: gur kum dang tsandan bsres pa dag gis skyes pa zhi ba las so //
translated: For the pacification of a man, one should use saffron and sandalwood mixed together.

original: bud med zhi ba la ni gi wam dang bsres pa'i tsandan gyis te /
analyzed: bud med zhi ba la ni gi wam dang bsres pa'i tsandan gyis te /
translated: For the pacification of a woman, one should use uśīra and sandalwood mixed together.

original: dkar po'i phyogs la dar la sogs pa'am ras gtsang ma la zla ba'i dkyil 'khor gyi steng du rtsibs drug pa'i 'khor lo gnyis zhes pa 'khor lo zur gsum gnyis te /

analyzed: rtsibs brgyad pa la sogs pa'i 'khor lo bzhin no zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say that it is like an eight-spoked wheel, and so on.

original: rdo rje'i phreng bas bskor ba mngon par bris nas shar la sogs pa'i rtsibs drug po rnams la rim pas aom yig la sogs pa drug mgo phyir bstan pa la g-yas skor gyis gcig ste /
analyzed: rdo rje'i phreng bas bskor ba mngon par bris nas shar la sogs pa'i rtsibs drug po rnams la rim pas aom yig la sogs pa drug mgo phyir bstan pa la g-yas skor gyis gcig ste /
translated: Having written the six syllables OṀ, etc., on the six spokes beginning with the east, etc., in order, with their heads turned outward, one should write the second one in the clockwise direction.

original: gnyis pa ni g-yon skor gyis bri bar bya'o //🔽lte par ni phat sv'a h'a che ge mo sh'antim ku ru sv'a h'a zhes pa ste /
analyzed: gnyis pa ni g-yon skor gyis bri bar bya'o // lte par ni phat sv'a h'a che ge mo sh'antim ku ru sv'a h'a zhes pa ste /
translated: The second one should be written in the counterclockwise direction.🔽In the center, one should write PHAṬ SVĀHĀ, and “ŚĀNTAṀ kuru SVĀHĀ” for a woman.

original: bud med zhi ba la na ma: lhas byin sh'antim ku ru na ma: zhes pa'o //
analyzed: bud med zhi ba la na ma: lhas byin sh'antim ku ru na ma: zhes pa'o //
translated: For a man, one should write “ŚĀNTAṀ kuru NAMAḤ.”

original: de nas kha sbyar du byas te /
analyzed: de nas kha sbyar du byas te /
translated: Then, having made a union,

original: de gnyis ka kham phor gsar pa gnyis kyis bsdams pa srad bu dkar pos dkris nas tsandan la sogs pa las byas pa'i mandala gyi steng du bzhag ste /
analyzed: de gnyis ka kham phor gsar pa gnyis kyis bsdams pa srad bu dkar pos dkris nas tsandan la sogs pa las byas pa'i mandala gyi steng du bzhag ste /
translated: one should bind the two with two new clay pots, wrap them with a white thread, and place them on a maṇḍala made of sandalwood, etc.

original: cho ga ji lta ba bzhin ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa sngon du 'gro bas /
analyzed: cho ga ji lta ba bzhin ye shes sems dpa' gzhug pa sngon du 'gro bas /
translated: Having previously caused the entrance of the awareness being in accordance with the rite,

original: me tog dkar po la sogs pa rnams kyis mngon par mchod par bya'o //
analyzed: me tog dkar po la sogs pa rnams kyis mngon par mchod par bya'o //
translated: one should make offerings with white flowers, etc.

original: de nas 'khor lo la dmigs te /
analyzed: de nas 'khor lo la dmigs te /
translated: Then, visualizing the wheel,

original: yi ge bdun pa'i sngags grangs stong la sogs pa bzlas nas /
analyzed: yi ge bdun pa'i sngags grangs stong la sogs pa bzlas nas /
translated: Having recited the seven-syllable mantra one thousand times, etc.,

original: 'khor lo dang bdag nyid kyi bar gyi mdun du bsgrub bya zla ba la gnas pa bltas te /
analyzed: 'khor lo dang bdag nyid kyi bar gyi mdun du bsgrub bya zla ba la gnas pa bltas te /
translated: one should look at the front of the wheel and oneself, and at the one to be accomplished, who is situated on the moon.

original: rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las 'thon pa'i dum skyes ma dkar mo phyag na ye shes kyi bdud rtsi'i chus yongs su gang ba'i shel gyi bum pas /
analyzed: rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las 'thon pa'i dum skyes ma dkar mo phyag na ye shes kyi bdud rtsi'i chus yongs su gang ba'i shel gyi bum pas /
translated: One should imagine that a white Vajravarahi emerges from the seed syllable in one's heart, and with a crystal vase completely filled with the water of the nectar of wisdom,

original: aom sarba ta th'a ga t'a bhi she ka sa ma ya shr'i ye h'um zhes pa'i sngags brjod cing dbang bskur ba'i yid kyis ye shes kyi bdud rtsi'i rgyun rnams kyis bkrus te /
analyzed: aom sarba ta th'a ga t'a bhi she ka sa ma ya shr'i ye h'um zhes pa'i sngags brjod cing dbang bskur ba'i yid kyis ye shes kyi bdud rtsi'i rgyun rnams kyis bkrus te /
translated: one should recite the mantra, Om, all tathāgatas consecrate the water of knowledge, hūṃ, and imagine that one confers empowerment.

original: bshang lam nas sdig pa la sogs pa nag po'i gzugs @34b kyis song bas dag pa shel gyi gzugs ltar grub par bsam par bya'o //
analyzed: bshang lam nas sdig pa la sogs pa nag po'i gzugs @34b kyis song bas dag pa shel gyi gzugs ltar grub par bsam par bya'o //
translated: One should imagine that the stream of the nectar of wisdom washes away the impurities of the one to be accomplished, and that the impurities, such as sins, etc., leave in the form of black substances from the rectum, and that the one to be accomplished becomes pure, like a crystal statue.

original: de nas slar yang yi ge bdun pa'i sngags brjod pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis gsal pa'i bsgrub bya rnam par bsam zhing zhi ba'i sems kyis sngags bzlas par bya'o //
analyzed: de nas slar yang yi ge bdun pa'i sngags brjod pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis gsal pa'i bsgrub bya rnam par bsam zhing zhi ba'i sems kyis sngags bzlas par bya'o //
translated: Then, again, one should imagine the radiant one to be accomplished by the light rays of the utterance of the seven-syllable mantra, and one should recite the mantra with a peaceful mind.

original: de ltar thun gsum du byas te /
analyzed: de ltar thun gsum du byas te /
translated: Thus, one should do this in three sessions,

original: ji srid 'bras bu grub pa'i bar du'o zhes pa'o //
analyzed: ji srid 'bras bu grub pa'i bar du'o zhes pa'o //
translated: until the fruit is accomplished.

original: 'bras bu grub pa na kham phor bsal te rig pa'i tshul gyis bsgrub bya'i mgrin pa la sogs par gdab par bya'o /
analyzed: 'bras bu grub pa na kham phor bsal te rig pa'i tshul gyis bsgrub bya'i mgrin pa la sogs par gdab par bya'o /
translated: When the fruit is accomplished, one should remove the saucer, and one should place it on the throat of the one to be accomplished by the method of the knowledge.

original: yang na ye shes kyi 'khor lo gshegs te chu la sogs pa rnams la bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: yang na ye shes kyi 'khor lo gshegs te chu la sogs pa rnams la bskur bar bya'o //
translated: Or, the wheel of knowledge should be invited and placed on the water, etc.

original: rims la sogs pa zhi ba gsungs pa /
analyzed: rims la sogs pa zhi ba gsungs pa /
translated: The pacification of fever, etc. is stated:

original: rims zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: rims zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: “Fever, etc.”

original: de la nus pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas ji ltar gsungs pa'i 'khor lo kho na lag pa g-yon par rnam par bsgoms te /
analyzed: de la nus pa dang ldan pa'i rnal 'byor pas ji ltar gsungs pa'i 'khor lo kho na lag pa g-yon par rnam par bsgoms te /

translated: Having given the bali, endowed with the yoga of yellow Cakrasaṃvara with two hands, on a charnel ground cloth, with the juice of lac and bovine orpiment, on top of Meru with eight spokes, in the order just explained, clockwise and counterclockwise,
