original: de rnams zhes pa sngags de rnams te nges pa'i rnal 'byor gyis ni ji ltar gsungs pa'i cho gas bsgrubs na nges par dngos grub thob par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
analyzed: de rnams zhes pa sngags de rnams te nges pa'i rnal 'byor gyis ni ji ltar gsungs pa'i cho gas bsgrubs na nges par dngos grub thob par 'gyur zhes pa'o //
translated: Those are those mantras. If one accomplishes them with the yoga of ascertainment, according to the rite as taught, one will certainly attain the powers.

original: le'u bcu gcig pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bcu gcig pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the commentary on the eleventh chapter.

original: // / ji lta bu yi bgrang phreng rigs //
analyzed: // / ji lta bu yi bgrang phreng rigs //
translated: What kind of rosary is suitable?🔽What is the measure of the characteristics of recitation?

original: bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid ji tsam zhig / ces pa zhu ba nyi shu rtsa gcig pa la sogs pa gnyis kyi lan gdab pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid ji tsam zhig / ces pa zhu ba nyi shu rtsa gcig pa la sogs pa gnyis kyi lan gdab pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to answer these twenty-one questions and so forth, it is said:

original: nyon zhes pa la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
analyzed: nyon zhes pa la sogs pa ste go sla'o //
translated: Listen, etc. It is easy to understand.

original: de la gser dang zhes pa la sogs pa mdor bstan pa ste ;
analyzed: de la gser dang zhes pa la sogs pa mdor bstan pa ste ;
translated: There, gold, etc. is the brief teaching.

original: zhi dang rgyas la spyar bar bya //
analyzed: zhi dang rgyas la spyar bar bya //
translated: One should apply it to pacifying and enriching.

original: zhes pa gser dang zangs la sogs pa la byas pas rgyas pa la'o //🔽dngul dang shel dang dung la sogs pa la byas pa zhi ba las te sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa gser dang zangs la sogs pa la byas pas rgyas pa la'o // dngul dang shel dang dung la sogs pa la byas pa zhi ba las te sbyar bar bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: This is for enriching, made of gold, copper, and so on.🔽This is for pacifying, made of silver, crystal, conch, and so on.

original: gur gum la sogs dri la sogs //
analyzed: gur gum la sogs dri la sogs //
translated: One should apply it to the smell of saffron, and so on.🔽One should anoint the form, color, smell, and so on, which is in accordance with the rite.

original: zhes pa las kyi rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs dang kha dog dang dri la sogs pa byug par bya ste sbyar bar bya zhes pa snga mas 'brel lo //
analyzed: zhes pa las kyi rjes su mthun pa'i gzugs dang kha dog dang dri la sogs pa byug par bya ste sbyar bar bya zhes pa snga mas 'brel lo //
translated: One should apply it, as stated by the previous verse.

original: gur gum la sogs pa rnams kyi ril bu nyid do zhes kha cig go //
analyzed: gur gum la sogs pa rnams kyi ril bu nyid do zhes kha cig go //
translated: Some say that it is the very pill of saffron, and so on.

original: rtag tu ril bu lnga bcu'o //
analyzed: rtag tu ril bu lnga bcu'o //
translated: Always fifty pills.

original: zhes pa a'a li k'a li'i rnam par dag pas so //
analyzed: zhes pa a'a li k'a li'i rnam par dag pas so //
translated: This is due to the purity of Īkālikā.

original: de nyid kyi phyir ril bu lnga bcu rnams kyis byas pa'i phreng ba las thams cad pa'i 'a //
analyzed: de nyid kyi phyir ril bu lnga bcu rnams kyis byas pa'i phreng ba las thams cad pa'i 'a //
translated: Therefore, a rosary made of fifty pills is for all rites.

original: drag po'i las la ni ril bu drug cu rnams kyis so //
analyzed: drag po'i las la ni ril bu drug cu rnams kyis so //
translated: For violent rites, it is made of sixty pills.

original: mthe bong lha yi rang bzhin las //
analyzed: mthe bong lha yi rang bzhin las //
translated: The thumb is of the nature of the deity.

original: zhes pa mthe bong lcags kyu lta bus rang bzhin gyi ril bu dgug pa'i phyir /
analyzed: zhes pa mthe bong lcags kyu lta bus rang bzhin gyi ril bu dgug pa'i phyir /
translated: The thumb is like a hook for summoning the natural pill.

original: las rnams kun la sbyar bar bya //🔽mchod 'os ril bu thams cad de//
analyzed: las rnams kun la sbyar bar bya // mchod 'os ril bu thams cad de//
translated: It should be applied to all actions.🔽All the pills of the one worthy of worship

original: zhes pa bzlas pa'i sngags dang lha'i rang bzhin gyi ril bu thams cad do //
analyzed: zhes pa bzlas pa'i sngags dang lha'i rang bzhin gyi ril bu thams cad do //
translated: are the nature of the mantra and deity.

original: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //
analyzed: chos kyi dbyings kyi rang bzhin no //
translated: The nature of the dharmadhatu

original: zhes pa steng gi ril bu chos kyi dbyings mchod rten gyi gzugs so zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa steng gi ril bu chos kyi dbyings mchod rten gyi gzugs so zhes pa'i don to //
translated: means that the upper pill is the form of the stupa of the dharmadhatu.

original: ril bu gzhan yang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du @38b bya'o zhes kha cig tu gsungs so //
analyzed: ril bu gzhan yang stobs dang mi 'jigs pa la sogs pa'i rang bzhin du @38b bya'o zhes kha cig tu gsungs so //
translated: Some say that the other pills should be understood as the nature of power, fearlessness, and so forth.

original: 'di dag gis bgrang phreng gi rab gnas mtshon pa'o //
analyzed: 'di dag gis bgrang phreng gi rab gnas mtshon pa'o //
translated: These illustrate the consecration of the mala.

original: mnyam gzhag ces ba la sogs pa sems brtan par gyur pa de bzhin du bzlas pa dang bsgom pa dag gis bgrang phreng gi ril bu lha'i rang bzhin mthe bong gis dgug cing sngags kyis bod pa'i tshul gyis bzlas par bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
analyzed: mnyam gzhag ces ba la sogs pa sems brtan par gyur pa de bzhin du bzlas pa dang bsgom pa dag gis bgrang phreng gi ril bu lha'i rang bzhin mthe bong gis dgug cing sngags kyis bod pa'i tshul gyis bzlas par bya'o zhes dgongs pa'o //
translated: As for equipoise, and so on, just as the mind becomes stable, in the same way, by means of recitation and meditation, one should recite the mantra by means of the rosary beads, which are the nature of the deity, and by means of the thumb, which is the method of recitation.

original: rdzogs ldan la ni bzlas bya gcig / ces pa sngags gang gis 'bum phrag gcig bzlas par gsungs pa dang / 'bum phrag gnyis la sogs pa yang ste /
analyzed: rdzogs ldan la ni bzlas bya gcig / ces pa sngags gang gis 'bum phrag gcig bzlas par gsungs pa dang / 'bum phrag gnyis la sogs pa yang ste /
translated: As for in the perfect age, one should recite the mantra once, it means that one should recite the mantra for which it is said one hundred thousand times, and also two hundred thousand times, and so on.

original: de nyis 'gyur la sogs pa gzhan rnams la rig par bya'o zhes pa'o //🔽sngags kyi tshul ni bzhi po la //
analyzed: de nyis 'gyur la sogs pa gzhan rnams la rig par bya'o zhes pa'o // sngags kyi tshul ni bzhi po la //
translated: One should know that the others are double that and so on.🔽As for the four modes of the mantra,

original: zhes pa sngags kyi bzlas pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
analyzed: zhes pa sngags kyi bzlas pa rnam pa bzhi'o //
translated: there are four modes of mantra recitation.

original: de dag ston pa /
analyzed: de dag ston pa /
translated: They are taught:

original: ngag gi bzlas pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: ngag gi bzlas pa zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Recitation of the voice, and so on.

original: 'gro dang 'ong ba zhes pa rlung 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang gnas pa zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: 'gro dang 'ong ba zhes pa rlung 'gro ba dang 'ong ba dang gnas pa zhes pa'i don to //
translated: As for coming and going, it means the wind coming and going and abiding.

original: 'di zla ba dang nyi ma dang lam lnga bstan pa'i le'u sngags kyi de kho na'i skabs su shes par bya ste /
analyzed: 'di zla ba dang nyi ma dang lam lnga bstan pa'i le'u sngags kyi de kho na'i skabs su shes par bya ste /
translated: This should be understood in the section on the reality of mantra in the chapter on the moon, sun, and five paths.

original: 'dir skabs su bab pa dag gi bzlas pa'o //
analyzed: 'dir skabs su bab pa dag gi bzlas pa'o //
translated: Here, it is the recitation of those that are relevant to the present context.

original: mtha' gsum las ni rnam grol ba //
analyzed: mtha' gsum las ni rnam grol ba //
translated: Free from the three extremes

original: zhes pa skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa spangs pa'i //
analyzed: zhes pa skye ba dang gnas pa dang 'jig pa spangs pa'i //
translated: means free from arising, enduring, and disintegrating.

original: yang na 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba spangs nas aa wa dh'u t'i la rlung g-yo ba med bar 'gyur ba'o //
analyzed: yang na 'jug pa dang gnas pa dang ldang ba spangs nas aa wa dh'u t'i la rlung g-yo ba med bar 'gyur ba'o //
translated: Or, having abandoned entering, abiding, and rising, the winds become unmoving in the avadhūtī.

original: de dag gis 'di ltar gsungs te /
analyzed: de dag gis 'di ltar gsungs te /
translated: They explain this as follows.

original: sprul pa'i chu skyes kyi snying po la gnas pa'i n'a da las snying po la sogs pa'i bzlas pa'i sngags gang yang rung ba brjod pa na g-yas pa nas 'thon te /
analyzed: sprul pa'i chu skyes kyi snying po la gnas pa'i n'a da las snying po la sogs pa'i bzlas pa'i sngags gang yang rung ba brjod pa na g-yas pa nas 'thon te /
translated: When any of the essence mantras of the heart and so on of the recitation are recited from the nāda that abides in the heart of the emanation lotus, they emerge from the right nostril.

original: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par spros nas 'gro ba'i don bya ste ;
analyzed: dkyil 'khor gyi 'khor lo'i rnam par spros nas 'gro ba'i don bya ste ;
translated: They emanate in the form of the mandala circle and perform the welfare of living beings.

original: g-yon pa nas zhu bar gyur pa rab tu zhugs pa de kho na ltar 'byung ba bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: g-yon pa nas zhu bar gyur pa rab tu zhugs pa de kho na ltar 'byung ba bsgom par bya ste /
translated: They enter from the left nostril and are meditated as emerging in the same way.

original: brtan par gyur na sngags kyi dngos grub thob bo //
analyzed: brtan par gyur na sngags kyi dngos grub thob bo //
translated: When one is firm, one attains the power of mantra.

original: de dag nyid nye bar sdud pa 'di rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'di dag kho nas sngags bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid dang cho ga yang nges par brjod pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: de dag nyid nye bar sdud pa 'di rnams zhes pa la sogs pa ste 'di dag kho nas sngags bzlas pa'i mtshan nyid dang cho ga yang nges par brjod pa'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: These very ones are summarized in “these” and so forth. The meaning is that the characteristics and rites of mantra recitation are also stated by these alone.

original: le'u bcu gnyis pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
analyzed: le'u bcu gnyis pa'i rnam par bshad pa'o /
translated: This is the explanation of chapter twelve.

original: // / lha yi rnam pa'i rnal 'byor pas //
analyzed: // / lha yi rnam pa'i rnal 'byor pas //
translated: The yogi/nī in the form of the deity🔽how much does one circle the maṇḍala?

original: dkyil 'khor bskor ba ji tsam zhig / ces pa zhu ba nyi shu rtsa gsum pa'i lan gdab pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: dkyil 'khor bskor ba ji tsam zhig / ces pa zhu ba nyi shu rtsa gsum pa'i lan gdab pa'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to respond to the twenty-third question, [the Bhagavān] declares,

original: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o //🔽de la 'di ni @39a * //
analyzed: de nas zhes pa la sogs pa'o // de la 'di ni @39a * //
translated: “Then, the Bhagavān” and so forth.🔽Therein,

original: bsgom pa'i rim pa ste /
analyzed: bsgom pa'i rim pa ste /
translated: this is the sequence of meditation.

original: dang por re zhig sems can thams cad dpal bde mchog 'byung ba'i go 'phang thob bar bya ba'i phyir dpal bde mchog tu 'gyur bar bya'o zhes byang chub kyi sems bskyed nas skad cig gis stong ba nyid mngon du byas te /
analyzed: dang por re zhig sems can thams cad dpal bde mchog 'byung ba'i go 'phang thob bar bya ba'i phyir dpal bde mchog tu 'gyur bar bya'o zhes byang chub kyi sems bskyed nas skad cig gis stong ba nyid mngon du byas te /
translated: First, in order to cause all sentient beings to attain the state of Śrī Heruka, one should generate the mind of enlightenment, thinking, “I will become Śrī Heruka.” Then, in an instant, one should actualize emptiness.

original: shes rab dang bcas pa'i bde mchog phyag gnyis pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la ji lta ba bzhin rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa mos par byas nas g-yon pa'i sdigs mdzub kyis se gol byed🔽pa dang dus mnyam du shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams su g-yon skor gyis sumbha la sogs pa'i sngags bzhi las yang dag par byung ba'i sngon po dang ljang khu dang dmar po dang ser po bzhi dang de dang dus mnyam pa kho nar 'og tu h'um las
analyzed: shes rab dang bcas pa'i bde mchog phyag gnyis pa'i rnal 'byor dang ldan pa'i phung po dang khams dang skye mched rnams la ji lta ba bzhin rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa'i rnam par dag pa mos par byas nas g-yon pa'i sdigs mdzub kyis se gol byed pa dang dus mnyam du shar la sogs pa'i phyogs rnams su g-yon skor gyis sumbha la sogs pa'i sngags bzhi las yang dag par byung ba'i sngon po dang ljang khu dang dmar po dang ser po bzhi dang de dang dus mnyam pa kho nar 'og tu h'um las
translated: Endowed with the yoga of two-armed Cakrasaṃvara with wisdom, one should imagine that the aggregates, constituents, and sense bases are totally purified as Vairocana and so forth.🔽At the same time as snapping one’s left-side fingers, one should imagine that the four mantras such as sum bha ra arise from the four directions such as east in a counterclockwise direction, and the four colors blue, green, red, and yellow arise from those mantras.

original: skyes pa'i sa gzhi sna tshogs rdo rje'i rang bzhin dang / steng du de'i 'od zer 'phros pa las rdo rje'i mda'i dra ba dang / rdo rje'i gur dang bla re rnams rnam par bsams te /
analyzed: skyes pa'i sa gzhi sna tshogs rdo rje'i rang bzhin dang / steng du de'i 'od zer 'phros pa las rdo rje'i mda'i dra ba dang / rdo rje'i gur dang bla re rnams rnam par bsams te /
translated: At the same time, one should imagine that the ground below arises from hūṃ and is the nature of a vajra cross and that above, a net of vajra arrows and a canopy of vajras arise from the light rays.

original: rang gi snying gar pam ser po las skyes pa'i sna tshogs padma'i steng du /
analyzed: rang gi snying gar pam ser po las skyes pa'i sna tshogs padma'i steng du /
translated: In one's heart is a yellow pam, from which arises a variegated lotus.

original: aom yig las skyes pa'i zla ba la h'um sngon po las skyes pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sku 'khor dang bcas pa mdun du yang dag par bkug nas phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro ba can rang gi snying ga'i sa bon
analyzed: aom yig las skyes pa'i zla ba la h'um sngon po las skyes pa'i 'od zer rnams kyis bcom ldan 'das 'chad par 'gyur ba'i sku 'khor dang bcas pa mdun du yang dag par bkug nas phyag 'tshal ba sngon du 'gro ba can rang gi snying ga'i sa bon
translated: On that, from an om arises a moon, on which is a blue hum, from which arises light rays, which invite the Bhagavat's body, with its retinue, which will be explained, in front.

original: las 'thon pa'i mchod pa'i lha mo me tog ma la sogs pa rnams kyis yang dag bar mchod de /
analyzed: las 'thon pa'i mchod pa'i lha mo me tog ma la sogs pa rnams kyis yang dag bar mchod de /
translated: Having made prostrations, one should make offerings with the offering goddesses such as the flower goddess, who emerge from the seed syllable in one's heart.

original: bzod gsol zhes pa sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya'o //
analyzed: bzod gsol zhes pa sdig pa bshags pa la sogs pa bya'o //
translated: One should request forbearance, confess sins, and so on.

original: de nas dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa btang snyoms kyi mthar thug pa rnam par bsgom par bya'o zhes pa bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
analyzed: de nas dkon mchog gsum la skyabs su 'gro ba la sogs pa btang snyoms kyi mthar thug pa rnam par bsgom par bya'o zhes pa bsod nams kyi tshogs so //
translated: Then, one should meditate on going for refuge to the Three Jewels and so on up to equanimity. This is the accumulation of merit.

original: sems can gzhan btang snyoms so zhes pa sems can gzhan rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba'i gnas su gyur pa rnams la btang snyoms su thams cad la sems snyoms pa nyid ni btang snyoms zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: sems can gzhan btang snyoms so zhes pa sems can gzhan rjes su chags pa dang khong khro ba'i gnas su gyur pa rnams la btang snyoms su thams cad la sems snyoms pa nyid ni btang snyoms zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The line I am indifferent to other sentient beings means that one is indifferent to other sentient beings who are the objects of attachment and anger. The meaning of equanimity is the sameness of mind toward all.

original: de nas ye shes kyi tshogs kyi phyir /
analyzed: de nas ye shes kyi tshogs kyi phyir /
translated: Then, for the sake of the accumulation of wisdom,

original: aom sva bh'a ba zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyi don sngon du bya'o //
analyzed: aom sva bh'a ba zhes pa la sogs pa'i sngags kyi don sngon du bya'o //
translated: one should perform the meaning of the mantra oṃ svabhāva.

original: de la aom zhes pa khas blangs pa'o //
analyzed: de la aom zhes pa khas blangs pa'o //
translated: There, oṃ is the assertion.

original: sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharm'a: zhes pa rang @39b bzhin kho na las sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyis dag pa'i gzung ba rnams so //🔽sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham /
analyzed: sva bh'a ba shuddha: sarba dharm'a: zhes pa rang @39b bzhin kho na las sgyu ma lta bu nyid kyis dag pa'i gzung ba rnams so // sva bh'a ba shuddho& ham /
translated: Svabhāva śuddhāḥ sarvadharmāḥ means that the objects of perception are pure by way of their own nature, which is like an illusion.

original: zhes pa chos rnams thams cad ji lta ba de ltar bdag ces pa'o //
analyzed: zhes pa chos rnams thams cad ji lta ba de ltar bdag ces pa'o //
translated: Svabhāva śuddho 'haṃ means that all phenomena are like that, and so am I.

original: 'di dag gi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dag pa gsungs te /
analyzed: 'di dag gi gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dag pa gsungs te /
translated: The purity of the object of perception and the subject of perception is stated here.

original: snang pa dang bcas pa'i stong pa nyid kyang 'di'o //
analyzed: snang pa dang bcas pa'i stong pa nyid kyang 'di'o //
translated: This is also the emptiness that possesses appearance.

original: de'i phyir / sems tsam la ni rnam gnas bya //
analyzed: de'i phyir / sems tsam la ni rnam gnas bya //
translated: one should abide in mind-only.

original: zhes pa dam pa'i don gyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po rnam par spangs pa'i phyir 'di dag sems tsam kho na'o //
analyzed: zhes pa dam pa'i don gyis gzung ba dang 'dzin pa'i dngos po rnam par spangs pa'i phyir 'di dag sems tsam kho na'o //
translated: Because of the ultimate meaning, these are mind-only, since they are devoid of the entities of grasped and grasper.

original: de yang / aom a'a: h'um zhes pa yi ge gsum gyi rang bzhin steng nas steng du gnas pa'o //
analyzed: de yang / aom a'a: h'um zhes pa yi ge gsum gyi rang bzhin steng nas steng du gnas pa'o //
translated: Moreover, that is the nature of the three syllables, om, ah, hum, existing one above the other.

original: bdag nyid 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin rtogs par bya ste /
analyzed: bdag nyid 'di lta bu'i rang bzhin rtogs par bya ste /
translated: One should realize one's own nature in this way.

original: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i dbang gis bdag nyid de lta bu'i rang bzhin du ma mthong ba 'khor ba na 'khor ba dmus long lta bu'o //
analyzed: kye ma sems can 'di dag ni thog ma med pa'i ma rig pa'i dbang gis bdag nyid de lta bu'i rang bzhin du ma mthong ba 'khor ba na 'khor ba dmus long lta bu'o //
translated: Alas, these sentient beings, by the power of beginningless ignorance, not seeing their own nature in that way, wander in cyclic existence like the blind.🔽Therefore, I will cause them to realize their own nature individually.

original: de'i phyir bdag gis de rnams la rang gi tshul so sor rtogs par bya'o zhes chos la dmigs pa'i snying rje bskyed nas /
analyzed: de'i phyir bdag gis de rnams la rang gi tshul so sor rtogs par bya'o zhes chos la dmigs pa'i snying rje bskyed nas /
translated: Having generated compassion that focuses on phenomena in this way,

original: de rnams kyi phyir 'khor lo gsum rnam par spros te 'gro ba 'khor lo gsum du byas nas bde ba chen pos zhu bar byas te de nyid la gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: de rnams kyi phyir 'khor lo gsum rnam par spros te 'gro ba 'khor lo gsum du byas nas bde ba chen pos zhu bar byas te de nyid la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: For their sake, the three wheels are elaborated, and the world is made into the three wheels, and is caused to melt by great bliss, and is caused to enter into that.

original: de nas aom yig a'a: yig la'o //
analyzed: de nas aom yig a'a: yig la'o //
translated: Then the letter Oṃ is in the letter Aḥ.

original: a'a: yig h'um yig la'o //
analyzed: a'a: yig h'um yig la'o //
translated: The letter Aḥ is in the letter Hūṃ.

original: de yang a'u dang ha dang mgo dang zla ba phyed pa dang thig le'i rim pas n'a da la gzhug bar bya'o //
analyzed: de yang a'u dang ha dang mgo dang zla ba phyed pa dang thig le'i rim pas n'a da la gzhug bar bya'o //
translated: That also is caused to enter into the nāda by the sequence of the letter Au, the letter Ha, the head, the half-moon, and the drop.

original: de nas n'a da'i gzugs nyid kyis gnas te /
analyzed: de nas n'a da'i gzugs nyid kyis gnas te /
translated: Then, in the form of the nāda, one abides.

original: 'di lta bu bzhin du chos thams cad kyi de kho na bdag gis mngon sum du byas nas sems can thams cad la'ang rtogs par bya'o zhes pa dmigs pa med pa mngon du bya zhing /
analyzed: 'di lta bu bzhin du chos thams cad kyi de kho na bdag gis mngon sum du byas nas sems can thams cad la'ang rtogs par bya'o zhes pa dmigs pa med pa mngon du bya zhing /
translated: Thus, having actualized the reality of all phenomena, one should realize it in all sentient beings, and one should actualize the absence of an objective reference.

original: n'a da tsam gyi rnam par rtog pa yang dor bar bya'o //
analyzed: n'a da tsam gyi rnam par rtog pa yang dor bar bya'o //
translated: One should also abandon the conception of the mere nāda.

original: de dag nyid gsungs pa /🔽byang chub tshogs ni bsgom rnams kyis //
analyzed: de dag nyid gsungs pa / byang chub tshogs ni bsgom rnams kyis //
translated: They themselves are stated:🔽The accumulations of enlightenment are cultivated

original: zhes pa ste ye shes kyi tshogs bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: zhes pa ste ye shes kyi tshogs bsgom par bya'o zhes pa'i don to //
translated: by those who cultivate the accumulation of intuition.

original: brtan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
analyzed: brtan par bya ba'i phyir gsungs pa /
translated: In order to stabilize, he says:

original: aom zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: aom zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: Oṃ and so forth.

original: stong pa nyid la zhugs pa'i sngon gyi smon lam gyi nus pa las ldang ba'i rim pa gsungs pa /
analyzed: stong pa nyid la zhugs pa'i sngon gyi smon lam gyi nus pa las ldang ba'i rim pa gsungs pa /
translated: The stage of rising from the power of the previous aspiration that entered emptiness is stated:

original: rten dang brten pa la sogs pa ste brten pa'i steng du bhee ram pa sogs zhes pa'i don to //
analyzed: rten dang brten pa la sogs pa ste brten pa'i steng du bhee ram pa sogs zhes pa'i don to //
translated: The support, the supported, and so forth. The meaning of “supported” is “on top of bheḍa and so forth.”

original: bhee ram pa sogs rnams bsam bya //
analyzed: bhee ram pa sogs rnams bsam bya //
translated: Bheḍa and so forth should be imagined.

original: zhes pa bhee ram pa zhes bya ba'i rlung de gang gi thog ma yin pa de bzhin du de'o//
analyzed: zhes pa bhee ram pa zhes bya ba'i rlung de gang gi thog ma yin pa de bzhin du de'o//
translated: The meaning of “bheḍa and so forth” is that wind that is at the beginning of bheḍa and so forth.

original: @40a * // de dag ston pa /
analyzed: @40a * // de dag ston pa /
translated: He teaches those:

original: yam zhes pa la sogs pas brgyan pa'i bar de go sla'o //
analyzed: yam zhes pa la sogs pas brgyan pa'i bar de go sla'o //
translated: Up to “adorned with yaṃ and so forth” is easy to understand.

original: de steng padma lte ba dang // ge sar ldan pa bsgom par bya //
analyzed: de steng padma lte ba dang // ge sar ldan pa bsgom par bya //
translated: On top of that, one should meditate on the center of a lotus with a pistil.

original: zhes pa de'i steng du tshig las sngon du shes par bya'o //
analyzed: zhes pa de'i steng du tshig las sngon du shes par bya'o //
translated: On top of that, the words should be understood as before.

original: de dbus rnal 'byor bsgom par bya //
analyzed: de dbus rnal 'byor bsgom par bya //
translated: In the center of that, one should meditate on the yogin.

original: zhes pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro ;
analyzed: zhes pa zla ba'i dkyil 'khor ro ;
translated: The moon maṇḍala.

original: / a'a li k'a li'i rnam dag las //
analyzed: / a'a li k'a li'i rnam dag las //
translated: From the purity of ālikāli,

original: zhes pa a'a li k'a li yongs su gyur pa ste /
analyzed: zhes pa a'a li k'a li yongs su gyur pa ste /
translated: This is the complete transformation of the vowels and consonants.

original: 'dir ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa rnal 'byor du rnam par gzhag go //
analyzed: 'dir ni zla ba'i dkyil 'khor bskyed pa rnal 'byor du rnam par gzhag go //
translated: Here, the generation of the moon mandala is considered to be the yoga.

original: de'i zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
analyzed: de'i zhes pa la sogs pa ni go sla'o //
translated: The words thereupon and so forth are easy to understand.

original: thod pa'i phreng bas brgyan pa'i thod //
analyzed: thod pa'i phreng bas brgyan pa'i thod //
translated: The skull is adorned with a garland of skulls.

original: ces pa zhal so so la de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can thod pa lnga dang ldan pa nyid las so //
analyzed: ces pa zhal so so la de bzhin gshegs pa lnga'i bdag nyid can thod pa lnga dang ldan pa nyid las so //
translated: This means that each face has five skulls, which are the nature of the five Tathagatas.

original: dgong bya zhes pa bsgom par bya ste /
analyzed: dgong bya zhes pa bsgom par bya ste /
translated: The word contemplate means to meditate.

original: padma'i phyogs gnas la zhes pa phyogs kyi 'dab ma rnams la'o //
analyzed: padma'i phyogs gnas la zhes pa phyogs kyi 'dab ma rnams la'o //
translated: The words on the lotus petals in the directions means on the petals in the directions.

original: gal te yang gshin rje 'joms ma'i mthar thug ba 'di dag bcom ldan 'das rdzogs pa dang dus mnyam ba kho nar rdzogs pa de lta na yang rnam par rtog pa'i bsgom pa gcig gi tshe yul du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir rim bas gsungs te /
analyzed: gal te yang gshin rje 'joms ma'i mthar thug ba 'di dag bcom ldan 'das rdzogs pa dang dus mnyam ba kho nar rdzogs pa de lta na yang rnam par rtog pa'i bsgom pa gcig gi tshe yul du bya bar mi nus pa'i phyir rim bas gsungs te /
translated: Even though these deities, up to and including Yamantaka, are completed at the same time as the completion of the Bhagavat, still, because they cannot be taken as objects of meditation at one time, they are taught in sequence.

original: phyag dang zhal la sogs pa'i rim pas gsungs pa bzhin no //
analyzed: phyag dang zhal la sogs pa'i rim pas gsungs pa bzhin no //
translated: This is like the teaching of the sequence of faces, arms, and so forth.

original: de nas rnam pa thams cad rdzogs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kar ye shes sems dpa' dang de'i thugs kar ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' yang rnam par bsgoms nas /
analyzed: de nas rnam pa thams cad rdzogs pa'i bcom ldan 'das kyi thugs kar ye shes sems dpa' dang de'i thugs kar ting nge 'dzin sems dpa' yang rnam par bsgoms nas /
translated: Then, having visualized the gnosis being in the heart of the Bhagavat who is complete in all aspects, and the concentration being in his heart,🔽one should consecrate with:

original: aom a'a: h'um aom sarba b'i ra yo gi n'i n'am k'a ya b'aka tsitta badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
analyzed: aom a'a: h'um aom sarba b'i ra yo gi n'i n'am k'a ya b'aka tsitta badzra sva bh'a ba a'atma ko& ham /
translated: om aḥ hūṃ om sarva-pāramitā-yoga-nām kāya-vāk-citta-vajra-svabhāva-atmako 'ham

original: aom badzra shuddh'a: sarba dharm'a badzra shuddho& ham /
analyzed: aom badzra shuddh'a: sarba dharm'a badzra shuddho& ham /
translated: om vajra-śuddhaḥ sarva-dharmā vajra-śuddho 'ham

original: zhes pas byin gyis brlab cing mig la sogs pa drug po rnams la gti mug rdo rje la sogs pa drug dang / sa la sogs pa rnams la ltung byed ma la sogs pa dang / gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa rnams la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnam par bsgom ste /
analyzed: zhes pas byin gyis brlab cing mig la sogs pa drug po rnams la gti mug rdo rje la sogs pa drug dang / sa la sogs pa rnams la ltung byed ma la sogs pa dang / gzugs kyi phung po la sogs pa rnams la rnam par snang mdzad la sogs pa rnam par bsgom ste /
translated: and visualize the six, such as Mohavajra, in the six, such as the eyes, and so on, Pāpīmatī, and so on, in the six, such as the earth, and so on, and Vairocana, and so on, in the six, such as the aggregate of form, and so on.

original: bcom ldan 'das dang bcom ldan 'das ma dag la go cha gnyis bya ste /
analyzed: bcom ldan 'das dang bcom ldan 'das ma dag la go cha gnyis bya ste /
translated: One should don the two armors with regard to the Bhagavat and the Bhagavatī.

original: gcig ni aom ha zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gcig ni aom ha zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: One is with om ha, and so on.

original: gnyis pa ni aom pam zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
analyzed: gnyis pa ni aom pam zhes pa la sogs pa'o //
translated: The second is “oṃ phem” and so forth.

original: spyi bo la sogs pa'i gnas rnams su rtsibs stong pa'i 'khor lo'i gzugs nyi shu rtsa bzhir nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor rnams la /
analyzed: spyi bo la sogs pa'i gnas rnams su rtsibs stong pa'i 'khor lo'i gzugs nyi shu rtsa bzhir nyi ma'i dkyil 'khor rnams la /
translated: In the places of the crown and so forth, the twenty-four suns on the forms of the thousand-spoked wheels

original: p'u dza la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams kyang zhes kha cig @40b go ;
analyzed: p'u dza la sogs pa'i yi ge rnams kyang zhes kha cig @40b go ;
translated: are the syllables pūja and so forth.

original: / de'i rjes la padma dang rdo rje'i 'du byed sngon du 'gro ba'i shin tu dga' ba brtsam zhing rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer rnams dang / 'bar ba'i phyag rgya dang pheem yig gis kyang ye shes kyi 'khor lo spyan drangs te /
analyzed: / de'i rjes la padma dang rdo rje'i 'du byed sngon du 'gro ba'i shin tu dga' ba brtsam zhing rang gi snying ga'i sa bon gyi 'od zer rnams dang / 'bar ba'i phyag rgya dang pheem yig gis kyang ye shes kyi 'khor lo spyan drangs te /
translated: After that, one should begin the practice of the utterly joyful one, preceded by the lotus and vajra yoga, and the light rays of the seed syllable in one’s heart and the blazing mudra and the syllable pheṃ invoke the awareness wheel.

original: dza: h'um bam ho: zhes pa'i sngags rnams kyis dgug pa la sogs pa byas nas pad skor sngon du 'gro ba'i 'khyud pa'i phyag rgyas mnyes par bya ste /
analyzed: dza: h'um bam ho: zhes pa'i sngags rnams kyis dgug pa la sogs pa byas nas pad skor sngon du 'gro ba'i 'khyud pa'i phyag rgyas mnyes par bya ste /
translated: Having done the summoning and so forth with the mantras “jaḥ hūṃ vaṃ hoḥ,” one should please the awareness beings with the embrace mudra, preceded by the lotus roll.

original: sngar bzhin sngags gsum gyis byin gyis brlab cing ye shes kyi 'khor lo dang lhan cig byon pa'i dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams kyis bdag nyid la dbang bskur bar bya'o //
analyzed: sngar bzhin sngags gsum gyis byin gyis brlab cing ye shes kyi 'khor lo dang lhan cig byon pa'i dpa' bo dang dpa' mo'i dbang phyug ma rnams kyis bdag nyid la dbang bskur bar bya'o //
translated: As before, one should consecrate with the three syllables, and the hero and heroine lords who have come together with the wheel of wisdom should confer initiation upon oneself.

original: dbang bskur pa'i de ma thag bcom ldan 'das dang bcom ldan 'das ma dag gi spyi bor mi bskyod pa dang rnam par snang mdzad dag go //
analyzed: dbang bskur pa'i de ma thag bcom ldan 'das dang bcom ldan 'das ma dag gi spyi bor mi bskyod pa dang rnam par snang mdzad dag go //
translated: Immediately after the initiation, one should visualize Akṣobhya and Vairocana on the heads of the Lord and Lady.

original: mkha' 'gro ma dang l'a ma dang dum skyes ma dang gzugs can rnams kyi spyi bor rim pa ji lta bar rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dad ;
analyzed: mkha' 'gro ma dang l'a ma dang dum skyes ma dang gzugs can rnams kyi spyi bor rim pa ji lta bar rnam par snang mdzad dang / rin chen 'byung ldan dad ;
translated: On the heads of the dakini, Lāmā, Khaṇḍarohā, and Rūpiṇī, one should visualize, respectively, Vairocana, Ratnasaṃbhava,

original: snang ba mtha' yas dang / don yod grub pa rnams so //
analyzed: snang ba mtha' yas dang / don yod grub pa rnams so //
translated: Amitābha, and Amoghasiddhi.

original: khva gdong ma la sogs pa rnams kyi don yod grub pa nyid de rgyas gdab pa sngon du 'gro ba'i rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las 'thon pa'i mchod pa'i lha mo rnams kyis mchod cing bstod nas lha mo ro mas drangs pa'i ro myangs te rim gyis
analyzed: khva gdong ma la sogs pa rnams kyi don yod grub pa nyid de rgyas gdab pa sngon du 'gro ba'i rang gi snying ga'i sa bon las 'thon pa'i mchod pa'i lha mo rnams kyis mchod cing bstod nas lha mo ro mas drangs pa'i ro myangs te rim gyis
translated: The meaning of the Kākāsyā and so forth is Amoghasiddhi, who is worshipped and praised by offering goddesses who emerge from the seed syllable in one’s heart, preceded by the sealing.

original: 'od gsal la gzhug par bya'o //
analyzed: 'od gsal la gzhug par bya'o //
translated: Then, having tasted the elixir drawn by the goddess Rasā, one should enter into clear light in stages.

original: de la 'di ni rim pa ste /
analyzed: de la 'di ni rim pa ste /
translated: The process is as follows:

original: ye shes sems dpa' yab yum gyi dga' ba'i sgras yang dag par bkug pa'i 'gro ba dur khrod la'o //
analyzed: ye shes sems dpa' yab yum gyi dga' ba'i sgras yang dag par bkug pa'i 'gro ba dur khrod la'o //
translated: The sound of the joy of the father and mother gnosis beings summons migrating beings to the charnel ground.

original: dur khrod dam tshig gi 'khor lo la'o //
analyzed: dur khrod dam tshig gi 'khor lo la'o //
translated: The charnel ground is the commitment wheel.

original: de mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams la'o //
analyzed: de mkha' 'gro ma la sogs pa rnams la'o //
translated: That is the ḍākinī and so forth.

original: de rnams bcom ldan 'das dang bcom ldan 'das ma dag kho na la'o //
analyzed: de rnams bcom ldan 'das dang bcom ldan 'das ma dag kho na la'o //
translated: They are the Bhagavān and Bhagavatī.

original: de dag kyang rim gyis 'od gsal la bcug ste de nas 'od gsal la gnas pa dang ldang ba dang 'jug pa'o //
analyzed: de dag kyang rim gyis 'od gsal la bcug ste de nas 'od gsal la gnas pa dang ldang ba dang 'jug pa'o //
translated: They also enter into clear light in stages. Then one abides in clear light, rises from it, and enters it.

original: skyo bar gyur na sngags kyi le'ur gsungs pa'i cho gas sngags bzlas te /
analyzed: skyo bar gyur na sngags kyi le'ur gsungs pa'i cho gas sngags bzlas te /
translated: When one becomes weary, one should recite the mantra according to the rite taught in the “Mantra Chapter.”

original: ldang bar 'dod na ji ltar bya zhe na gsungs pa /
analyzed: ldang bar 'dod na ji ltar bya zhe na gsungs pa /
translated: If one wishes to rise, how should one act?🔽It is said:

original: chos dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
analyzed: chos dang zhes pa la sogs pa ste /
translated: The Dharma, etc.
